Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I found the people to be professional yet warm and friendly. So many places professionalism becomes stiff and cool. They had a more relaxed vibe about them. Would have preferred a bar/appetizers area to sit and meet others or just relax without going to room, apart from the restaurant.. However, know that space is a problem there. Our room was very clean and smelled good. Loved the roomey bathroom. No views here really but easy walk to anything you might need. It was great because if we had a hour to so to kill between tours or such, we'd walk to the wharf and look around. Got our barings real fast from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel right near Pier 39”
Reviews.Author: becksscott
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice and the front desk staff couldn't do enough to help you. On arrival we were upgraded to a King size room and were provided with coupons for complimentary breakfast at Cafe Pescatore which is attached to the hotel. The breakfasts were lovely by the way, as was the food at Cafe Pescatore when we ate there one night. The hotel is ideally situated about a block from Pier 39 and very near to Pier that the Alcatraz cruises go from. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Return visitor”
Reviews.Author: aussiesmithfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 years ago and returned again for 4 nights in october. It is still a lovely hotel near fishermans wharf but far enough from the crowds. The room was nice but we had requested to be near our travelling friends and they could not accomodate us even though we had made a request in May when we booked online at expedia. We were told we should have contacted the hotel direct! Car parking at the hotel was expensive but so was the carparks in the area so no win! The resaurant Pescatore is still very nice and on a Mon or Tue night you can take one bottle of win if they do not have it on their wine list and there is no corkage. The happy hour wine selection could have been better. There were a few half full glasses left!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in wonderful location - recommend!”
Reviews.Author: snap802
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a wonderful 4 night stay at the Tuscan Inn. I would recommend this hotel to friends who where traveling to San Francisco. The location was 2-3 blocks from just about everything. We had Muni passes while we were there, and there is a bus stop across the street, the F streetcar is 1 block, and both "turnarounds" for the cable cars are about 2 and 1/2 blocks. Because the Inn is not right on the waterfront, the crowds that swarm the waterfront are absent. There are 2 groceries (Safeway and Trader Joe's) within 1 block, plus a Walgreens. Great location! The staff was very helpful and always friendly. Every time I saw a staff member they greeted me happily. Perks: Coffee and tea service every morning in the lobby, Wine reception every evening (5-6pm) in the lobby. Free Wi-fi. They also have a conservation program where if you put a sign on your door by a certain time (declining room servicing the next day), then you can pick up a $5 voucher to the restaurant next door. Additionally, we got a promotion by booking online and got a $25 Shell gas card at check out. Mini-fridge in room (stocked with pay as you go items) but the staff invited us to remove those and use as we see fit, careful to instruct us to leave their items "in plain view" so we wouldn't accidentally be charged for things we didn't consume. The room: We had a standard room, King. The decor was nice, the room well cared for and clean. Small room, but plenty of space. Our room faced the inner courtyard (which we requested, as we had read complaints of noise in street facing rooms). The bed was obviously not new, but we slept well. Plenty of pillows. The hot water was fast and it was HOT! The only odd thing was the apparently ADA-compliant door between the shower/toilet and the sink/closet area. It was gigantic and got in the way if we were both trying to get ready at the same time. A wheelchair wouldn't have fit between the main door and the bed, so the gigantic bathroom door was a puzzle. All in all - glad we stayed here. If you compare prices, you will see that this hotel is one of the very best values in the area, and the location and staff made our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: gafarmgirl623
Reviews.Content: When three friends and I visited San Francisco recently, we chose the Tuscan Inn after deciding to stay at Fisherman's Wharf as opposed to downtown. When we arrived, we were greeted by friendly, eager staff. We found our room to be very attractive and modern with comfortable beds. We only got to take advantage of the wine reception one night but thought it was a nice touch - would have liked for it to be a little later. The only bad experience was getting a taxi one evening. The person at the desk told us he would get us a taxi. The actual bellhop who was to take care of this first offered us a limousine sitting out front for which we would have paid $20 to go to the ferry building - not far at all. Then another car - not marked as a taxi - pulled up. We were not keen on getting in this car, wanting something that looked a bit more official. The bellhop seemed to get exasperated with us and walked off. He did come back later, but we were the ones who actually secured the taxi a bit later. (We hated the taxis in San Francisco, knowing we were ripped off on two occasions.) We only ate at the restaurant there one time - for breakfast - but it was very good. We were able to walk anywhere in the wharf area and always felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location while at fleet week”
Reviews.Author: Jan196218
Reviews.Content: great staff, complimentary wine reception every evening. really enjoyed our stay here. restaurant was really nice

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our recent stay in San Francisco. The staff could not seem to do enough for us. Friendly, accommodating, helpful seem to be the qualifications needed for employment. The rooms are small, but adequate, and clean. Upon arrival,we were given cards for complimentary continental breakfast for each day of our stay, plus there is a daily complimentary wine reception in the evenings. I would certainly stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location,”
Reviews.Author: anujaustin
Reviews.Content: Great location, but noisy, A/C sounded like generators for room 156.( self had to swith it off to sleep well ) Reception staff was cold, self was awaken by maintenace staff while i was sleeping, he says self had requested for repair. I was in deep sleep, so did not bother to argue. Raised the complaint to front desk while i was leaving, but response was cold. They said they are not aware of that, that means any body can just barge in to your room with out front desk even knowing it. They said they can find it out, self told them i have no time to wait. Then the reply from front desk staff was that if you cant wait then i have nothing to do. I repeat, front desk staff need to behave with more manners. Especially if they sent somebody for maintenance when the room is occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Ok rooms, great service.”
Reviews.Author: LovingTravel17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights at the end of our California honeymoon. The hotel's location is convenient, but in a very touristy area. When we checked in, it was (unbeknownst to us) Fleet Week but the staff was quick and helpful. The Hollywood Cafe just down the street is great for breakfast. The daily wine tasting is good and they pour nice big glasses. The rooms were adequate (pretty small, as described in many reviews, but clean, which is important). We had an inner view which was a quieter room but we seemed to look onto someone's apartment so our shutters were closed the whole time. The interactions we had with various staff were very good. The concierge Jackie was excellent and gave a lot of helpful advice. We also had to ask for help with various issues (smoke detector, extra hangers, fridge, and thermostat), and the staff was quick to respond and helpful. The hotel wasn't cheap, but seems to be on par with San Francisco prices. Overall, great: staff/service, location, daily wine tasting, Jackie the concierge. Adequate: room itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for this walkable city but...”
Reviews.Author: skeeterplustbone
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located 2 blocks back from the wharf. It's a short walk to many restaurants. I was surprised by the lack of continental breakfast as we've always had this amenity at other Best Westerns- that was a huge minus for us but they do offer a wine reception 5-6 pm. Great- unless you are out sightseeing or on a tour.The staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms are adequate and quiet. There are mini bars in the rooms but the hotel has removed the vending machines (haven't removed the SIGNS for them however) I was told to go to the 7-11. I would not recommend this hotel. The value was just not there for us. Sorry Best Western- I hope you haven't lost my loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced for minimal value.”
Reviews.Author: IndyNana
Reviews.Content: One plus -- GREAT LOCATION, but too many minuses for this property to be of value to us. We participated in the FLEET WEEK activities, my husband is a WWII veteran and had spent a considerable amount of time in SFO during the war, but this was my first visit and I was very excited, but quickly became disenchanted. Our room, the size of a broom closet was on the first floor and our view was a blank wall. It was almost like a garden apartment. We asked to be moved to a higher room but were told nothing else was availble. A $299/night view of a wall was very upsetting. Not at all what what I had expected In addition to the high room rate, we were also billed $44/night for parking. Which probably should have been $42, but the amount had been crossed out in been and $44 written in. I assumed they were penalizing FLEET WEEK guests. We couldn't get the thermostat in our room to function properly, it was very complicated, so the first night we were very cold and unable to get anything but cold air blowing. The first morning we woke up, we were in a hurry to get to the dock to cruise on the Jeremiah O'Brien. Didn't have much time but when I went to dry my hair, I could not locate a dryer. I called housekeeping and got voicemail, so I called the front desk and they told me they would get a hair dryer to me as quickly as possible. They did, it only took about 15 minutes, but I shouldn't have had to ask for one. Before we left we asked to have the heating system looked at in our room as we did not feel it was working properly and we had been very cold during the night. Upon our return, we had a message from engineering telling us to call them when we returned and they would show us how to operate the thermostat. After the engineer was in our room for over 20 minutes, he couldn't figure out why it wasn't working but if we had any more trouble, he would be there until 11 PM, it was already 10 PM. Needless to say, it was another cold night. Also, when we had checked in on Friday, we were informed that there was going to be a neighborhood festival on Sunday and that we would be stuck at the hotel for 12 hours unless we left first thing in the morning and came back later than night. They also advised we would not be able to get our car out of the garage during that time because all of the roads around the hotel would be blocked off or jammed up with traffic. We had enough. It felt more like punishment than pleasure having to stay at this Best Western. So, Sunday morning we packed up early, went down to the front desk and told them they were checking out. I was informed they were going to charge us $75 for leaving early. They were more worried about getting their $75 than why we were leaving. After explaing to the desk clerk why we were leaving, she did agree to waive the $75 fee. In addition to the $299 rate, the $44 parking fee and the misc. taxes and fees, our daily charge for this hotel was almost $380. We were able to relocate to the Holiday Inn Express at SFO Airport, and for $150/night we had a beautiful room overlooking the Bay, free parking and about half the misc. taxes than what we had paid downtown. Plus we got free breakfast and a clean WARM room with a working thermostat.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and noisey!”
Reviews.Author: Murano47
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here in Room 419. Room was average but the noise was horrible. Trash truck at 5am under our window sounded like it was in the hallway. Windows so dirty you couldn"t see out of them. Bell and Valet staff were super nice but the front desk staff leave alot to be desired. When I complained about the noise, all I got was a" um sorry".

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeeClare
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Tuscan Inn was perfect from the word go. The staff were incrediblely friendly and couldn't do enough to help you, and were so happy to recommend places to eat or go. You even got a welcome cookie on arrival! The rooms looked recently refurbished and were a good size, and very quiet at night. The really nice thing about this hotel is that they do a free wine hour every day between 5-6 pm and you get to meet all of the other guests in the hotel and make friends. We got complimentary continental breakfast each day or you could receive 50% discount on other breakfast items. All of which were so tasty, especially the potatoes. As well as staying in the Fisherman's Wharf area, we spent some of our trip at a downtown hotel too, but would highly recommend the Fisherman's Wharf area over downtown as it was quieter and closer to the touristy areas.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: strogoo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights in September 2011. The hotel is in a good location to do your sightseeing and the coffee in the morning/wine meet in the evenings is a nice touch. We stayed in room 201 which was noisy, the room was dated as where areas in the hotel. The staff were helpful. For the price we paid we thought the hotel OK. I think you'd be better off checking out other hotels before booking this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Carol061
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Best Western. Staff were friendly and helpful. Lobby very cosy. Room was nice. Bathroom abit small but adequate. Bed comfy. Wine reception in evening was nice touch. Complimentary coffee & tea each morning. Great location ~ walking distance to Pier and other attractions. Would also recommend the "Hollywood Cafe" for breakfast just down the street. Would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Mike N
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel, the only downside was the noise from the street during the night but more so in the early hours of the morning from the trash lorries. It is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: HBC_7
Reviews.Content: Tuscan Inn is in an outstanding, central location. You can walk two blocks to Fisherman's Wharf. The cable cars are around the corner, and the bus we took to the Giants game was only five minutes away. You could also walk to North Beach if you really wanted to. Rooms are OK for two people, but would probably feel crowded for more. Beds are comfortable. We were on the 4th floor and there was a steady amount of road noise, but this is a city and it really didn't keep us awake. There is coffee in the lobby in the morning and a free wine bar from 4-5 pm when guests can mingle and share stories for an hour. Very well run with friendly staff. We ate breakfast in the attached restaurant - very expensive but lots of food. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service Good location”
Reviews.Author: Fran447
Reviews.Content: This was recommended in the top ten guide book to San Francisco as a reasonable hotel with good location. They were right. Great service very comfortable stay, good location. Valet parking at a price but it was worth it for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to everything........”
Reviews.Author: ChefKFairfax_VA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to everything! It was in walking distance of all of the major attractions and restaurants and close to the trolley line. The service here is outstanding. We were nicely greeted everytime we either left or came back from our hotel room. There is valet parking at a price, but worth it to leave your car behind while you can walk to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirardelli Square. Our room was clean and comfortable, but a bit noisy since it was on the street level. We would definitely stay here again next time we are in the SF area.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: occtravelers
Reviews.Content: First time visiting SF. Visited 9/16 - 9/21/11. Great location to Fisherman's Wharf, just two blocks away. Hotel is going to be doing some renovation, which will be nice. Room was very clean. Staff always very, very helpful and friendly. Nightly wine hour was very nice, met some other travelers and compared notes. Nice restaurant and bar attached to the hotel. Would stay here again if we return to San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: CA092011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn as our first stop in CA for 3 nights, the reception staff were lovely and very helpful. The room was rather small but ok for a base. The shuttle to the airport is only $15 per person but expect an experience of a drive, rude driver and took us through streets we tried to avoid on our visit. Good location to the pier, a bit too far from the restaurants and shops but a nice walk, close the the tram station and cycle hire. Free wifi and printer access.

Reviews.Title: “Our 5th stay here”
Reviews.Author: InterntlTraveler10
Reviews.Content: Our first stay was in 1999 on our honeymoon. We stayed 4 nights this time. The hotel has not changed much since '99 - some refurb but basically the same. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay - we used it as a base for Fisherman's Wharf, the art museums, and road trips to the surrounding area. Rooms are small. Rates are high but San Francisco is expensive. Parking is now $40-56 a night, on par with Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Just Close Enough”
Reviews.Author: Mentor189
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tuscan Inn 9/17-9/19/2011 because it allowed us to explore the Fisherman's Wharf area while we were in SF for a couple of days. Room was bright and we were able to open the windows to enjoy the breezes from the Bay. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean and adequately appointed. Only snag was that we promised robes but none were in the room when we checked in. A quick call to the front desk had the robes delivered within 20 minutes. The attached restaurant was more than adequate for breakfast and even dinner if you so desired.

Reviews.Title: “Very nicely decorated room, but small”
Reviews.Author: hctravelers
Reviews.Content: Stopped here late on a Friday night on our way to Windsor, CA. Wanted to spend Saturday at Fishermans Wharf and ride the cable cars. Didn't intend to spend the night in downtown San Francisco, but we didn't find any place along the way that seemed like a good place to stay. So since I was fairly familiar with the area, we chose to stay here. We wanted gated parking that we could leave the car while we did our sightseeing and this fit the bill perfectly. We didn't have to be out of the garage until 3 pm. We ended up being about an hour late, but it was not a problem. Our room was 2 double beds, without a view (looked at a roof) but we had requested a nice quiet room as we are both light sleepers and traffic in that area can be quit loud. We both slept like babies. Beds and pillows were very comfortable. The room was decorated very quaint. Everything was really clean, and the price was very reasonable. They held our luggage once we checked out, until we came back for the car. Everything we needed was within a few blocks either direction. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location by Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: 255100Traveler
Reviews.Content: Stroll to Boudin's on the Wharf and sample a famous San Francisco Sour Dough loaf, top cut off, toasted, and filled with your choice of scrambled eggs and ham, or clam chowder. Enjoy the manager's evening wine tasting, or start your day with a morning coffee in the lobby. Have your on-line check-in for tomorrow's flight done for you by hotel staff who set up a station in the lobby just for this purpose. This hotel made our visit to San Francisco easy. On top of all that, the rooms were large and the beds comfortable and all the sights of San Francisco were easily accessible. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “exellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: magb_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, very clean and fresh hotel really nice rooms, staff very friendly loved the free wine reception every night from 5 till 6pm. Nice breakfast and complementary coffee and tea in lounge until 10am nice touch. Its in a good location walking distance to Wharf and China town plenty to do would book this hotel next time we are in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cost-Effective, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: MOGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: We generally travel 1st class when wer'e on vacation, but decided to give Tuscan Inn a try with all the great reviews. (Plus, the place we stayed last time, Fairmont Ghiradelli cost $600+/night now.) Tuscan Inn didn't let us down. Why we loved this place: 1. Location - Tuscan Inn is located in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. It was so convenient to walk everywhere ... Fisherman's Wharf eateries, shopping, Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, cable cars, Ferry Building, downtown, etc. Getting to/from Napa/Sonoma was a breeze. 2. Rental Car - We needed a rental car for just 1 day (during the day) and didn't want to pay for overnight parking. Both Budget and Dollar are right next door. 3. Cost - it was the cheapest 3-star hotel in Fisherman's Wharf, and it even included a nightly wine reception. 4. Clean - While the rooms are a bit dated (i.e., peeling wall paper, tube TV, a little rust in the shower, worn towels, etc.), the room was spotless. Every day we could count on housekeeping cleaning our room and bringing clean, fresh towels. 5. Comfort - Aside from the occassional street noise, the room we received was very quiet and the bed was very comfortable. My husband and I had some of the best sleep/naps ever. 6. Service - From the valet to the reception to housekeeping, everyone met us with a smile and hello. Tips: 1. Arrive early to the wine reception or you will NOT get any hors d'ouerves. 2. Turn your A/C or heat to low to avoid the loud "kapow" when the unit kicks on. 3. Except where marked for cleaning, you can park on the streets at Fisherman's Wharf for FREE between 7 pm - 7 am. 4. Skip the long wait & $$ at Pescatore and go to IHOP a block away. They have good, quick service and good, hot eats.

Reviews.Title: “Large tourist transit hotel not worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: MaldonDW
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights on the review that this was a boutique hotel with an Italian flavour, what a misnomer. The hotel is definitely not boutique, rather a large chain tourist transit hotel with no atmosphere and little facilities. If it were not for the excellent Cafe Pescatore (attached) there would not even be a hotel bar. The room was very small and below par. If you want to get any sleep avoid the rooms facing the street the 24hr noise levels were appalling. The daily managers wine affair was a joke with run of the mill wine and no where to sit. The valet parking was exhorbitant at $50 a day and the reception staff had to be reminded to take off my $5 a day AAA discount even though they were told at check in. Overall a huge disappointment the only positives being the Cafe Pescatore and it's close proximity to Fishermans Wharf if you want to be in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: foodntravellover7989
Reviews.Content: It is very nice hotel in the best location of SF's attractions. The room is lovely and clean. Friendly staff, cozy atmosphere, provide free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place!”
Reviews.Author: countryman74
Reviews.Content: We booked the Tuscan Inn on the recommendation of our travel agent in England who was obviously well informed! It's a superb hotel in a great location close to the the waterfront at Fishermans Wharf. After arriving from a big hotel in Las Vegas this was just what we needed........... personal service and attention to detail. Rooms are spotless and well equipped. Everyone is keen to help and the hotel has a cosy atmosphere all it's own. There is complimentary wine in the lounge area between 5 - 6pm. Coffee/tea-making facilities are provided in all rooms which was a real bonus! We had vouchers for continental breakfast which is served until 10am. We also had excellent meals in the restaurant on two evenings and noticed that it always seemed to be full of local people which is always a good sign! I realised when I returned home that I'd left my cash in our room-safe! I called Ed, the customer relations manager, who told me it had been found and immediately arranged to FedEx it to me. With service like that who could ask for more. If we're ever fortunate enough to get to San Francisco again we'll certainly stay at the Tuscan Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Saarita
Reviews.Content: Tuscan Inn isn't as nice as some other Best Western/Kimpton hotels, but it was clean and the location was nice. Easy walk to Pier 39 and the wharf. Not too far from public transport and lots of taxis around. The pizza room service they offered was mediocre, but there's a Safeway across the street and a Starbucks around the corner. The two-bedroom suite was cramped with small windows, but nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GayleCharach
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. It's only a few block walk from Pier 39 - GREAT location if Fisherman's Wharf is on the agenda. Hotel was clean, spacious room and very pleasant staff. The 5 o'clock evening win reception is a nice touch :) We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ericruns66
Reviews.Content: This was just a 1 nighter stay over until we could get to Napa. we've stayed at this hotel maybe 3 times in the last 10 years. The main reason we stay here is it's proximity to the Buena Vista bar where we got their awesome Irish Coffees (coffee with Tullamore Dew whiskey and a dollop of whipped cream) and looked out at the Golden Gate Bridge. The rooms are VERY small but were clean and functional. It's a nice area to have as a 'home base' for any San Fran vacation because of the close proximity to cable cars, Golden Gate Bridge and everything else San Fran has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “AFINE DEAL ALL AROUND”
Reviews.Author: tpmedia
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience here. From the moment we arrived and even before, by telephone, the staff was friendly, helpful and courteous. They could not do enough to please. The rooms are clean and comfortable and in need of a few small upgrades which are coming soon (like a flat-screen TV). The location is excellent! Valet parking is pricey but well worth it. Free wine reception every afternoon and coffee/tea in the AM. Would stay here again for sure! Enjoy San Fran from a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Fakapuna
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was all great. They let us check in super early, check out super late, and were just very accommodating all around. My only complaints would be that the hallways are a little gloomy and dark and the outside noise that I heard from my room was a little much. The room was somewhat small but very clean and nice. All the room amenities (towels, TV, A/C, etc were all very good). Great location! Everything from restaurants, bars, shopping, sightseeing/touristy places are all within walking distance. Great place! I would definitely recommend this location for convenience and the friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Awesome Location -- A bit off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Dalex916
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Going to SF was a last minute thing while we were on vacation in Monterey, CA. I booked the hotel through Priceline.com, and got a great rate for one night (Friday) over the other hotels in the area (which all seem good too). Upon arriving, we were met by the valet's who were ready to help us out. Parking is expensive($50, unlimited access), but it's expensive at every hotel in the area. You can probably save some money with public parking but this is convenient. As i mentioned our rate was low, and the room was small. But it was very nicely decorated, clean, and had a large (for the room) bathroom. It was all very clean, the bed was comfy, and honestly we hardly spent any time there at all. The room had a minibar, but we didn't get the key for it. All in all a great hotel. They offered a free wine tasting that evening that we didn't go to but was a nice addition. I would return to this hotel again, and it was a nice room. At the end of the trip, with our low rate plus parking and fees, we were still ahead than any other rate of other hotels in the area. A great trip I would say

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: hillygra
Reviews.Content: We could not fault this hotel at all.The staff were great particularly the manager Ed, the wine in the afternoon fabulous and the tea & coffee in the morning much appreciated. Our room was just lovely, 2 double beds for three of us and great views of Coit Tower and the Pyramid building. We wouldn't hesitate to stay again if we are fortunate enough to go back to San Francisco again. Also we were there for a week and bought a weekly MUNI ticket for the cable cars, trams and buses for $27 and it was definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller10101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights and did not like it much. It is a very simple 3 stars hotel. The rooms were just above the bearable minimum. The windows did not close well and there was a lot of noise from the street. The bathroom was not pleasant to use. The charge for parking was outrages. The location is near pier 39 which is nice but the street is not a pleasant one. It was not bad enough to look for another hotel but I will not come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fishermans wharf is a great location and this is at the heart.”
Reviews.Author: Motley2112
Reviews.Content: Firstly they wanted $50+ to park my car for a night. The shopping centre next door is a comparative margin at $30. the hotel is nice, no pool or gym. No bar or food. Free Internet, and wine tasting on an evening is good. LOcation is very good. Noisome bread makes up for the lack of food in the hotel. San Fran is a great city - enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff but small room”
Reviews.Author: Buttonwoodwriter
Reviews.Content: Good location for this best western - a block or so from Fisherman's wharf. Our room however was very small for a family of four, barely room to fit the suitcases as well as ourselves. Like other SF hotels, it has a very high car parking charge; my advice is to take a taxi from the airport if you are staying more than one night in the city. The taxi fare was around $60. A plus for this hotel is that the reception staff were very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel very central.”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraLA
Reviews.Content: A great hotel really central for all Fishermans Wharf attractions. Alwasy ask to see room first as we were given a small room even though we were staying for 5 nights and had booked a seating area within our room. Staff really friendly and helpful and keen to please.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but pricey for what you get”
Reviews.Author: joepekoe
Reviews.Content: SHORT VERSION Very convenient location, adequate room, and mostly helpful staff. There may be better places to stay that provide better value, but sometimes location makes the higher price worth it. LONG VERSION The reviews citing an average rating for this hotel accurately portray my experience and I give it an average rating as well. Please note that this was my first trip to SFO and so I cannot offer any guidance as to whether this hotel is any better or worse than any other hotel in the same area. We paid $200/night not including taxes, etc. A few quirks throughout our stay but nothing that caused me concern or necessitated a call to the front desk or manager. Our room was on the outside wall facing Mason St. As other reviews have pointed out, probably the worst attribute about this hotel is the noise from outside which is pretty powerful and at times annoying. It is worse on weekends than during the week, but there are various distractions all the time such as busses, loud cars, people yelling, and across the street is a parking garage for a small mall that has a buzzer to warn pedestrians every time a car is coming out of it. We can't reasonably hold this against the hotel especially since the entire wharf area is a very busy place and traffic noise should be expected. However, all of this noise could likely be dampened if the hotel modernized its windows (see photos) which at least in our room were in serious need of replacement. If you can deal with “white noise”, we found that the air conditioner created enough of it to drown out the noise from outside. Unfortunately there was no “fan only” option on the AC unit, only cool and heat, which meant that when the room reached whatever temperature you set it at the unit shut off and there was the street noise again. A better solution would be to set the TV on a “static” station and at a volume that would take care of the street noise. If you can’t survive with “white noise” or street noise, the best advice I’ve seen from other reviews is to specifically request an INSIDE room. The room itself was adequate size with a King bed, bureau, TV (not flat screen or HD), desk, two chairs, closet, and adequate sized bathroom. I’ve read other reviews stating the rooms are small; however they are not any smaller than most other hotels I have stayed at. We found there was plenty of room to move around and did not feel boxed in. They certainly are not suites, but they are not shoeboxes either. Regarding other reviews that claim the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything your neighbors do, we did not experience this. The entry doors to the rooms however are close to each other and are somewhat noisy. We could hear our neighbors entering and leaving their room (and I’m sure they could hear us), but we never heard them once they were inside their room. Perhaps they were just quiet neighbors. The bathroom was in very good condition except for some mold we found on the ceiling (see photo), and there was plenty of hot water for showers. On one occasion the ballcock on the toilet did not close and I had to lift the tank cover and reseat it. Not a big deal and otherwise no problems with the bathroom or hot water. The AC/heating unit in our room looked new (see photo) and worked flawlessly. We found the hotel staff mostly friendly and helpful. I’m not sure if they call them doormen or bellhop anymore, but a young man named Matt was great and stands out from the rest of the hotel employees. My only real complaint is that the concierge service is lacking with only one person available. Someone got to her before us and kept her busy for the better part of an hour. We only wanted to know what bus to take to the Golden Gate Bridge so asked someone at the front desk who sort of knew, but didn’t really know, and ultimately told us to ask the young lady who was acting as concierge. Well she was still busy with the other couple who got to her before us, so we found our own way. Overall, we found the staff was pleasant, professional, and helpful. The room cleaning service was very good except for the last day. We went out touring around and came back around 1pm tired. My wife has a medical condition and needed to rest but the maid was just getting around to our room. We went down into the lobby and sat there for about 30 minutes then went upstairs to check our room again, and the maid was just finishing up. As we opened the door we found we had a rollaway bed in our room, which was interesting since we never requested one. We assumed that perhaps the next occupant of the room had requested it and the hotel had just brought it early. We asked the maid about it who seemed surprised that WE were surprised to see it there, and quickly removed it. We laid on the bed to take a nap and about 5 minutes later some other maid opened the door without knocking and asked if we had a bath-mat. I looked and said we did and she closed the door. About 10 minutes later some male opened our door without knocking and when he saw us inside said “whoops, sorry” and closed the door. I still don’t know if it was a hotel employee coming into the room for some reason or if the maid had not closed the door tightly and someone just went to the wrong room and was able to open the door. While my wife was very annoyed that two people had opened our room door and invaded our privacy, I felt no harm done…we were dressed and just resting but it were certainly a very weird series of events. Lesson here…LOCK your door from the inside if you REALLY want privacy. The hotel has a restaurant which we tried once for breakfast, but we found the service lacking and did not return. We were seated promptly but it took a while for the waiter to approach us. I ordered a coffee and got one…and only one. Our breakfast was simple and directly off the menu but it took longer to serve than we thought it should. Having finished my first cup of coffee and almost done my meal, I was ready for another coffee (or ANYTHING to drink) but our waiter was either not to be found, or busy keeping his back to us so that I couldn’t get his attention. Unable to delay any longer, I flagged down another waiter and asked if he would please get me a glass of water, which he did promptly. There is an IHOP a block down the road with impeccable service and so we ate breakfast there the rest of the week for half the price of the hotel restaurant. Wireless internet access was available free in the room and worked fine. There are two elevators and both worked fine, relatively quickly, and we experienced no crowding or lines for them. Longest wait for an available elevator was about 30 seconds, and most times we had the elevator to ourselves. We found the bed mattress and pillows very comfortable and slept very well. I would classify the mattress as firm, although it had a soft top layer on it. There are a few things I do take issue with regarding the hotel which caused me to rate it only average and I leave it to the reader to make up their own mind of their importance. First, I think a $200/night hotel in the 21st century should have High Def TV’s in the room, not outdated CRT models with only 10 or so channels available. This is one of those things that is a tip off the hotel is not investing in its own infrastructure which can sometimes point to larger issues with the hotel. A $200/night hotel also should not have mold in the bathroom (see photo) or have door hinge pins coming out (see photo). These are minor maintenance issues, easily identified and fixed, the occurrence of which also suggests the hotel is not investing money in its infrastructure. Think of it, all it takes is for housecleaning or maintenance staff to carefully inspect each room between occupants. At most, a five minute room go-around with a checklist is all that is required. Mold especially is a no-no, and shame on Best Western for not identifying and fixing the mold in this room before making it available for occupancy. A $200/night hotel also should not have windows in the condition we found them (see photos). Not only did it not close tight, but the handle was not firmly attached and came off in my hand whenever trying to crank the window open or closed. A tightly sealed window would help cut down on the outside traffic noise and make for happier customers. The window condition is another suggestion that the hotel is not investing in its own infrastructure and simply trying to extract as much profit out of the existing building as possible. In summary, the hotel is adequate but value is debatable. Management could easily increase the sense of value by performing simple maintenance inspections and investing in the infrastructure. There are many hotels in the same area that might provide better value.

Reviews.Title: “The Tuscan Inn - A wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paresh04_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 7th August to 21st August 2011. I must say having stayed in a lot of hotels before, I would rate this as one of the best we have stayed in. The staff were pleasant and helpful, the hotel reception was clean and welcoming and the rooms very comfortable. The "wine reception" each evening was great to meet new people and exchange stories and ideas. Our THANKS to the manager and staff for making our stay so pleasant. I have also got to say Thanks to the concierge, Nicole who was great. She was pleasant and helped with ideas on places to visit as well as how to get there. Overall a 5 out of 5 for The Tuscan Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lorniesan
Reviews.Content: Small room for a family with only a small double sofa bed for the 2 kids to share. We found pier 39 a bit tacky and so location although great for fisherman's wharf was a bit wasted on us. If I were you I'd save money by staying downtown & just go to the wharf for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated but fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: beepages
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Tuscan Inn and check in was quick. Kevin at reception was very nice and helpful. The lobby is like a cozy living rom with fireplace and all. They serve coffee there from early in the morning to 10 AM. The hotel is a bit old but the location cannot be beat. It´s a 5 minute walk from Pier 39 and close to a lot of restaurants, the cable car and nightlife. The rooms and bathrooms are a bit small and we barely fit our 4 luggage bags there. It´s a bit pricier than other Best Western hotels, but S.F. is an expensive city. Nicole, the concierge, was very helpful in arranging our tours and visits. Tip: Book the Alcatraz tour online 2 months before you arrive to S.F. otherwise you won´t find tickets. Same tip goes for car rental (thanks to Nicole, we were able to book one last-minute). The hotel´s restaurant was good but there were no menu options for kids so we only had breakfast there once. There is a Trader Joe´s, Safeway and Walgreens very close to the hotel. All in all, it was a good stay and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: pgej
Reviews.Content: Had bed bugs. Personnel lied about inspection. Not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find!”
Reviews.Author: julesd149
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by looking at Trip Advisor and in guides of San Francisco. We were a little hesitant at first as some of the reviews on here are not full of praise. However, we are very glad that we followed our instincts because this is a fantastic little hotel and we could not fault it! We arrived at 1pm and although check-in wasn't until 3pm we were able to go to our room straight away. The guy on the desk was extremely helpful and made us feel very welcome, providing us with exact instructions on how to get to AT&T Park that night for the baseball game that we had tickets for. Our room was small but perfectly well equipped, spotlessly clean and was well decorated, with a great looking bathroom. There was a coffee maker and complimentary toiletries. There is a minibar but as is always the case in hotels, the prices are ridiculous, but we used it as a fridge to keep our own drinks in. We had not expected to get breakfast included as we had booked the hotel as room only, but were given a free continental voucher for each of our three mornings which was great. This is waiter service and had a choice of tea, coffee, juices, muffin, crossiant, or toast and a bowl of melon and strawberries. You could also choose to upgrade to other items at half price. Although we enjoyed this breakfast (as it was an unexpected freebie!) we're not sure we could have been happy to pay $12 for it as it wasn't very big. There is a Safeway and Walgreens within one block of the hotel, so we could easily have picked up something else for breakfast, and there are a couple of other cafes we saw within a block also. The hotel is VERY well located, just a five minute walk from Pier 39, but set back enough to be quiet and not feel too touristy. The hotel can booked transfers too and from SFO airport which we used on our return instead of getting a taxi, saving us $15, and was very efficient. We did a good job at getting out and about while we were in San Fran. We got a 48hr bus tour ticket which took us all over the city and across the Golden Gate Bridge. We went to watch the Giants at AT&T. We took a half day trip to Muir Woods and Sausalito (booked before we travelled with Viator). As in many US cities the food seems to be either burgers or high-end restaurants, with a number of Clam Chowder restaurants in San Fran. We would highly recommend Knuckles Bar at the Hyatt on North Point. This is supposed to be a sports bar but more like a good mid-range restaurant with reasonably priced, good quality food. We ate there two nights! We had a fantastic trip to San Francisco and a lovely stay at the Tuscan Inn.

Reviews.Title: “2 blocks from the Wharf, 1 block to the Trolley. Quaint rooms. Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: yvrtravelguy
Reviews.Content: Read very good reviews about this hotel on Trip Advisor and other places. Reserved for $155 per night which in comparison to what is around the same area, this was a good price. Room was smaller but ample. Queen bed mattress was a bit thinner than we are used to but was ok. Wine tastings in the late afternoon is a nice touch. Safeway is one block east. Trolley (F-Line) is one block north. Wharf is two blocks north. Dollar Rent-A-Car is in the Sheraton, kitty corner from the hotel. Ask for a top floor room so that you don't hear people above you. Courtyard view will get you away from the street which is noisy. Turn the AC on to drown out any unwanted noise. Very good value for the money, but then SF is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: tibi08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two days as part of a car trip around the west coast. The location is great, walking distance from Fisherman's Wharf, the cable cars to Union Sq, safeways/trader joes for supplies, and the buses. The bus to the Golden Gate Bridge only costs a couple of dollars although a change is required (follow the other tourists!). The hotel itself is okay, nothing special, our room was a little noisy although we never established quite what made the noise (maybe a noisy aircon unit outside the window). We also had to walk a pretty long way to get to our room. But those are minor points and on the whole it was fine, nothing to complain about. Concierge was very helpful although she suggested the Stinking Rose restaurant which was absolutely vile! Avoid! Overall I'd probably stay here again although there are other hotels on the same road which I might try next time to see if they're any better.

Reviews.Title: “Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: kwfnut
Reviews.Content: Close to Fisherman's Wharf, parking is expensive, try to find a coupon for 5.00 off. No microwave in the room. Hotel is very nice. Beds are great. Bathrooms are a bit small. Would stay here again but just know it get's spendy staying by the Wharf. Traffic and drivers in Calif in general are not friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shelleym5
Reviews.Content: Nice place, away from Union Square but with the F train nice and close. Close to the Cable cars. It has a Safeway and a Trader Joes right across the street, so we didn't have to eat out for every meal. If you go book a tour with Dylan's tours we went Aug 4th 2011(with Brendan) and loved it. I would stay here again when I go back.

Reviews.Title: “nice and quiet , very close to fisherman's wharf”
Reviews.Author: Gary_El
Reviews.Content: Great stay , very close to fisherman’s wharf and all local attractions , shopping centre just around the corner too . Had a courtyard room so no street noise . Continental breakfast was good with great service the first morning , terrible the second – would advise finding another place to eat .

Reviews.Title: “Graet hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: AlandPat
Reviews.Content: Liked this hotel very much. Very clean and our room #336 in the corner of the bldg was very well decorated with a pretty bay type window over looking the side street. We had a large 37" flat screen tv and a comfortable king size bed. The wine tasting at 4PM was very popular and occasionally offered a snack (pizza from the restaurant) Coffee only was offered in the lobby in the AM. The only criticism I would offer was that security was not up to par. A very busy lobby would easily permit anyone to walk in and use the elevator to the guest rooms. No room or floor specific keys or cards were needed to operate the elevators. The staff was helpful and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Just okay...but not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Liz1ttr
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, quiet room. Price is way too high for what it is. Not much relation to other Kimptom properties that i have stayed at and no where near the quality. Service was mediocre, forgettable. Room service was pizza and the worst submarine sandwich I have ever tasted. Breakfast in the attached restaurant was decent (crab-cakes benedict was delicious but service was just meh). Don't get excited about their wine hour, 2 buck chuck. I thought that was a joke from other reviewers but it wasn't. Parking rates are insane. Next time I'm in San Francisco I will opt for one of the real Kimptom hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: DebTravelsSD
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Tuscan Inn.. we love everything about this hotel. The service is excellent...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: pmri
Reviews.Content: This hotel was updated and clean. The people employed at this hotel were friendly and very helpful. Located was excellent and loved being able to walk everywhere. Didn't have to rent a car!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location, but BAD EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Aaron_C
Reviews.Content: We loved San Francisco... It's one of those places you have to see... After driving from Monterey, we were glad to pull up outside the Hotel, and looked forward to staying in a Best Western after having good experiences with this Hotel Chain so far on our Road Trip... We went in and were greeted by a friendly guy and allocated our rooms... All good so far... Clean rooms, comfy beds, the Hotel seemed nice and we were RIGHT BESIDE Fisherman's Wharf... Fisherman's Wharf is a nice place to walk around and take it all in... Driving around San Fran in the rental car was fun.. The steep streets and the iconic views really were a sight to behold... Very enjoyable... The first night there and we went down to the wine reception in the lobby... Quite nice, but not as great as some reviews make out... Some people chatting together, some people taking advantage of the free wine and drinking as much as possible... That night we hit the town... We went to an Irish bar that was close to little Italy, where a "honey trap" which was employed by the bar in my opinion, tried to get us to drink and eat as much as possible and also tried to land us with her bill too... It didn't work out too well for her or the pub, and she should have thought twice before trying to pull the wool over the eyes of a couple of Irish people who couldn't be bothered with her tripe talk... She was told where to go... I think she was used to getting her way with most travellers... So I hope she enjoyed the plates of uneaten food she ordered and stacks of drinks. We went to Shanghai Kelly's pub after that, and met an Irish guy that had been living there for 16 years... He told us that it was common enough, and our suspicions were likely correct... So... Back to the Hotel... We drank our fill, and I ended up in the Hotel room before my wife and my friend as they stayed outside for a cigarette... I was not asked to produce any ID... After 2 mins I had fallen asleep! After a very long time, I eventually woke up to my mobile phone ringing... I had been drinking after all, and it was a long day of travelling... My wife was downstairs with my friend and they would not allow them to go to up the room... Since it was my credit card paid the deposit, they wanted my ID. My wife and friend, both very friendly people, had asked for them to wake me, or let my friend into his room (adjoining to ours) where he could provide proof that they were guests... The room was in his name and he showed his ID, but once again, since my credit card paid the security deposit, they wanted my ID??? The Chinese girl that was working at the front desk wanted proof that they were guests before letting them even go into the elevator... Ok, I understand they don't want people coming off the streets posing as guests... ... But after failing to wake me via the room phone, they could have had security escort one of them up and into either my room or my friends room... Is it THAT INCONCEIVABLE that your husband may have fallen asleep in the room?... IS THERE NO OTHER WAY to check other than insist that I MUST answer the phone and come down with ID?... They gave my name and room number and my wife showed her Irish ID with her married name and it still wants enough... The other room was in my friends name, and he showed his ID, but because my credit card paid the deposit they refused to accept it... The room is in his name!... He's showing you his ID! When I finally showed up after 45 minutes of my wife and friend pleading with them, although we had drink in us, I could tell she was on a power trip... Its such a pity... Even AFTER I showed my ID, we were only then escorted to the room by security to show MORE EVIDENCE that we were guests... He was a nice man, and said he was just doing what he was told... There were plenty of other ways to deal with this, and there was no need to escort us up to prove again, after I showed my ID... My friend had ID and his room was in his name, and my wife had ID, and was the only other guests from Ireland with the same surname as me and she knew my name and room number etc etc etc... Common sense.. My wife was cold, tired and upset... It ruined a nice stay at a decent hotel... that particular member of staff was on a power trip and was a rude and horrible person... I complained the next day, and a friendly man at the front desk explained security etc... He had been made aware of the whole scenario, obviously warned to expect a complaint, or just told during chit chat... I'm not stupid and I understand to a certain extent the policies that must be enforced, but working in sales and customer service myself, that particular member of staff was rude, unhelpful, and made me regret paying my hard earned money to stay there, only for my wife to be treated like a junkie that walked in off the street... They even said the next day that my wife was intoxicated and that's why they were so adamant that she prove they were guests! How dare they... We are on holidays enjoying ourselves!... She was not abusive and everything she said made perfect sense... I am appalled, and I intend to make a formal complaint... for all the good it will do!... But maybe they keep a close eye on the jobsworth girl at the front desk... I liked the location, and the hotel was nice and clean with nice staff... But that girl ruined our stay... If you see any of my other reviews, you will find that we don't fuss or complain, and are easily pleased... I still gave this Hotel an average rating... But that girl is in the wrong job... She should work at the security checks in the airport... It would suit her down to the ground... Pathetic excuse. MAKE SURE to take a bus tour around the city... very nice... china town, little itally, the golden gate bridge, the iconic streets etc... Also... BOOK Alcatraz well in advance... It was brilliant.. The self guided tour was the highlight of my visit... Just do it. There seemed to be a lot of homeless people in the area, and in fact all over the city... That was unfortunate too. Enjoy San Fran... Stick to the tourist area's... this hotel is OK... Pity it was ruined for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location OK stay”
Reviews.Author: peejmontego
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, however you need to keep in mind it is on a main street. Ask for a room on the inner court yard otherwise you will have the sound of the street all night... Front desk was frazzled and some were great while others were not very accomidating at all. Rooms were clean and good size but the pull-out couch was very uncomfortable, I would not recomend using them unless your traveling with very young chlidren.

Reviews.Title: “Super Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Marissabiz
Reviews.Content: Wow, for the over $200.00 a night price we paid the room was like sleeping right out on the sidewalk. Super noisy! I heard every car, truck and bus that drove by. Not sure if I will ever stay at this place again. It was clean and convenient to the wharf but what good was the room if I could not sleep? Great place if you are not bothered by road traffic. Then to add insult to injury we were charged $50.00 to park our car there over night! Terribly overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy - Couldn't Sleep”
Reviews.Author: mouseburgeroo
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at the Best Western Tuscan Inn for a weekend in July based on the ratings the hotel had received in Fodor's San Francisco guidebook. We arrived around 7pm and had a room above the main entry. It was so noisy that we called the front desk and asked to be moved. The front desk said that they were sold out and couldn't move us and offerrred to send up earplugs. We asked if we could change to an interior room for the next night and again were told that the hotel was sold out. We tried to go to sleep at midnight but were woken up at 2am by street noise which continued the rest of the morning - so we didn't sleep at all. If you are a light sleeper - we do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, excellent rooms, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: ramblingsalesman
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights and was extrodinarily impressed with the hotel and particularly the staff. Keith on the front desk was very helpful and went out of his way to help. Other staff from cleaning staff to parking attendants very all very pleasant. I now have my hotel haunt in san fran picked out. Street parking is free on weekends so skip the valet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Becky98
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at agreat location- 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. It has a very attractive restaurant and comfortable rooms. My only complaint is the parking- I think it was about $50 a night, plus you have to use their valet every time you get your car out, and we felt we had to tip each time.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly acceptable base for exploring San Fran”
Reviews.Author: RobJenD
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable and conveninetly placed. Comfortable beds, although room slighly on the small side. Never going to wow but as a comfortable base for exploring San Franciso with easy access to much of the city it was perfectly acceptable. And there were some nice touches, including a wine reception in the evenings and coffee and cookies in the lobby in the mornings.Helpful reception staff, concierge left something to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place”
Reviews.Author: Stonewall
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one Sat. night in June before cruising to Alaska. Rooms were clean and spacious and the location great. Easy walk to restaurants, grocery, church, and drugstore. Helpful front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jewlsplus2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of June, first part of July. First off, I messed up the date of our flight so only realized about 2 days ahead that I didn't book the hotel starting on the correct date. Best Western reservations was good about trying to help me book a double room for an additional night but one wasn't available so we booked a suite for 1 night. When we arrived at the hotel, they did upgrade us to stay in the suite for the entire trip so we didn't have to change rooms. This was a really nice bonus. We were in a 2-room suite on the 3rd floor. The rooms weren't very big but it was nice having 2 separate rooms, 2 TVs, and a refrigerator. The pull-out couch was a very small double bed but my children are young so they were okay in that. Everything is fairly basic at this hotel. The bathroom itself is large but the shower & the sink area were quite small. My biggest problem here was that there are no curtains on the windows, at least in this suite with 2 windows. Only white plantation-type shutters that will not shut out the morning light. A nice bonus is the appetizers & wine offered in the lounge area around 5pm daily. We tried the attached restaurant for dinner one night & it was a decent Italian restaurant. The best point for this hotel is that it is in a great location - within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Strategically located hotel in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Travelingismyh0bby
Reviews.Content: Tuscan Inn at Fisherman's Wharf is conveniently located 2 blocks south from the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. Almost everything my husband and I need are close by. An italian restaurant is attached to the hotel; Safeway, Wallgreens, Radio Shack, US post office and a bus stop are across the street. This pet-friendly hotel offers complimentary coffee and tea every morning (with no snacks), free wine reception every evening, and free-of-charge wireless internet service (but we had to connect to Kimpton first). My husband and I got a suite that could comfortably fit 4 people. The mattress was nicely firm, the linen was soft and the tuscany-style room was definitely well taken care of daily. Nintendo, on-demand movie channel Lodgenet and iPod dock player are nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, well located.”
Reviews.Author: osspeak
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel, and were very pleased with it. We had my 94 year old mother in the room next door and she was also very pleased, except with her stringent breakfast requirements. The rooms were spacious and very comfortable. The bed was exceptional. The staff were very friendly and attentive. As far as we were concerned there were only 2 negatives. Each room has a coffee maker, which is not good for making tea. They took about 50 minutes to get the water hot enough to make coffee or tea, and did not get it hot enough to add milk. I enquired about a kettle or jug, but they did not have one, so it meant making the tea, adding milk, and putting it back into the pot and wait another 15 minutes, so having a cup of anything took at least an hour. At least they did have refrigerators in the room. The second was the onsite Restaurant. We travel a lot, and this was our 20th World trip, each over a month, so are well used to hotels. It is an Italian Restaurant , and the food seemed fine, but not everyone wants to eat Italian all the time, and there was nothing else on the menu. The breakfast was served there, and it was a la cart, with a fairly limited range, but the pricing was good for what they had. This made getting breakfast a slow process, not getting what you actually wanted. On the last day, we found the Restaurant at the Marriot, about 150m down the road, this was a full buffet and was excellent, but a bit more expensive, so we were annoyed that we only noticed in time to have one dinner and the breakfast there the next morning. Both were excellent, the breakfast was a bit more expensive, but a lot more varied. As far as the hotel went, we were very pleased, except the minor problem of making tea. They were happy to bring a jug of hot water on request, but that was out of their coffee maker, so not exceptionally hot, and the San Francisco water is very chlorinated, where pure water was $3/gallon at the nearby 7-11. The free Wi Fi was very appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel perfectly situated for a San Francisco Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Rocking01
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything I look for in a sightseeing vacation. It is located close to all that Fishermans Wharf has to offer and offers easy access to public transportation so the rest of San Francisco is moments away. The hotel is beautifully appointed and the staff exceptionally accommodating. The propertyl in general and our room in particular were very clean and inviting. I would highly recommend this Best Western to anyone traveling to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lisadphotos
Reviews.Content: Great location friendly staff. Parking is expensive as it seems to be everywhere. Rooms a bit cramped but nice. But not spending much time in there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families and dogs!”
Reviews.Author: onthego619
Reviews.Content: I checked in with my family and my two german shepherds. The hotel staff were all very friendly, helpful, and pleasant! The location of this hotel is great! Just two blocks from the Embarcadero which is the heart of Fishermans Wharf. My rate was a little bit expensive but it was during the 4th of July weekend. Its not the most luxurious hotel out there, but it was clean, well kept, and the beds were comfortable. There is no parking at this hotel. Its only valet $44 per day. If you look online there is an option for parking included at $10 more per night. Highly recommend that option!!! Parking is metered all around the hotel during the day if you decide on leaving your car. Honestly if you and your family can ride a bike I would explore that option. There are tons of places to rent bikes and the weather is so cool you wont break a sweat.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, but good value for location”
Reviews.Author: Nicola_anon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good value for money really, cant say much more than that really. It does not have any resturant etc.. the room was nicely decorated, with tea and coffee etc. but on the small side maybe. I thnk for the money and its location its good value, we did not use the resturant attached, so not sure what that was like.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great staff, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: glkmnarl
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Tuscan. The great location allowed us to return our rental car and walk or take the MUNI for the three days we were there. The staff was wonderful! The concierge took excellent care of us, he made some outstanding recommendations, and then followed up on every request. The hotel was charming and very clean. The room was a bit small but we spent so little time in it, It was never a issue. The only thing missing at this hotel is a nice place to relax outside. I would and will recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, and Best Rate”
Reviews.Author: jotman1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights here. Only 2 blocks from the Wharf easy to get around and the resturant next door is great. Staff was very friendly, offered great suggestions for getting around and we enjoyed our stay. Our rate through expedia was $156 a night which is a great bargin for this area. Beds are clean and while the mattresses are not high end they were comfortable. Only issue we had was a crying baby next door but really not the hotels issue just the luck of the draw and we could have change rooms if we wanted. Overall great stay and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBob2009
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews and they are right. Nice and cozy. The staff was very helpful and polite. We told them we were Best Western Rewards members and got "upgraded" to a king room. It was very "cozy" on the first floor with a view of an A/C unit. I wish I would have asked for a courtyard view but forgot. The room was fine for our short 2 night trip and the location could not be better for access to the pier. The bathroom was very cozy and clean, great shower and fluffy towels. Yes, parking is pricey but actually cheaper than other hotels in the area-- with in/out access. We also got a free breakfast (fruit, juice and muffin) in the cute restaurant attached. It was a perfect start to each day. Loved the free wi-fi in rooms. We also had a great meal at Frascati (a hard hike up Hyde St. so take a cab or trolley).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Keely0207
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was very clean and spacious. Rooms were a little close to each other and could hear absoultely everything that was going on next door. This is the only hotel i think i have ever stayed that allows pets. The guest next door had a dog, which barked a few times... But most of the time you wouldnt know there were any pets in the hotel. Hotel in fab location for cable cars, pier 39 and Fishermans Wharf. Easy walking distance to both. Just a little tip - make sure you bring jumpers, gets very nippy, especially at night. We have visited in both September and June and both times we have needed jumpers/ coats.

Reviews.Title: “Good, well located accommodation”
Reviews.Author: davidhchess
Reviews.Content: We visited the Tuscan Inn as part of a holiday (but needing to work while there) in San Francisco, primarily to visit the opera, but decamping to Fisherman’s Wharf for a bit of rest and recreation. The location is no more than a block or two away from all the main attractions. We found staff to be friendly and helpful. The bright and airy room was large enough for our needs. There was a good sized table. It was good to have a machine into which you can plug six appliances – helpful if you have a laptop, iPad and Blackberry with you as I did. The room we stayed in had the benefit of a fridge and coffee maker. Wardrobe facilities (I was told that this is closet in American!) were sufficient for our needs, staying four days. I found the bed to be a little on the hard side but I suspect that this is a matter of taste. There was a large, if a little old fashioned TV with sufficient channels to maintain our interest. WiFi access is free and reliable and the speed was fine for business use. An ironing board and iron are provided. Everything was clean and well serviced. The bathroom was well appointed and functional though the shower took a little manipulation to get an acceptable temperature. There were ice making and vending facilities on the floor we stayed on. We didn’t eat in the restaurant. Breakfast prices seemed a little on the high side, but of course there are many options within walking distance. The wine hour between 5 p.m. and 6 p.m. was a pleasant idea and a good opportunity to meet other guests – don’t expect premier grand cru though! The lobby area is spacious and well appointed. Overall, we found nothing to complain about and much to admire.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Reccomended !”
Reviews.Author: jingo14
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here, and had a suite that fitted 4 people. Whilst a little small, room was good. The hotel was very well located and also well looked after. Most importantly the service and the staff. This was excellent! Everyone was friendly and was always on hand to help. Restaurant food was very good for both Breakfast and dinner and waiter service was excellent. For th eprice and location we would come back here. Easy access to Fishermans wharf (highly overated) and most other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: Grimalkins
Reviews.Content: Great place to spend the weekend at while visiting San Francisco. Our room had a bad TV and we were offered another room or $50 discount per night! Can't be that!

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel and what a great location!”
Reviews.Author: LondonAsa_2
Reviews.Content: We've really enjoyed our stay there for the following reasons: Location: Great place to stay when in SF. You are 5 minute walk from the bay. There is plenty of restuarants, bars, shops etc at the bay. You can easily walk to different piers and enjoy all what they have to offer. Wlaking distance to the cable cars stop, to the Alcatraz pier (best book before you travel to SF as the trips are usually booked sold out for the next two days) and we even walked on a few ocassins to the city centre. The rooms. Not massive but just right for 2 peole and very cozy. Also lovely decorated. Couldn't ask for more fo the money we've spent on it. The restuaant Downstairs, in the hotel there is a restaruant which isn't owned by hotel. Great food and great service. Very helpful staff as well when it comes to pcking bar or club to go out to. The service Lovely staff and very helpful. Overall we would definately stay in this hotel again. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, and the location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: MrsTRobertson
Reviews.Content: We decided that we wanted to see San Francisco at Christmas time. We booked at the Tuscan Inn, and apparently got a great deal, because I was going to book there again for a summer visit, but the prices are double what we paid in December! The building is just blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. It is adjacent to a small shopping mall and across the street from Safeway. The building is old, but nicely remodeled. The room was very spacious, with cute wooden shutters over the windows. We really loved the lobby, with the lovely conversation areas and large fireplace. There was an enormous Christmas tree in the middle of the room as well as some other beautiful decorations. They have an evening managers reception with appetizers and beverages, including California wines. They do have a seafood restaurant, but we did not try it. Overall, it was a wonderful experience. Our one complaint is that of anyone who visits San Francisco...the price of parking! We spent $30 a day on an outdoor, public lot. The valet parking at the hotel was considerably more than that. The front desk staff and concierge were very helpful, friendly and knowledgeable. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “nice, well-located, mid-range hotel... pricey parking”
Reviews.Author: LizzleC
Reviews.Content: We stayed for several nights ending with Memorial Day weekend. The hotel is really well located to all San Francisco tourist spots - most within walking distance or easy to get to by the cable car around the corner. The king room we had was smallish but had a nice, big, clean bathroom with all necessary amenities plus a nice window that opened and looked right at telegraph hill and coit tower. There was room service, in-room delivery available from a great italian place close by, plenty of decent, affordable restaurants within walking distance, Trader Joes, Safeway, and a gas station literally next door or around the corner. Everything you would need or want is very convenient. The parking is $44 a night. It is, however, 24 hour valet service and they'll haul your car around 20 times a day for that $44. Considering there were parking garages (but not valet) in the $25 range all around the hotel, it just seems a little steep. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay. The cleaning crew did a great job, all staff we encountered were helpful, and the wifi worked great.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean”
Reviews.Author: Winelover123456
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st time to San Fran and this hotel was a great location to walk everwhere. Rooms are small and your suitcases can get in the way, but the room was very clean and there was a good size bathroom. Afternoon wine was cute too. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Too clean to be a pet friendly hotel...”
Reviews.Author: alhambramd
Reviews.Content: We walked into our room and we were "WOW! This is a pet friendly hotel?!" Having traveled with our medium sized dog to a lot of places (San Diego, Las Vegas, Vancouver), we were used to Motel 6 or in fancier hotels, getting the tiny room in the corner with the damp carpet and the musty smell. But the room we got at this hotel was so clean, you'd think our dog was the first one there, ever. Also, they didnt charge anything extra as a "pet fee", so that puts them pretty high in my books. The room itself was spacious, the decor was very tastefully done, the beds were comfortable, even our dog couldnt resist climbing on. All three of us had a good night's sleep. The location was ideal, as it was only 2 blocks east of Pier 39, so you can pretty much walk everywhere else along the wharf. We did not get valet parking as it was ridiculously expensive for us, but there was street parking, which we were fortunate enough to find a spot in front of the hotel on a saturday at 3PM. Talk about lucky! The hotel lobby is very cozy, and the fireplace was aways running, adding to the lobby's charm. I really liked that they had complimentary wine at 5-7PM, a chance for guests to mingle. They also had complimentary tea and coffee in the hotel lobby in the morning, another comingling opportunity for those who are so inclined. Overall, we loved this hotel and are so glad we didnt go with Motel 6 this time. Next time we're in San Francisco, we will definitely stay there again, with or without the dog (although I'm pretty sure the dog will feel bad if she didnt get to go there again).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, limited facilities”
Reviews.Author: Aspect
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location but has little in the way of space or facilities. The lobby area is very small as are the bedrooms. My room didnt even have a wardrobe! Overall I didnt feel it offered great value for money. Although I do accept that San Francisco hotels are quite expensive. Also found the person on the concierge desk quite rude - which was surprising and disappointing. Loved San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Ronniek2011
Reviews.Content: Very friendly reception staff. The young receptionist was on the phone and obviously having a hard time with the person on the other end but he stayed very professional and calm....well done!!! Nice surprise when we checked in and were told we had been upgraded to a king room (thank you). Close to major attractions for this end of town. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: HelenCopestake
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice for 3 nights before and after touring Northern California.
