Both times we had a courtyard facing room, which was quiet, though on the second stay the room was smaller and the fridge was noisy; we turned it off at night. The concierge we used, Jasmine, was helpful, and we enjoyed the wine reception as an ideal opportunity to chat to other guests. The location is ideal for the wharf area, 2 cable car termini, and with a Safeway just next door for extra snacks and drinks. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa2833
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very helpful. Room very clean. Breakfast was a little disappointing, continental breakfast consisted of muffin or croissant and, small dish of fruit. (This was included in the price). You can pay extra for a cooked breakfast but there are plenty of places around that serve breakfast a little cheaper. Coffee making applicance in rooms. Our room was a little noisey, so if you need quiet it may be a good idea to ask for bedroom at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikes1901
Reviews.Content: This hotel is officially rated three star and there was nothing I found that suggested it should be below this. The hotel’s best point is the location. It is close to all the Fisherman’s Wharf attractions - Pier 39, Pier 33 for Alcatraz trips and the Hyde Street Pier. Additionally it is also close to the turnaround on both the Powell-Hyde and Powell-Mason cable cars as well as the F Market street car line, therefore getting round from here to other parts of San Francisco is not a problem. The rooms are clean and smart and contain everything expected of this grade of hotel. Though not particularly large, the inner room I had was no smaller than average city centre hotels and was incredibly quiet. Breakfast could be obtained in an attached café/restaurant though I found a better alternative about 200 yards further up north point street (turning left as you come out of reception on the opposite side of the road.)

Reviews.Title: “Location is best part of the deal”
Reviews.Author: BluesDoctor
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan Inn is a Best Western dressed up by the Kimpton Chain. Two blocks from the main drag at Fisherman's Wharf close to Pier 39. Easy walking distance "as the crow flies" to Chinatown, Ghirardelli and Lombard St. but take extra time for the hills. The hotel rooms are small and the bathrooms are standard 2 or 3-star. The beds were average but the rooms are clean. I recommend not staying in a room next to the street as there was a great deal of noise into the late night and early morning as the Bus 47 stop is right outside the hotel. This is convenient for transportation but I would ask for an inside room next time. The best part was the Concierge Hugo. Recommended the best Chinese restaurant ever - Hunan Home's. Also, Caesar's for dinner. The latter had some amazing lasagna and decent veal both for a reasonable price. Parking rate is an issue so we got the parking deal with save a few dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice hotel, will be back”
Reviews.Author: viciouslysh
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel's close location to everything. Easy walk to eating and shopping. We stayed in a suite which was nice, clean and spacious. Front desk was great. When we needed directions, she gave me a map and showed us exactly were we needed to go. Upon check out, they held our bags and scheduled the shuttle to pick us up which was right on time.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dfh2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, a short walk to Fisherman's Wharf, close proximity to attractions, and public transportation. The rooms were very clean, very well kept - nothing was in disrepair at all. The beds were very comfortable. The desk staff were all extremely helpful and friendly. One small downside - their concierge was not the most helpful. I went to him a few times w/ some questions and we always felt as though we were "bothering" him. However, it all worked out -- it was a great guest experience -- you can't go wrong staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay at Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: cmslj
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Fast, friendly service. Clean rooms. Short walk to the pier. The only negatives were: uncomfortable beds (lumpy mattresses) and over $40 to park overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great restaurant attached”
Reviews.Author: Wonkypauline
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights on the last leg of our stay. The location is good, back from the busy waterfront area. The rooms are small, but if you are organised its not a problem. The rooms are a bit noisy as there a roads on 4 sides - on our second from last night we had roadworks and noisy workmen until after midnight plus a giant generator. I complained the following morning as we had an 11 hour flight the following day and they immediately moved us to an inward facing courtyard room - bigger and much quieter - wish we had compained earlier. The restaurant next door (Cafe Piscatore) is excellent with great staff. The continental breakfast id nice - muffin or toast and fruit. Also served the best tea we had all holiday - almost as good as PG Tips! Goos concierges too, but be aware they actually work for one of the tour companies. The City tour is worth going on though to get orientated and see some of the amazing houses in this fab city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff!!”
Reviews.Author: citygirlforever
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for us. We spent time on the Wharf and in North Beach. The staff was extremely friendly. Tyler worked with us when we had to change our reservation and totally took care of us. It was a very smooth transaction. Our rooms were very clean and had everything we needed for the stay. I wish they had been a tad larger though... The nightly wine and cheese tasting was nice (didn't care for the 2-buck-chuck wine from Trader Joe's - ew!) but the food and cheese was yummy. The morning coffee and hot tea offered in the lobby was good and we really liked the fact that they had nice to-go cups. The front desk held our luggage on the last day of the trip so that we could still explore the city since our flight didn't leave until 9:00 PM. They even secured a ride to the airport for us (make sure you negotiate a price with the driver before leaving the hotel :)) In the end, we will be staying at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for us!”
Reviews.Author: SDC_Ready
Reviews.Content: We definitely picked this one for the location! We were able to walk to the Wharf, and to Chinatown. We walked everywhere, and really enjoyed everything in the vicinity!! The room was good size, and clean. Our neighbor was annoying, but that wasn't the hotels fault. We had a comfortable 2 night stay there. We didn't have a lot of contact with the staff necessarily, but they were friendly when we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Local Nice Motel”
Reviews.Author: PenelopeH
Reviews.Content: Clean nice rooms, a little small but all we did is sleep there. The Hotel Eatery was yummy and so handy...you are right near the heart of the action. Beds were nice and comfy also! :)

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel, quaint, very clean and ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: supermum26
Reviews.Content: We have just returned to the uk after visiting San Fransisco and staying at the Tuscan Inn in celebration of our wedding anniversary. We had checked all the feedback about this hotel before we booked it and can honestly say it surpassed our expectations. It is brilliantly situated. Bus stop outside on the opposite side of the road gets you on most routes. The tram car is 3 minutes walk away, the wharf is a stones throw away. Brilliant location. The hotel is lovely, very clean with hospitable staff. We loved the Cafe Prescatore, the restaurant attached to the hotel, we had breakfast there daily, great atmosphere and good food. We will definately recommend this hotel. A good tip for potential travellers to San Fransisco! If you are intending to do the Alcatraz tour, which by the way is so informative and interesting, purchase your tickets before you travel. You will have a far better chance of getting them for the day and time slot you want. There are some good websites that sell them. Check them out!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Shytot0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in April, the staff were very friendly and the hotel met all of our expectations - good value and nice location. They also have a wine hour every evening which besides the obvious benefit allowed us to chat with other guests and exchange itineraries and hotel notes. Car parking is a bit pricey and the bar area was a little small - overall very good though. Free internet in the rooms and in the lobby. You can buy the MUNI transport pass for $13 from reception - ride the trams and trolleys all day!! We managed to take the BART from SFO to Embarcadero $10 and then the F trolley $2 each to Beach and Mason - hotel is 1 block away.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good stay at Fishermans Wharf”
Reviews.Author: onewheel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscan inn twice during our stay in San Francisco at the end of March, early April 2011 – 2 days initially and then another 2 days after returning to San Francisco after a side trip to Yosemite. Both times we booked a 2 x Queen bed room for 4 people - 2 adults and 2 children – the first time our room was as expected, very comfortable, very clean and nicely decorated (just like the photo’s on their web site) but a little small once we had 4 large suitcases in the room. Our flight arrived in the morning but as they had a room available we were able to check in early. The second visit at the hotel on arrival we were told there were no 2 x Queen rooms left on the non smoking floor, so they put us in a one bed king room with a sofa bed. I was rather disappointed in this, we had booked the room some 5 months prior to our trip, if there was not going to be 2 x Queen beds available, why did they accept our booking? I wish they had been honest at the time of booking because if they did not have a room as we required available then we could have made alternative arrangements. Once we set up the sofa bed in our room we hardly had any room to move and very little room for our suitcases, so it was rather cramped. The sofa bed was VERY uncomfortable so I did not get a very good nights sleep for 2 days. As a result we were a little disappointed in this part of our stay the second time. Besides this, I would highly recommend this hotel. The rooms were nicely decorated and very clean. Both times we had a view of the street, a little bit noisy but quieter when we had the window closed. We had dinner one night in Café Pescatore which is located in the hotel, the food and service was excellent. We also had breakfast there each morning which was also enjoyable. For the first visit we were given breakfast vouchers for a continental breakfast but not for the second visit which was a bit strange as our booking was exactly the same for both visits. There is a shopping centre across the road from which you could buy food and supplies. Our rooms had free Wifi and an in room safe. The lobby area is very inviting and there was also a computer available for use but it was out of order most of the time we were there. We used the Valet parking for one night for our hire car as it was convenient for us to do so but be aware of the cost if you do decide to park your car there (approx $40 per night). It was a short walk to Fishermans Wharf, Alcatraz wharf and other attractions in the area and we felt it was a good safe area for us to stay with our two children. They also stored our luggage as we had a late flight on the day of our departure. All staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. Besides the issue with our room on our 2nd visit we would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, helpful staff, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaBeachhouse
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for taking friends to do the "tourist stay". Love San Francisco and the hotel was perfect for our weekend!

Reviews.Title: “perfect stop over”
Reviews.Author: GCofNorwich
Reviews.Content: Comfortable good sized room, very clean and in perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Sha-sas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely, rooms were clean and nice and location was very close to Fishermans Wharf. There is free internet in reception area. Really comfy bed (large) and mini bar in room.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in the wharf area”
Reviews.Author: zoeandjulian
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in San Francisco and in a great location to explore the city from. It is close to a lot of what we wanted to see and we could walk to pretty much everything we wanted. As other reviewers have said, it is nothing fancy but we only needed it as a place to sleep and eat breakfast because we were out all day. It did everything we needed. The concierge was a font of all knowledge and was always on hand to pre-book things or arrange airport transfersThe staff are friendly and the rooms are large and clean. Admittedly the bed could have been more comfortable but that would be our only criticism and it is a minor one, we still slept! The restaurant attached to the hotel did great breakfasts and had plenty of choice so we were ready to go each morning afterwards. There are a couple of shops nearby like Walgreens which are handy for bits and pieces. The free internet is useful but some people do tend to hog it a little so you might be in for a wait. Handy for checking weather etc. This hotel was ideal as a base for exploring San Francisco and had everything you would need.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: arenal-azul
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location, the rooms are OK, but I did not like the view, the rooms are near the street, the air conditioning very noisy, wake me up all the time, very hard mattresses, look like they are too old. Every thing else was fine. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. I will recommend this hotel for the location and for the service, but not for the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Staff, service, location - everything! Examplary”
Reviews.Author: kathryn7grant
Reviews.Content: Thsi was the second event that my group chose to host at the Tuscan Inn. I was pleased with every aspect ot the experience and am lookng to book again for next year. The staff from Jan Misch on through everyone with whom I had contact was friendly, helpful and very efficient. The room was set up exactly as our speaker's wished. The food presentation was lovely and delicious. The sleeepng rooms are very nice and the location cannot be beat. I highly recommend The Tuscan Inn for individuals travelling to S.F, and for groups to consider using this excellent facility

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: Freakoftheuniverse
Reviews.Content: One of the best places to stay in SF. There are tonnes of things to see and do within a kilometre of this hotel. There is even a supermarket and pharmacy across the road for emergency snacks and blister treatment. The rooms are very clean, mattresses soft and delightful to sleep on, and a good selection of TV channels are available. Wine tasting occurs in the lobby. Easily my favourite stay on my SF trip

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location!”
Reviews.Author: palmettosojourner
Reviews.Content: With concerns re:parking cost($44-AAA discount to $40) per day,we booked super saver rate of$119. We arrived early-2PM. We were permitted to check in early w/no upcharge. A lot of interests within walking distance. 'F' line just around the corner. $2. per person per 3 hr time block. Several dining options close by. Walgeens,Safeway,Trader Joes nearby. We had booked 9am alcatraz tour. Loaded car before we left. Inquired @ front desk that we would not be back until 4 or 5 pm when tours were completed. We were told that after 3 pm a $5 per hour fee would be tacked on. We arrived back@5:15 pm w/no added fee. Two days parking for $40 was great. Most lots were in the $30 per day range. With the very crowded and expensive parking problem,location near piers,fisherman's wharf,dining,shopping,and low cost public transportation is very important. Very good front desk,valet,bellman. Very clean property. Only downside-Ac/heat thermostat was difficult to operate. Front desk assistance w/thermostat was no help. Thermostat had 4 different pre-programmed times/temps. After 30-45 minutes,I determined that #2 program was valid for that time. Temperature inside had dropped to 65. It soon recovered to 74. I would stay in this property if in SF/Pier area again.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not special”
Reviews.Author: wwwright
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan inn is a pleasant enough hotel near the touristy part of SF, and as we like to walk, we enjoyed wandering up to North Beach for coffee and out along the wharf for time in the sun. Other reviews make much of the staff, but I found them competent but not particularly friendly. This is true for the valets as well as the clerks. The morning coffee is a nice perk, and they work hard to accommodate the wine crowd in the evenings. The free Wifi is nice, though the public computer was not very available, and the printer didn't work. The housekeeping staff is excellent and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great restaurant, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: reddove113
Reviews.Content: In short... The location is one of the best of hotels in Fisherman's Wharf - just a few blocks to everywhere and a 0.7 mile walk to the heart of Little Italy. Public transportation very easy to access within a 2 block radius but if you need to taxi down to the Financial District/museum area it's only about $9. Literally around the corner is a Trader Joe's and Safeway, Borders, Cost Plus World Market and Starbucks. The main intersection of FW is 1.5 blocks away, Pier 39 is a 5 minute walk. The staff was very knowledgable and hospitable. We ate dinner at the hotel's Cafe Pescatore and was very impressed - not the typical hotel restaurant. The king bed room was a little cozy with the end of the bed being 2 feet away from the dresser...but the bathroom was nice sized, the bed was comfortable and I'd stay in the room again in a heartbeat. It was at the back of the hotel so no view, but very quiet. Who really stands there and stares for a view out the hotel window anyway - we were out doing things! Wine reception in the early evening was nice. Concierge was helpful but pointed guests toward the mainstream tour companies and didn't give suggestions for the mom-and-pop companies/restaurants so be sure to check into those on your own. Didn't do anything except sleep and shower here, and eat in the restaurant, as we were busy out in town the entire time so I can't review what others might consider important - fitness center, conference rooms, etc. We parked our car here (valet only) for $44 a night - the hotel doesn't own the garage so they have to pay to use some other company's...hence a pretty high price. I loved everything and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: bractullo
Reviews.Content: Endorse all recent positive reviews. Rooms relatively small but clean and quiet. Corridors could do with being freshened up though. Like a few Best Westerns organised a social get-together each evening between 5:00 and 6:00 with complimentary wine. Great for swapping stories with fellow travellers. Public area comfortable if a little draughty. Very central with Fisherman's Wharf; the cable cars; eateries etc all within easy walking distance. Stored luggage; printed boarding passes; and, organised transport for us on our departure day very efficiently. Wi-fi free and good. At $130 per night seemd a little pricey but maybe that's what you have to pay for the location. Only real complaint was, even though we had paid in advance, they insisted on putting a non-negotiable $50 per night "hold" on our credit card. So that will be $150 not available for 7 days. Got the impression it was in case we trashed the room or stole from the mini-bar. Bad initial impression as I wondered what sort of dive we had booked into where the guests were in the habit of doing that sort of thing - and that took a while to wear off.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, watch for the parking trap - it may be free on the street”
Reviews.Author: TheRevLondon
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for the second time. All very reasonable, professional good location and nice touches like pizza and wine in the evening and free wifi. Yay. A nod too to Kaelyn (sorry if the spelling is wrong) for being very helpful. It can be noisy in rooms facing the courtyard because air conditioning/heating/fan units all back onto it and the noise carries. But they offered to move us, and anyway earplugs were good enough for a restful night. The main gripe is because this time I had a hire car. Headline price $44 for 24 hours. Ouch. Still, the website said "For just an additional $10.00 more on top of your rate, you are receiving parking. What could be more perfect than that?" Except that it wasn't $10 on top of my rate, it was $10 on top of the headline rack rate, which was already $50 more than the discounted one, even for last minute bookings. So it works out as $60 for parking, not $10. A bit sneaky? I phoned them to see if they could do anything. No good. Eventually I booked, and decided to suffer the charge at the hotel. When I arrived, they aggressively pushed the parking. They offered to discount it to $40. As I unloaded our luggage we must have been asked three or four times if we wanted them to park the car. When I asked about alternatives, they said there was another car park over the road, but they told me only the hotel allowed me to come and go. But they failed to tell me that 100 yards from the hotel there was FREE STREET PARKING (turn right, and it's opposite the large bus park). Albeit that I needed to check what days there would be street cleaning. But from Saturday evening to Monday afternoon I was able to leave the car without charge. Luckily, I stumbled across this because I went straight out on a drive after arriving at the hotel. But if I'd paid $80-$120 dollars for hotel parking and found the street parking was free, I'd be furious. The way the hotel pushed their parking rather than telling me all my options was disappointing at best. And less likely to trust them, which was a shame. Aside from this, the recommendation stands!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: tusli
Reviews.Content: I was leary of booking at this hotel since the value for its location seemed too good to be true. The only drawbacks were that the room did not have all the wonderful amenities that some do and it was very small. That being said, it had everything we needed. Most of all it was immaculate. It is by all means adequate for a short stay and a good value for the money. The location is perfect, great for walking to the piers, Ghirardelli Square, etc. and easy access for drives to area attractions. The staff is efficient, friendly, and very helpful. The happy hour is a nice touch but don't expect much. (We quickly passed on the "Two Buck Chuck." We had dinner at Cafe Pescatore (their on site restaurant). The food was very good and Marlowe, our server, was great fun.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: mexicolindo2007
Reviews.Content: Exceptional hotel. Our experience was wonderful. Hotel was clean and near everything. Tim took care of our group reservations in January. He was very patient and courteous throughout the reservation process. Thank you Tim for all your help.

Reviews.Title: “Excellently located”
Reviews.Author: EpicGuy43
Reviews.Content: We were extremely tired after our Amtrak train, 'The Coast Starlight', ran two hours late. The rooms were well designed and comfortable. Sleep quality was great.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and different”
Reviews.Author: MrP78_11
Reviews.Content: Pros * As soon as we walked through the front doors, we felt a very different and warm feel, compared to the other hotels we stayed in while in America. The staff seemed to have a genuine pride in their city. * This was the only hotel to respond to my email enquiries. The information provided was accurate and thorough. * The hotel provided complimentary wifi and a PC in the lobby. * The housekeeping did an excellent job. * Great location NEG * Only one, some of the linen needed upgrading (a few tattered sheets and some with cigarette holes).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! We highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: TerriKay
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome hotel, right off Fisherman Wharf and within walking distance of lots of great sites. The room was beautiful, the bed was comfortable and the attached restaurant was amazing! Some of the best food we've ever eaten! The concierge was wonderful. We told him what we wanted to accomplish during our visit and he was able to advise us, help us get set up with a great tour, and make us feel like valued guests the whole time. Everything about this hotel was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny!!”
Reviews.Author: angie8023
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a Monday and Tuesday night. Parking ran us 38.00 a night. If you have AAA they give you a small discount. We were near everything. The room itself was clean and comfortable. They was a fridge in the room but no microwave. The front desk guy was very helpful and always in a good mood. The only issue we had was on the last morning of our stay. The maid came by twice within 10 minutes to see if we had left. Quite annoying when you're trying to pack. Keep in mind check out was at noon and she was knocking at 9:30. We had also called for a luggage cart and waited 20 minutes to not receive one. Overall our stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - this is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tira_20
Reviews.Content: You are sure that you're in San Francisco when you stay at Tuscan Inn. The hotel is located near Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, cable cars and just a walk from the view of Golden Gate Bridge. Lots of restaurants and shops (and tourists) near by. Be aware that valet parking is expensive (about 50 USD pr night). The breakfast at the restaurant at the hotel is also quite expensive and nothing speciel. We didn't try the restaurant at lunch or dinner. The rooms were clean, and the service was great. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patti97321
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan Inn was everything I hoped for. A very nice, upscale hotel for a reasonable price in a very centrally located area of San Francisco. The room was very nicely decorated, very clean and quiet. The staff was very courteous and friendly, right down to the maintenence man painting in the hall. Safeway is right across the street as well as Trader Joe's in the next block. Catching the cable cars, doubledecker busses was within a couple of blocks. The boat to Alcatraz is a 15 minute walk. I thought San Francisco is a very tourest friendly city. I am sorry it took so long to visit. I hope it won't be our last trip.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in good tourist location”
Reviews.Author: CanberraJenny
Reviews.Content: Friendly, clean hotel in good location. The rooms are quite small. The happy hour is friendly and welcome. Breakfast is quite good - possible to augment free continental breakfast for small price.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: shelkar
Reviews.Content: our family of 5 stayed in interconnecting rooms & found the hotel charming & great value for money. Very friendly staff. Great location. Heartily reccommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Potty41
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Trailfinders and we were not disappointed. The staff were very friendly and the concierge was extremely helpful and nothing was to much trouble, The hotel was spotlessly clean (everywhere). There reception looked lovely with a big Christmas Tree and open fire. We were able to walk everywhere from this location i.e. Golden Gate Bridge, China Town, Nob Hill and it is close to a Street Car terminus. The only down side was the bar shut at 9.30 pm but what I dont know is if this was because it is classed as out of season. Great restaurant attached as well. The air conditioning was a little noisy but it cold easily be turned off completely.

Reviews.Title: “Still a lovely little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fromHB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here several years ago and really were impressed, but never wrote a review. Happily we stayed here again last weekend and still found it to be a great little hotel. It is well located near Ghirardelli Square and Fisherman's Wharf. We caught the Cable Car about 2 blocks away and were in Union Square in about 25 minutes. We also walked to to the Ferry Building (to make room for all the delicious food) which was about 1 mile away. The hotel itself is nicely decorated. Rooms are smaller as expected for a boutique hotel, but very comfortable. The staff were helpful and we were able to check in @ 12pm. Enjoying the wine reception by the fireplace on a rainy day was nice even though they were pouring 2 buck chuck! This hotel is a gem and we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fab, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: wapitbe
Reviews.Content: Apologies for the delay in posting this reply! We spent five days at this hotel in April, really enjoyed our time there and when we go back to SF, will be staying there again. Hotel is very clean, staff friendly and helpful, rooms well appointed and our room (on our request was facing in instead of to the street) was peaceful. We had breakfast each day in the adjoining restaurant, again, the staff were very pleasant and coffee was never ending! An excellent location for exploring SF, very close to Fisherman's Wharf. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Dont' Bother!”
Reviews.Author: gmanagr
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days here and were without hot water for 3 hours the first night. I was treated very rudely by the night assistant and promised a comped night for my troubles, which I never received. The place was filled with barking animals and if your idea of a wine receptions, which is supplied with $2 Trader Joe's wines, than this place may be for you! I would never stay there again! The restaurant is also terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Eden, would have been the next best place”
Reviews.Author: Magellan222
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough about how wonderful the staff and location of this hotel. The concierge service was excellent, all of our bookings and tours went off without a hitch. Thanks again Hugo. Comfortable, quite, and clean,kudos to the housekeeping staff!!! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A great locaton, service and comfort!”
Reviews.Author: hilmcleod
Reviews.Content: Tuscan Inn is close enough for easy walking access to the piers and all their attractions, but just far enough away for peace and quiet. We were steps away from transit which got us anywhere we wanted to go outside of walking distance. My adult daughter and I shared a double/double room with excellent beds, modern decor and a shining, spacious bathroom. The fridge and safe were appreciated. The hotel offered the option of skipping the daily cleaning, which of course is not unique, but new in my experience was the $5.00 voucher for use in the restaurant. We did this twice. Added to the 15% discount offered upon arrival, it was a nice little savings for an excellent meal. We recommend the special (available on Friday and Saturday) - cioppino, a delicious seafood stew which includes the local dungeness crab. A real treat! You might want to make a reservation as it was always bustling - a good sign. Oh yes - you can also bring your own wine (if it's not on their list), which we really liked because we had purchased wine on our travels through Paso Robles and liked being able to enjoy it with an excellent meal. The service was stellar (thanks, Velda), and Nick the host was a gem. (He went to the trouble of remembering our names from when my husband ordered champagne to welcome us to our room upon arrival.) We also enjoyed the daily manager's wine reception in the lobby. The front desk staff were extremely helpful, and kept an eye on my rented mobility scooter which was delivered and picked up from the hotel (by Scootaround, a rental agency). The hotel was completely accessible for my use of the scooter. We had a great time in San Francisco, thanks in part to this worry-free hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: UkBrookes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2010 and had a fantastic experience. Our room was spotless, staff friendly, lovely reception area - home from home.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: mfw100
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times on business. It's not a bad hotel by any means but doesn't really stand out in any particular way. Having said that, the rooms are comfortable and front desk staff are friendly. Free Wi-Fi is a big plus for guests. The best thing is the location - very close to Fishermans Wharf so it's ideal for tourists. I would recommend getting a cab if you're going downtown, as there are usually huge queues for the cable car. There are plenty of good restaurants in this area of SF, so I'd recommend going out for dinner. Can't comment on value as I don't pay for the room myself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: etan92612
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to everything in Fisherman's Wharf. Felt safe walking around at night. Five minute walk to Ripley's and Burger King. Short walk to both cable car lines. Safeway is just across the street. Front desk is exceptionally helpful. Nice to have coffee available in the lobby in the morning. Pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay if you want to be near Fishermans Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Michael255093
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in San Francisco. As a lot of first time tourists do, I stayed very near to Fishermans Wharf. As hotels in the Fishermans Wharf area go, this one is a beaut. It's less than five minutes walk to the famous sign. You can be at Pier 39 in under 10 minutes walk and take in all the shops or the famous sea lions. There are two lines of the cable car within 10 minutes walk as well. The bed was quite comfortable. The rooms are clean and very acceptable, though I really do HATE low flow showerheads, and the bathroom here was guilty of having one installed. I would have appreciated some curtains on the windows (not just shutters) because too much light got through when I was trying to recover from some jet lag. Do be aware that there are charges for using the in-room safe. There are complimentary wine tastings in the lobby early the evening, which are a great way to sample some local products and say hello to a few other guests. Staff are courteous and very friendly. The concierge service was especially helpful. The restaurant in the building serves a very nice breakfast and has a simple bar if you're after a late night drink, although prices are a tad on the expensive side. There is a supermarket and drug store over the road and can be reached in three or four minutes from the hotel's front door. McDonalds, Subway and Burger King are all nearby. During my stay, there was only one elevator operating. It was very frustrating! I would imagine when they have them both working again it wouldn't be so bad. My experience was that it was quite an ordeal just to get upstairs! By biggest tip for anyone staying in Fishermans Wharf is to get away and see more of the city beyond Fishermans Wharf! Take a cable car and see the city on the move. Go and explore Union Square or Haight-Ashbury. It's a great city and it would be shame to spend too much of it in (what I found out to be) the kitsch, overly touristy part of town!

Reviews.Title: “Would love to talk to the decorator. What were they thinking?”
Reviews.Author: skydoc101
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance to virtually all the tourist destinations around Fisherman's wharf. Trolley right around the corner. Parking outrageous, of course. We stayed in a "suite" since I often read in the middle of the night. It seemed like one good sized room had been divided in two by a wall. The bedroom was completely filled by the bed with barely walking room around the edge. The bathroom door could only be opened partway as it hit the bed. And, since there was no heat in the bathroom and the wall connected to the outside staircase, the door had to stay open or it was freezing in there. Made that middle of the night trip interesting-close door to get out of bed, open door to enter, close door, reverse. The door to the shower (no tub) opened away from the towel rack, though there was an entirely empty wall on the other side, guaranteeing water on the floor. Plenty of hot water with decent pressure. Heaters are the old fashioned, noisy kind and blow right on your face, if you are on that side of the bed. Our view was of the brick wall next door. Could see the sky by leaning out the window. Staff was friendly and helpful, but not very knowledgeable about the area. Only one elevator operational. One computer and printer in the lobby. Overall, there are nicer, less expensive places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tripper096
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Nov. 2010 on a family trip. Overall, thought this was a good place to stay, our 2nd trip to San Fran. Pros: Convenient location near Fisherman's Wharf, easy walk to everything. I think the reason for most of the glowing reviews is the extremely reasonable rate for a San Fran hotel. This is not the Ritz Charles, but it is a very nicely updated, clean, and comfortable hotel. Rooms were small but modern with a Tuscan theme, well-maintained. Two of our family had interior rooms including myself, and I personally slept like a rock. We stayed at Union Square last time and I liked this location better, easy walk to restaurants and shops. Wine reception was a bonus (though about what you'd expect for free wine) and lobby was not extremely large and became very crowded during that time, nowhere to sit. Ate at the restaurant a couple times for lunch and dinner and it too was good. Female concierge was very helpful and all employees were pleasant. Cons: Small rooms, wierd setup with the sink outside the bathroom a few feet from the bed. No way to turn the bathroom light on without turning the light over the sink too, which illuminated the room in the middle of the night, waking the other person up in the case of couples. My brother had an exterior room and said that there was a lot of noise both from the street and the maid service starting in early am. My mom was not happy that she caught the maids throwing the decorative bed pillows on the floor while cleaning the room, though I'd imagine that a lot of hotel employees probably do all kinds of things while cleaning that no one really wants to know about. Anyway, she later got sick that week and blamed it on the maids . . . Overall, would come back again and would recommend. However, might also consider spending a little more $$$ and staying at the Argonaut or Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mollie1England
Reviews.Content: Went on holiday with my husband and our daughter in October 2010 and stayed in the Tuscan Inn for a week. The staff were so friendly and helpful giving us directions on where to go and where we can get the different transports.The hotel is clean, warm and inviting after a day out on our feet. The open fire is lovely to sit by after a long day. The hotel is in a great location just off the Wharf and it's quite and safe. Transport was very easy to access and the attractions where walking distance away (5 Mins). The free breakfast was a added bonus and we did pick off the ordinary menu as well. Go out and try a diner one morning it's an experience they eat so much!!! Great eating places on Pier 39 - we tried them all. The Bay cruise is good fun, speed boat is brilliant if you like that kind of thing. Go on the Trams, hang off the side of them, eat cheesecake in Macy's it's huge!!! Great shopping in Union Square take the credit card!! Mr Toads car tours of San Fran are just fantasic - they are based just down from the hotel. The Alcatraz trip will be a lifetime memory for us all - my 8 year old daughter was so interested and speechless when on the audio tour and we were blown away by it all! Great holiday, Great memories! Would I recommend that hotel - YES Would I stay there again - YES

Reviews.Title: “Great price for the area”
Reviews.Author: adrianfristensky
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great nightly rate for what you get in SanFran, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “very clean and friendly hotel ,good location for fishermans wharf”
Reviews.Author: nats4646
Reviews.Content: if i booked hotel again would ask for internal room,found the road outside noisey at all times.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel only 5 minutes walk from fisherman's wharf”
Reviews.Author: travellingman062
Reviews.Content: generally a nice clean comfortable place, not cheap but reasonable value considering the location. they do a basic breakfast included in the room rate which was very nice. You pay extra for cooked food but there is far too much! service was ok, staff efficient rather than friendly. Although they forgot to get our laundry done when requested so we waited 2 days for that. Room comfortable and had a minibar and coffee maker. Perfect location 5 minutes walk from fisherman's wharf and all the attractions there. They are also served by an airport shuttle bus service which is useful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoMermaid
Reviews.Content: Simply put - this is a very nice hotel in a wonderful location. You won't be disappointed. It was very clean - service was great. Rooms tastefully decorated. I used to live in San Francisco, so I know the city. Had a family event to attend - and while we normally wouldn't stay in Fisherman's Wharf - it was where we needed to be for this event and this hotel is in a great location. Easy to get to --- For anyone who complains about the noise from the street? This hotel is no worse than any other hotel would be in Fisherman's Wharf (or for that matter - most hotels anywhere in the city) -- because guess what? You are in a city. Not the suburbs. Not the country.

Reviews.Title: “Good position and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: marieanddon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to get to, using BART and taxi from Embarcado. Reception was welcoming and staff helpful, we got offer that included 2 free cable car tickets and breakfast. Every evening includes wine and nibbles. The room was clean and had 1 bed and TV. The bathroom was clean. I would stay here again if deal is good as very near Wharf and cable cars. Free WIFI in bedrooms

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in the Fisherman's Wharf area.”
Reviews.Author: debbie92284
Reviews.Content: I booked this room on their advertisement that they were close to Fisherman's Wharf. And they were right! I loved this hotel, even with the couple of quirks I had. First, I arrived after driving for almost 8 hours, I was tired. As soon as I walked in the lady at the front desk dropped what she was doing to check in me in. Impressive. While checking in I was told that I was getting a complimentary upgrade to a King size room. "Fabulous" I thought to myself. I had a lot of bags as I was staying for 3 days while on a road trip. The bellboy ran, got a cart and took everything up instantly, while the attendant parked my car. So far so good" I'm thinking. Then I got into my "kingsize" room. I own a king size bed and this was not one. This was quirk one. But the bellboy had already offloaded my luggage, I was beat, and it was late in the evening so I did not call to make an issue of it. But the room I did get was cute, clean, quiet and comfortable. It even came with a lighted, magnifying makeup mirror. The hotel does have wireless internet that works like a charm and they have the ability to print things for you if needed. I was there on a package deal so my room included complimentary Continental Breakfast in the attached Pescatore (?) Cafe, a nice touch. In the mornings they have the local newspaper there and a coffee/tea station set up until 10 I think they said. The brochure said hot chocolate too but I didn't find that. The restaurant was charming and I got just as excellent service there as I did in the hotel. Nick greeted us for a couple of mornings and made us feel right at home. They have an "upgrade" menu for the continental ticket holders and for $5 you can choose something off this menu instead of the standard bread and fruit. The Apetito (a ham and cheese omelet) was wonderful served with homestyle potatoes, juice and coffee. In the evenings from 5 to 6 they have a complimentary wine reception that was a welcomed treat after a long day of walking. Nice to sit by the fireplace sipping wine while unwinding and a great way to "meet your neighbors" a darling couple from Cincinnati joined my husband and I for a nice fireside chat. The brochure said there were to be tidbits to go along with the wine but all I found was a crumbly tray and I got there at 5:10 and stayed until after 6 and nothing was refilled, so that was a bit disappointing, but the wine was fabulous. I had booked the tour to Alcatraz and took off walking in the morning to get to the dock for boarding, what a nice walk. Out the front door two blocks and turn right easy directions and I was there within 10 minutes. The parking at the hotel is valet only but I never used my car once. I walked every where around the area and the two times I needed to go any distance the attendant out front hailed a cab for me and i was whisked away within seconds. No waiting around. So my only other quirk was the parking rate. It was $25 a night with my package, higher if you didn't have the discount. So even at $25 I thought that was a bit pricey, but it didn't detract from my enjoyment. Every so often I would have a question about the area (directions/where to go) and no matter who I asked up front I got a courteous and immediate answer. Even when checking out I must have been asked by 5 different employees if I needed directions or a map. It was a wonderful knowing that even after checking out I was still being taken care of. They currently are working on one of the two elevators but even that didn't slow down getting around. I saw doggie treats by the front door and I can only speculate that they allow pets. I didn't see any while I was there and I definitely didn't smell any which was a plus. Overall, this hotel was great! Excellent location for the Fisherman's Wharf area. Excellent staff. Nice amenities. It would be absolutely perfect if the parking was included or reduced even more, but I digress. I'd stay here again and in fact will be staying here again on my return visit in a couple of months. Maybe then I'll see what the King size room is like.

Reviews.Title: “No Security - No Service - No Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: perkinswi
Reviews.Content: At Check-in, my husband and I were told we were being upgraded to a suite. We thought, "how nice - as Best Western Rewards members this must be a bonus and a great way to end our trip to California". We were wrong! The room appeared nice, but little did we know it was located by the "All Night Dumpster" It started at Dark, I called the front desk to inform them, right out side our window - people digging in the dumpster - could they send security? No, Why? No Security on site...no one to check it out. Tried to watch a PPV Movie, the signal was so bad, fuzzy, could not enjoy it. - called the front desk , no resolution. In the Morning at Check out, I explained what happened, they were less than responsive. Credited us for the movie - OK. Stay here if you want to be in a bad neighborhood, no security- homeless dumpster divers all night - pan handlers - and a front desk staff that could care less!

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are right!”
Reviews.Author: WindsorTenor
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the other reviews from TripAdvisor. An excellent location (2 blocks to Pier 39 and then on to Fisherman's Wharf) and 1 block from the Historic F Line makes this hotel an easy transport to anywhere in the city. The rooms are small by most hotel standards, but this is a boutique hotel and, as such, the rooms are more than roomy enough. Check in was efficient and friendly. One of the elevators is under repair but this did not slow down access to the room or leaving. The bathroom was spotless (a must for me) and the in room safe was a nice added extra. Staff were friendly. I must relate this story. One evening, upon approaching the reservation desk, two staff members were chatting. They stopped their conversation (IN MID SENTENCE) and attended to my needs immediately. WOW! The wireless internet in the room worked on my netbook and my Ipad. I would recommend this property to any of my friends and associates.

Reviews.Title: “White Glove Clean, Comfy Home Like, Lightening Fast Internet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debbie S
Reviews.Content: Even the baseboards in the bathroom where dust free! Slept like a baby on comfy king bed. Greeted with fresh baked cookies. Amazingly fast inernet. Let us check in hours early AND upgraded our room to a king deluxe! Bridjette was perfect at answering ALL questions and helping with directions and reservations. Wine hour is so relaxing. Beautiful lobby and rooms. Pictures can't do it justice. Location is PERFECT! Grocery and Drug store next door. PLEASE VIST THEM - you will NOT be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “As good as the write ups say”
Reviews.Author: collettebristol_U_K_
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here,from the 1st of October.We had a late check in,but had to wait half an hour or so for our room.As we had spent the last 14 hours travelling we could have done without that! However,the room was lovely,very clean and a good size.The bathroom was huge,and had everything you needed. The staff were extremley pleasant,and the entire stay was lovely.We would definately return to this hotel if we go back to S.F. Big thanks

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Retire09Uk
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location for Fisherman`s Wharf. Staff are friendly and the Managers free drinks 5 - 6 is a great way to meet other fellow travellers and pass on advice and experiences, plus the wine is very welcome at the end of a busy sight-seeing day!! We used the hop on hop off buses which were a great way to see the city and booked it on line before we left, the bus stop to join the excursion is just one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: rvwithrick
Reviews.Content: My wife & I picked the Tuscan Inn for it's proximity to Fishermans Wharf,Pier 39, The cable car & trolly system ( all within a couple of blocks). The hotel had a very pleasent warm boutique atmosphere. We took advantage of the evening wine reception to socialize with the other guests, some just happened to be going on the same tours we had booked. The hotel is the pick-up point for many tours. There are many moderately priced (I-Hop,Denny's) places for breakfast, as well as grocery and drug stores near by. The best deal for getting around San Francisco is a MUNI PASS @ $26.00 for 7days unlimited use on all public transportation including trolly & cable cars. Without the pass cable cars are $5.00 each time you get on. Staying at the Tuscan Inn helped make this trip one of our most memorable.

Reviews.Title: “good location, convenient to fisherman's wharf”
Reviews.Author: rumitummy
Reviews.Content: the room was average in terms of size and cleanliness. the convenience to fisherman's wharf was very worth it. parking is expensive in the area, but street parking is available if you are willing to do a little walking.

Reviews.Title: “Five star stay in a three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goodonz
Reviews.Content: At the end of September we thoroughly enjoyed a two night stay at the Tuscan Inn. We were not disappointed with the size of our room and the accomodations as some have related in their reviews. We found the room size comparable to the rate charged for it. Also the queen bed provided a comfortable night's sleep. The Tuscan Inn's location was great for the dropoff of our rental car prior to our check in. We had used it to tour the wine country and did not want to deal with a car in SF. E-prise Rental was only one block away on Beach St. The Inn's location enabled us to walk to either Mason or Hyde cable car stops, the F-line is only a block away, and Muni bus stop is only two or so blocks away at Columbus. We used the Muni to get to the Golden Gate Bridge on our way to a round trip walk across it. Ferry piers for Alcatraz and Sausalito are only a short walk away. The Inn's staff were all very friendly and helpful from the front desk to the concierge and bellmen. During our stay we met the manager, Jan Minsch, and told her we were very pleased with our decision to stay at her BW Tuscan Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & value at the Tuscan Inn”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravel1970
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its location and I was not disappointed! It's in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf, but very clean and safe. I was able to walk from Ghiradelli Square after my tea at Crown & Crumpet. During my late night munchies, I was able to walk down to Boudin's Cafe & Bakery and get a nice bowl of chowder and people watch. The hotel service was quick and friendly. There's also a very nice & cozy fireplace in the lobby to relax and read a book in front of. The room I stayed in was clean and comfortable. I also liked the morning coffee & tea service in the lobby. I stayed here 2 nights and it was totally worth it. The convenience of the location was the best part. They also have a really nice restaurant connected to it. I had dinner there one night and service was very friendly and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed, Great Location, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: jms30s
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my sister, room was comfortable enough for two people who spent very little time in the room, not much walking space but the beds & pillows were GREAT! Very clean, good cable reception & lighting. Wifi service in room was non-existent but I got great tech support the 2 times I called, It turned out the room we were in was sandwiched between the elevator & ice machine which interferred with the Wifi. Was offerred a change of room but we were already very comfortable. Wifi service in lobby is GREAT! Hotel cafe, Cafe Pescatore, delicious breakfast but only til 10AM (or maybe it was 11AM), then closed til lunch. Ask concierge for directions to Pat's Cafe where you can get full breakfast all day long, open through lunch, no dinner hours during our visit -- great food & service, a little slow if Pat is alone but well worth the wait. At check-in at the Tusvan Inn, we got a 15% discount coupon for Cafe Pescatore. Ask for one each day of your visit if you will be making use of the in-house cafe. Great location, Safeway market / mini-mall about 1/2 a block away, safe area, walking distance to all points of interest & transportation. Only concern at the Tuscan Inn was the mirror over the beds -- earthquake?!

Reviews.Title: “Surprising!”
Reviews.Author: Marie F
Reviews.Content: I have travelled a lot and in general the Best Western are barely a two stars. This hotel felt like a four stars. They were really accomodating, very polite and extremely helpfull. The rooms are not very big, but clean and pretty up to date. The location is perfect, exactly two blocs from Pier 39.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: DianneS50
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Tuscan Inn. It was very close to all the attractions at Fisherman's Whart and to the Cable car. Clean, Good on-site resturant, Good service. Comfortable beds. Would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Stetsonzhere
Reviews.Content: I knew nothing of San Francisco, so when my first choice fell through, I decided on Tuscan Inn, in large part, based on reviews on this site. We were pleasantly surprised at how the lobby looked. It basically looked exactly as the picture on the Tuscan Inn webpage. Our room was small, but good enough for 2 people who travel light and don't spend lots of time in the room. It was nicely decorated and very clean. The bathroom was roomy compared to a lot of hotel rooms I've been in. The location could not be better. There are lots of attractions in walking distances of the hotel. There is a Safeway grocery store across the street, and a Trader Joe's behind the hotel. There is free wi-fi access, as well as a computer in the lobby for customer use. In the morning, there is coffee and tea served in the lobby. In the evening, there is wine served in the lobby, limit 2 per guest. Information of note on this: I believe the website used to say there was biscotti served with the coffee, but no longer says that, and there isn't any served. It's possible I read this in some reviews. Also, it appeared something had been served on a large plate at the wine reception we attended, but we got there 10 minutes after the reception started and the plate was empty and not replenished. Not a problem however. More notes: At check-in we were asked if we needed the key to the wet bar, which we declined. However, this cut us off from the use of the refrigerator. I don't know if there was a fee for the key to the wet bar, but if you're interested in using the refrigerator, be sure to ask up front. Also, the wet bar/refrigerator is built into the dresser in the room, so drawer space is severely limited. Also, be warned that the street in front of the hotel is quite dark at night. There is a lack of lighting on this street. While we didn't feel unsafe, it is worth mentioning. Not that this is the hotel's fault. Now, the bad news: Some of the staff at this hotel is problematic. The night I was at the wine reception, I overheard the guy serving the wine say something about one of the hotel guests that would probably have caused a fight if the guest had heard him say it, and deservedly so. The housekeeping staff knocks lightly then lets themselves in without much wait. We were dressed, but it could have caused embarrassment... twice. But my biggest staff problem: We arrived at the hotel early, and our room wasn't ready, which was no big deal. The woman at the desk went ahead and checked us in, and told us if we gave her our cell phone number she would call when the room was ready. Then she took our luggage to the side of the counter and told us they would store it until we returned. Four hours later, and no phone call, we returned to the hotel. A different woman was at the desk (the first woman was still around), and checked in all over again, and our room was ready. Lo and behold our luggage was where we left it, available to anyone who reached for it. I realize they were busy, but this did not leave me with a good feeling for the front desk. All complaints and comments aside, this was a good choice in hotel. In the event I return to San Francisco, I will check at the Tuscan Inn for availability first.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western's really are the Best”
Reviews.Author: LY55
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Best Western Tuscan Inn in July this year. We chose a Best Western because while travelling around America we found them to always be clean, comfortable, affordable, and safe. This Best Western is no exception. Probably even better than most in the chain. The rooms are decorated with a very modern touch, not very big but the decor really is stylish. The staff were friendly and unobtrusive. The location was perfect for our first few days in SF. The only problem was the parking fees, but we found that San Fran is notorious for charging $30 per day for parking at every hotel. One big tip for San Fran - Don't hire a car. Sure it's comfortable, but public transport is excellent in SF, not like LA at all.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable "boutique" hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: tunagary
Reviews.Content: Third stay @ the Tuscan. We love it here--affordable, quiet & CLEAN boutique hotel in fun location. We enjoyed the attached Pescatore Ristorante for breakfast and a quick dinner apres theater. Use your AAA discount for best room and parking rate. (However, our friends parked for free @ the Safeway across the street.) Very close to cable cars, Alcatraz, Beach Blanket Babylon theater, and Fisherman's Wharf restaurants, etc. (You can be in Union Square in no time on the cable car, which is fun. We bought a city pass which is good for 9 days and enabled us to UNLIMITED Muni & Cablecar service and one time entrance to lots of great sites, including the Academy of Sciences--awesome aquarium and planetarium, the De Young Museum, Modern Art Museum, Bay Cruise, and much more. The morning coffee and afternoon wine in the lobby are great for meeting new people. We love SF and will return, and will definitely stay at The Tuscan Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Yorkies65
Reviews.Content: We had heard that around Fisherman's Wharf it is noisy but this hotel is tucked away a couple of blocks from the action and in an ideal position for everything. The room was excellent and the concierge very good at explaining sightseeing options. The complementery wine reception in the afternoons was very welcome and although we had booked room only we were given vouchers for continental breakfast in the very nice restaurant. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Fishermans Wharf Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicnac31
Reviews.Content: Dropped into San Francisco for a few days on the way back to UK from Hawaii on a holiday of a lifetime with my husband. First impressions normally say a lot so I was shocked when I arrived as the decor in the lobby wasn't great and reception staff were not in uniform. However, don't be put off by first impressions as the rooms are modern and have very tasteful decor and the level of service was remarkable. Located in the centre of Fishermans Wharf this hotel is close to the Cable Car turnaround and only a short walk to Pier 39. Supermarket and pharmacy located in the next block. Good pick-up location for Tours. Speak to the Concierge about trips; Napa Valley for wine tasting, Muir Woods - Redwood Forest. Alternatively, why not hire a bike and cross the Golden Gate before heading down to Sausalito, take in the boutiques and cafes before taking the ferry back to San Francisco (only costs about 9 dollars one way). Despite staying in Fishermans Wharf it is a must to visit Union Square: get take-out from the Cheesecake Factory in Macy's and sit in Union Square to watch the passers by. Shopping here is excellent so leave space in your suitcase. An excellent hotel that I would recommend. Everyone is welcome!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MB123England
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Oct 08 as part of our honeymoon tour of Hawaii and Cailfornia. Great location and good value were the main reasons we stayed here. Overall a very nice italian style Best Western in the heart of one of the main tourist hot spots. Rooms very clean and tidy. For the money the rooms were much better than we were expecting. Didnt eat at the hotel but had a drink with my wife. We got fleeced on the wine and beer ($38 for a bottle of bud and a small glass of wine) left a bitter taste in the mouth but overall we were very happy with our choice. Bathroom of a very clean standard also. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spurs1960
Reviews.Content: Started our road trip at the Tuscan hotel, what a great place to start. great location 7min walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Staff very helpful, loved the wine at 5. Rooms very clean & exactly as you see them in photos, beds very comfy, we had 3 great nights there. There is one downful you have to pay $42 per night to park your car there. If going i would recomend you book your Alcatraz tickets in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bed bugs bite!”
Reviews.Author: Crow101
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Tuscan Inn and were checked in by the lovely receptionist, who was very helpful. That is the best I can say about this hotel. The rooms are extremely tired and need a major refurbishment. Location is good if you like to be close to fisherman's wharf. If you prefer the action of San Fran city centre, then it's a cable-car into Union Square which is fun but expensive (USD$5 per person each way). Next time I would stay in Union Square. During our stay, over three nights, I woke up with a few bites but didn't think much of it. However, on our last night my husband and I woke up with bites all up our backs and legs. BED BUGS! When we checked out we told the receptionist about our bites and his response of "thanks for that" was unbelieveably underwhelming. No apology or anyother comment and began to move on to the next customer. Very disappointing. We will not be staying here again but we will be back to this fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “Location, facilities - it's got it all !”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryLuvva
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights just before Labor Day weekend. Valet parking was expensive, but we payed for the security. The alternative would have been to park in the (insecure) car park serving the small shopping mall around the corner. The hotel itself was excellent. Staff were courteous and helpful; the room was exquisite and the location was perfect. Just a few hundred yards from Pier 39 and a few dozen yards from the turn-around for the cable car that doesn't seem to get mobbed by tourists. Free internet helped a lot, as did the fact that a Safeway supermarket (and Walgreen pharmacy, which, thank goodness, we did not need) is situated in the small shopping centre a hundred yards away. The primary open top tour bus terminus is also very close to the hotel. This was a 'taster' trip to San Francisco. It tasted good and, when we go back, it will be to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but paid way too much for parking”
Reviews.Author: gsljenn
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here 1 night on our way to Oregon. The hotel room was acceptable despite the very small room size. What would prevent me from recommending it to others is the rip-off parking. We have a Suburban and they claimed it fit their over-sized vehicle category and charged us $50 to park. I could understand the oversized parking for an RV or something larger than a Suburban.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: jimbojim1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tuscan Inn for 8 days in August. The location is excellent and very close to Fishermans Wharf and transport links to the city. The rooms are a good size and comfortable. Free Wi Fi is offered throughout the hotel. The morning, free tea and coffee is excellent as is the evening free wine. Although the hotel does not have a restaurant as such, it does have a restaurant adjoined to it offering Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner. Whilst the breakfast was good, it was a bit pricey compared to similar places nearby. However, the dinner menu offered better value. This should not detract away from the hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: jjms-nyc
Reviews.Content: Yes, that's almost perfect! The location is great, near to must-see attractions, friendly hotel workers, free coffee/tea in the morning, and FREE internet access throughout the hotel, the room is clean. The only negative thing I have to write is the bed mattresses are too old. They are too soft. We slept 4 nights there. Without any supports of the mattress springs, our chests became all curled up. It was so bad that I had to get up in the middle the night to stretch my back!

Reviews.Title: “Tuscan is convenient to all public transportation”
Reviews.Author: FirstNYvisit
Reviews.Content: Stayed at BW Tuscan 4 weeknights. Location was wonderful--Buy a MUNI pass--bus right outside, streetcar 3 blocks, cable car 2 blocks. We were able to get everywhere along the wharf, Union Square, Chinatown, Golden Gate Park, and walk to North Beach and Ghirardelli square. The free wine at dinnertime was nice. Rooms are well-done but small. Courtyard room was quiet. Concierge booked our return airport shuttle for us. No problems--would return.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for visiting San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: napurpleh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay for visiting Fisherman's Wharf. It is a fairly standard Best Western but they have good standards. What made it a little bit special was the extra touches - free wine for all guests every evening, free coffee and tea every morning for a few hours and very friendly staff, especially the concierge who gave great advice and help during our visit. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but there is one attached next door where you can get breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position! Within walking...”
Reviews.Author: Tonimus73
Reviews.Content: Excellent position! Within walking distance to fisherman's wharf, ghiradelli square! A longer walk to china town but everywhere is close! Nice comfortable rooms! Free wifi! Parking on expensive side! But it's like that everywhere in San Francisco! All in all a nice, comfortable hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean & Friendly hotel close to the wharf!”
Reviews.Author: lizzyrazzi
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but very clean! Only 2 blocks to the wharf and around the corner to a cable car. Valet the car and did not see it for 4 days. Valet is $$ but you are in a large city. All the staff was very friendly and even got a thank-you note from the maid for the tip I left. Our room was on the side of the building and very qutie and very bright. Was quite at night. At at the rest. attached to the hotel the first night. With the weather changes in San Fran @ the wharf great location to be able to go back to hotel. Very happy we stayed @ the wharf at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No problem at all.Great location.Rooms a bit small but manageable”
Reviews.Author: Our_USA_trip
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are a bit small it was still OK for 2 adults/2kids.Location is fantastic. Courtyard rooms nice and quiet.Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: holibobin
Reviews.Content: Visited the Tuscan Inn in early July 2010, Great hotel, just a few minutes out the front door and you are on Fishermans Wharf. Area felt very safe and we were never hesitant when out walking in the evening, saying that we found that to be the case in San Francisco in general. Staff at the hotel were helpful and the concierge found out which bus routes to take when exploring and did a map for us of places we wanted to visit. Bus stops were right outside the hotel and for a few dollars the bus took us straight through chinatown to Union Square. The rooms were clean and had flat screen tvs, , basic enough but just what you need on a city holiday. Breakfast is served in the restaurant adjoining the hotel, it was great, staff were so friendly, remembered us everyday. The eggs Benedict is not to be missed! If you get a chance, visit on 4th July, the fireworks were spectacular and on pier 39 there were live bands playing all day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BJFToronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were there for 5 nights and had a very good experience. Great location; just a 5 minute walk to the Wharf and convenient to the cable car. Also an easy walk to Lombard St and North Beach. This is a small-ish "boutique" hotel, so there is no pool, health club, banquet rooms, etc. But the lobby is inviting with sofas and a fireplace. There's complimentary coffee & biscotti in the morning and wine & pizza appetizers from 5 tp 6 pm. There's a concierge table but anyone at the front desk will help you with information and dinner reservations. Nice mix of guests; couples and families from all over the world. There is no coffee shop on site but the attached Italian restaurant is open all day. (Although you're better off walking a block to the left down North Point where you can get a quick breakfast for a fraction of the price and no line up!) There's grocery and drug stores nearby if you need supplies. Our room (king bed) was not huge but certainly a decent size. The bathroom was surprisngly large (I think it was designed for wheelchair access). The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows (soft, not those hard foam blocks). Based on other revues we requested a courtyard-view room which was blessedly quiet. Maid service was good although we had to ask for more shampoo a couple of times before it was delivered. It's a tourist city so the lobby and elevators can get busy in the morning as everyone heads out. Dogs are welcome (they keep a dish of dog treats on display). Basically, the Tuscan met our requirements for a city hotel: Reasonable price, great location, with a clean, comfortable and quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “1st Trip to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: polarbear6
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! Great location and great staff. It is within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and alot of the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: WhitbyTerry
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Francisco for a family vacation and this was our first hotel to stay in. I had not stayed at a Best Western in a long time and was unsure of what this would be like. I was pleasantly surprised. This hotel is actually from the Kimpton boutique line so it is a little more upscale than the subsequent Best Westerns that we stayed at. The room was not huge but the beds were extremely comfortable and all the furnishings were very modern, including the LCD TV. All three of us were very pleased. The only thing to note is the Valet parking that is charged upon arrival. It is $47 but if you are a memeber of AAA or CAA, you will get a reduced rate of $35, be sure to tell them your number at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay in S.F.”
Reviews.Author: texmex900
Reviews.Content: the hotel was extremely nice. We stayed in one room with 4 people and of course there wasn´t a lot of space but it was still ok. The setting of the hotel close to Fisherman´s Wharf and other attractions made the place perfect for us. We chose the valet parking (parking is extremely expensíve in that area) and were lucky because there was a voucher on the hotel internet page for a discount.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelByTips
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for Fisherman's Wharf area. During our stay, the staff was attentive to our questions and needs. Also the complimentary wine hour before dinner was a great way to start the night! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ladyvdr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Best Western Tuscan Inn at Fisherman's Wharf July 8th - 11th, 2010. We chose the hotel because we loved the location, and we enjoy earning our Best Western points when traveling. We chose a non-smoking, king bed room. As stated in other reviews, the room was small, but it was also well appointed. It had everything we needed. The bathroom had a small tub, but this was not a luxury hotel, so that was to be expected. The bed was comfortable, the tv worked, and the room was quiet. That was all we really needed. Usually Best Western hotels include breakfast with the room rate, but this one does not. Instead, the hotel offered a hosted wine tasting each afternoon from 5pm to 6pm. This was nice, as each person was allowed two full glasses of wine, but we only made it back to the hotel in time one afternoon. We were too busy exploring the city to get back in time for the wine tasting on our other two nights at the hotel. We would have preferred the free breakfast each morning instead. There were several restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, including one attatched to the hotel, but a free breakfast is always nice to have. We were able to walk to Fisherman's Wharf from our hotel. It was very convenient for that purpose, which is why we chose it. Other than the hotel not including breakfast, the only other issue is that Best Western would not give us points for this stay. When I questioned the Best Western customer service about this, I was told that I received a special AAA rate for the hotel, and as such, my stay did not qualify for the rewards points. This was not mentioned on the Best Western website where I booked my stay, by the hotel when I presented my rewards card for check-in, or on the reservation paperwork emailed to me by Best Western. I am disappointed by this bait and switch by Best Western. I might have chosen a more upscale hotel if I had known I would not receive points for this stay. I do not hold the hotel responsible for this, but I would have liked to have known ahead of time by either Best Western or at least by the hotel itself upon check in that I would not be receiving points for the stay. Five years ago we stayed at the Marriott nearby, and we might have chosen that hotel again for this stay had we known about the points.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to wharf, far away from everything else.”
Reviews.Author: jblizard
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of fisherman's wharf. Parking is horrible at 40 bucks a night. King deluxe rooms offer more space, queen rooms are tight. Front desk staff was friendly and knowledgable. Saturday evening there was a line into the lobby waiting for elevators. Beds are good decor is good. You hear everyone walikng in the hall, walking above you, walking next door. You hear the toilets flush, the showers run, and the doors open. You need to have a taxi or bus to reach other sights in town. Bell service is pretty much non existant. Room service is provided from another restaurant in town, so it takes a while. We won't be staying again. It isn't one or two big things, it is a whole bunch of little things that made us feel like we weren't getting the quality we were paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Seahawkteacher
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the Tuscan Inn and enjoyed being close to the Wharf and public transportation. We bought a MUNI pass and rode the cable cars to many locations since the end of the Mason line was only two blocks away. The staff was extremely helpful and give us lots of info.We discovered Trader Joe's on the block behind the hotel. It is a great California "grocery" store with lots of unique items. The room size was fine and the beds were very comfortable. The only problem that we had was that our daughter had to sleep on a pull out bed on the first night since Priceline doesn't guarantee the room configuration.
