Reviews.Content: the tuscan inn has a good location, within easy walking distance to the wharf. there are many restaurants and attractions nearby the hotel room was large-ish with one king bed for my daughter and myself. very skimpy with the towels. (prompt when requested) the ironing board was never put away, and the ice bucket was never cleaned out for me. the bed was comfortable. this is a safe area, i believe, for some may feel threatened by the Many Homeless wandering about. they are harmless. as i said, but some may not feel comfortable. my teen daughter and myself felt perfectly safe at all times. the staff, while all polite, looked a bit distracted, and frankly disengaged. not the incredible, enthusiastic staff describes in such stellar terms by some lucky visitors. however, they were polite.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, Good room”
Reviews.Author: karmickreator
Reviews.Content: Located only two blocks away from Fishermans wharf is this hotels greatest asset. Our room was a bit small, but overall good for the value. I was disappointed they didnt have complimentary breakfast, but with all the good restaurants around I guess it didnt really matter. The rooms were clean and updated, the beds were comfortable, and the bellman service was fast and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great prices for the Wharf area”
Reviews.Author: b2simonsbus
Reviews.Content: We loved the location--easy walking distance to the wharf and cable cars. Reasonable prices, if San Francisco prices can be called reasonable! Rooms were clean and had typical amenities. Had to pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: chellandmike
Reviews.Content: This hotel has tons to do within walking distance, and the price we paid for it made it a great deal on travelzoo for 85.00, however that being said if you are used to staying at true Kimpton hotels this will leave you wanting, but again location and price makes this a great hotel, the wine they serve is 2 buck chuck get there early if you want to partake, there were people everywhere waiting for the pourings, so we decided to skip out on this one

Reviews.Title: “Explore San Francisco's Best Neighborhoods”
Reviews.Author: Mara B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tuscan Inn with my 10-year-old daughter for a special overnight "mommy and me" trip. Although we live in the San Francisco Bay Area, we wanted time to explore certain special neighborhoods in San Francisco best seen on foot. The Tuscan Inn was perfectly located for us to walk a few blocks in the opposite direction of the touristy Fisherman's Whaft to the traditional Italian neighborhood of North Beach. We walked through parts of Chinatown, visited City Lights Bookstore where the Beat movement took flight, shopped the boutiques along Grant Street and had a great, spontaenous dinner. The next morning we went back to a lovely neighborhood cafe on Mason Street two blocks from the hotel to enjoy homemade pastries, a latte and local characters. A highlight of our visit was the historic boats at the Hyde Street Pier -- a national Park Service site that costs only $5.00 for an adult with free entrance for shildren -- we were both fascinated for nearly two hours and it was not crowded. Our room at the Tuscan Inn was cheerful, beautifully decorated, quiet, spacious, bright, well lit for reading at night and offered an iPod port. The service was quick and gracious checking in and out. I highly recommend the Tuscan Inn as a base while in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and value!”
Reviews.Author: J4Lori22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from the Tuscan Inn. We stayed for 9 nights and couldn't be happier. The location was perfect (close enough to walk to most everything but just out of the way enough it was quiet). The rooms were clean and well-cared for. Everyone we encountered (except the valet guys at the front) were more than accomodating. The minibar was great (once we removed all the hotel items and filled it with drinks we bought from the supermarket one block up). Our ONLY complaint was one doorman/valet wasn't thrilled about us parking the car at the front *momentarily* while we removed our bags from the car we rented. Other than that-perfect trip. We would definately stay again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travel2time
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location to the Wharf and other sites in the city. Although the rooms are small it was very clean. Hugo the concierge was very knowledgeable, helpful and fun too.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: gsba_8
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Tuscan Inn San Francisco was sleepless! Our tiny room, was furnished nicely, however, right outside of window was not only a wall, but huge ducts that kept going off and on all night. Our room was not inexpensive. When we checked out I told the clerk about the noise and she replied that they had never heard that before. No apology. The staff at the desk didn't go out of their way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, comfortable room!”
Reviews.Author: oscarsmomMn
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, great italian resturant (a little spendy), SUPER concierege. Parking is easier then you might realize. There is a parking ramp across the street that is MUCH cheaper then hotel parking. Really fun happy hour each afternoon with wine and treats. great time to talk to other travelers and find out their favorite things to do in the area. Honestly, San Fran was our favorite trip ever. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joebaba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn for four nights in mid May 2009. We were in town for the Bay to Breakers. What a wonderful spot. We had a car, so we started with the valet. He was very friendly, and explained just what we had to do to retrieve our car – when they were available (24/7), how long to expect to wait to retrieve the car ( about 7 minutes), etc. He also helped us with our bags to the front desk. The front desk staff were very friendly and efficient. Our room rate was all in order – we’d booked a TravelZoo special, and the front desk had the right rate, and the right parking discount. We asked for a high room, and off the street. We got exactly that. We went down for the free wine reception, and had a great time. We met a number of other travellers, and the wine pour-ers and hostess were very friendly and efficient. The wine reception each night became an event we looked forward to (for more than just the wine!). The wine is Charles Shaw (two buck Chuck) so you wine afficianados should not get too excited, but it was fine for our standards. The room itself was a little small - pretty normal for the wharf area. But it was immaculate and nicely decorated. The bed was big and very comfortable. One interesting thing – the room doors open out to the hallway, rather than in to the room. This makes the room seem slightly bigger, as the door does not swing into the room, taking up space. I’m surprised more hotels don’t do this. The bathroom door does the same thing, making the bathroom seem slightly larger. The room was very quiet. We'd seen some reviews saying the rooms that face the street are noisy, so by asking for a room off the street, we got a very quiet room. The air conditioning worked perfectly. Yes – we needed air conditioning in San Francisco. It was unseasonably warm when we were there. We ate in the hotel restaurant – an Italian theme – and it was very good. Good food and service. The concierge was very helpful and extremely friendly. We did find the concierge was very busy in the mornings, trying to arrange tours for people. We didn’t use the workout facility. The hotel has one computer (with printer) available with free internet. And free wi-fi throughout the hotel which worked flawlessly. This is a Best Western, but it is operated by Kimpton - so it is pet friendly. They advertised that with a picture of the manager's dog on the check in desk. All in all it was a wonderful stay and I’d highly recommend it – we did get an amazing rate, so that made it seem even better. The location is excellent if you want to be near the wharf. It was a two block walk to Pier 39. And the street it was on (North Point), was busy enough to always feel safe walking, but not so busy that you felt crowded. The only downside, is not a fault of the hotel – rather, my personal preference. We usually stay in the Marina District, but we wanted a hotel near the wharf so we could walk to the Bay to Breakers (we didn’t want to stay near Union Square, even though it would have been more convenient). I like visiting the Wharf, but personally, I’d rather stay in the Marina District, and visit the wharf. To be honest, I was pretty sick and tired of the wharf after four days. But again, that was my choice, not a hotel problem. All in all, if you want to stay near the wharf, I’d highly recommend the Tuscan Inn. Though I’d try to get a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Did we all stay in the same hotel??”
Reviews.Author: DEPCalifornia
Reviews.Content: They are getting three stars because the room was very clean and the hotel is close to the wharf. I live about an hour north of San Francisco and have stayed in many hotels in the city and always enjoyed them until this past week. I am surprised anyone would find this place a gem. The staff is very rude and doesn't seem to care at all about their guests. Didn't seem to matter who was at the front desk, they treated everyone bad, the same with the valet. The location is good and the rooms are very pretty and clean. But the beds are awful. You come in and the room looks so nice. Then you sit down on the bed and get the thrill of springs hitting you wherever you lay or sit. We were five people with two rooms...four beds and all the beds were awful. It was worse than sleeping in some $50.00 a night room. Of course you have the added thrill of paying over $40 a night for parking and whatever your chiropractor bill is when you are done with the beds. Someone said it was quiet. We had street side rooms and all night long there were busses and loud noises so no one got good sleep. Go to The Palace or Parc 55, get treated like gold and they have the most comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Pearl”
Reviews.Author: Burgili
Reviews.Content: This is our second time in the Tuscan Inn and we are as satisfied with the hotel as we were last year. We had however a little irritation with the front desk concerning the security deposit and our request to talk to a responsible management person. Through the support of the concierge Hugo we finally got in contact with Pearl. She not only explained the need for a security deposit to our full satisfaction but also surprised us later with an unexpected and generous gift bag in our room. This action showed how high the hotel management values the well feeling of theír guests and that is what we want to appreciate through this comment.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Stoneharbor2009
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Best Western Tuscan Inn was enhanced by the delightful conceriege, Hugo Vides. He helped us through e-mails prior to our trip and provided many additional tips and suggestions during our stay, including help with our return shuttle transportation and printing of our boarding passes. Hugo definitely enjoys his job - it shows in his friendliness and warmth toward the hotel guests and his constant smile. Thank you, Hugo. Nancy Smith

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: warfield
Reviews.Content: This was the third time we have stayed at the Tuscan Inn and each time it has been excellent. The staff are very friendly and go out of their way to help you. We had a double room with 2 queen beds. Although the rooms are not huge, our room was still easily big enough for 2 adults and a child (plus 3 weeks of holiday gear). The hotel is close to Fisherman's Wharf (5 minutes walk max from the seafront) but not so close that it gets the noise. The base of the cable car line is one block away and there is a Safeways one block away as well. At 5 pm every day the hotel holds an informal reception where you can have a couple of glasses of wine and normally some food brought in from the Italian restaurant next door. After spending an exhausting day walking the hills of SF, this is a great way to unwind before heading off for a meal. In our case we used the adjacent Italian restaurant-if you are staying at the Tuscan Inn you get 10% off your bill. They've got an underground garage at the Tuscan Inn but we didn't use it, as we there is no need for a car in SF. The cable cars provide an easy way of getting around SF but the costs can soon mount up if you are using them continually. We walked much of the time and took in the views.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Value, Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: FRAMICH
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to SF and we were not sure of where to stay and what to do. This hotel location could not be any better. It is only a few blocks from the wharf and 1 block from the cable car turn around. The rooms were nice & clean. The wine reception was very nice but they could have used a few more seats. We found a nice place to eat breakfast just down the block called the Hollywood Cafe. It had a large selection at the cheapest prices around and the food was excellent. The staff & concierge were all very helpful and gave us a lot of tips of what to see and where to eat. I would stay here again without a second thought

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: WexfordSusie
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at this hotel we were instantly upgraded for our 7 night stay and also received complimentary champagne on arrival we were delighted with this and were made feel very welcome! The rooms are exceptionally clean and also the bathrooms. I have to say I see everyone that reviews this hotel compliments the front desk staff I actually found from the second day on that they were most unhelpful and actually quite rude! when the internet connection was down in the hotel lobby I very politely asked the front desk to print off our tickets for alcatraz at which I was left waiting for 10 minutes before being very rudely told that if I really needed to have these printed off then the concierge could help me, but I also found him to be most put out by my request! Also on my third day I came back from a long day sightseeing and stopped at the front desk to ask for milk and sugar to be sent up to the room as we wanted to have a coffee after our long day at which I was told to go into the restaurant and ask the waiting staff myself and take it up to my room myself! as you can imagine I was not happy!!!! so at this point I realised I would just keep to myself and use the hotel to sleep in and nothing else which is exactly what I done. I was really dissapointed as we were on honeymoon and were hoping for somewhere that we would be looked after a little. So to sum up if your looking for somewhere to lay your head after a long day then this is the place for you if your looking for something a bit special with good customer service avoid this place like the plague

Reviews.Title: “The best option in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: holertingrid
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best selection for San Francisco. The Front Desk and Housekeeping are efficient, friendly and helpfull. The hotel is clean till the smallest spot. The location is the best! On Fisherman's Wharf, 2 blocks from Pier30, close to all the main transportation spots and attractions. Best value for your money! Definetely a come back when in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: trippin76
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several Kimpton hotels and I have to say the Tuscan Inn was not one of their best. It was just a nice Best Western. Upon check-in they did not have my reservation (I booked through Hotels.com) and they woman working the counter was not very friendly about it and acted very annoyed. She eventually found a hard copy of my reservation and I got my room but she never apologized for the mix-up or anything. The room was nice and bigger than I thought it would be so that was good. The bathroom was clean and the bed was comfy. The location was really the best part. Right on the bus line and only 2 blocks from all the action of Fisherman's Wharf. I don't know that Tuscan Inn would be my first choice for a place to stay next time but it wouldn't be the last either. It's a maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: NateKinFL
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Tuscan Inn. Upon arrival we were greeted immediately and got checked in within 3 minutes. I'm not sure why so many people say the rooms are small here, but our standard king size bed room was huge in my opinion. We were at the end of a hall with a small courtyard view. This room was a nite respite from all the noise of the city and a a great quiet getaway at night. We were extremely pleased with the cleanliness of the room. It doesn't get cleaner. The bed was extremely comfortable and the amenities were excellent. They provide you with great aveda products in the bathroom. Free Wifi in your room, and the free wine reception in the evenings was great. All the staff was friendly, though I found the maintanence and housekeeping staff to be the warmest in the building. I did not take advantage of the concierge service, but I saw many people were receiving great service from them. We would defenitely stay here again. Great value and service for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Every hotel should have this staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Parliment
Reviews.Content: Im actually still in the hotel and couldnt wait to write my review, but from the moment we arrived the staff at this best western could not have done more for us. From the Manager, all the way down to the Car porters, i have never enjoyed my stay at a hotel like i have staying here. Every hotel should have the staff that is here at the Best western Tuscan inn.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Fisherman's Wharf Location”
Reviews.Author: shoesnbears
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Perfect location near Fisherman's Wharf. Easy walking to all of the popular spots and the trolley car. Kind and helpful staff. Very good restaurant. Nice complimentary happy hour at 5pm daily with snacks, beer, wine. Allowed us to meet some new people who were staying there as well. Would stay there again in a hearbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfy convienent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovecje
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for our 10 year anniversary and liked the convience of the hotel. I used the recommendations of others who have stayed there as well from trip advisor and requested a courtyard room. Didn't get it the first night but did the other nights, thankfully the room the first night was quiet. The hotel was supposed to deliver champagne as requested by my sister and they did not do that- so that was a little dissapointing! Concierge lady in the front lobby was very rude and felt like I was inconveiancing her by asking her a question. LOVED the Hollywood Cafe just down the street on Noth Point! Their crossaint with fruit was really good (my husband I shared it, as it was huge!)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed, quiet room, easy access to all of SF”
Reviews.Author: CanadianDoll
Reviews.Content: The rooms were smallish and could get a little damp if you didn't keep the air conditioning unit on, but the beds were comfortable, and the courtyard-view room we had was very quiet. The wine tasting in the evenings was a fantastic feature, it was timed perfectly so that we could have a glass of wine before going out for dinner. Checkout early Wednesday morning took about 2 minutes to complete, no complaints with the staff. The concierge can give discounts for booking city tours and for some restaurants, although we tried Neptune's which was recommended to us and felt it was overpriced for the service and quality. Fisherman's Wharf was very touristy, but we appreciated the safety of the area at night, and stores close by like Safeway and Walgreens. The Tuscan Inn is close to the MUNI system cable cars, and is on 2 bus lines so we were able to travel all over the city without a car.

Reviews.Title: “Talk about Amazing Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Red_Flag_V
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to San Francisco for her 30th birthday & we were treated like visiting royalty! Too many little extras to mention in this limited space, but here are a couple: I requested they prepare a cheese and fruit platter for us to take on our Napa outing and imagine my surprise when the boxes were opened - the gourmet assortment of cheeses encircling an orchid, the freshest of various fruits, including chocolate dipped strawberries! The hotel staff - as a whole - were more than happy to go above and beyond to satisfy your request. The room was a bit small - but all we did there was sleep - so no complaints!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinTiger
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at the Tuscan in March. We found the staff very helpful especially Jose. The one hour reception was very nice. To our surprise, not only did they have wine, but they also had beer, soda and juices with an appetizer. They did have coffee and tea in the morning. I think they should have not stopped serving their biscotti - mistake. I agree with other travelers that the rooms are small, and the street noise is sometimes annoying. All of the hotels on Fishermans Wharf are pricey and so for the money - I would recommend this hotel to a friend. We found it on sale on the internet. The Safeway was great for saving money on food. But also less than a block away was a Subway. There was a little place down the road (Hollywood) that had an exceptional breakfast for under $10,00. The fruit was some of the best I have ever had. We did not have a car, but I did hear complaints not only at this hotel but other hotels as well that it was very expensive. Also - I would advise getting a map on arrival at one of the stores on the Wharf - a lot more informative than the one they give you at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: AB_traveller_55
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan Inn has a great location to tourist sites within San Francisco. Walking distance to Pier 39, bay ferries and tours, Ghirardelli Square, etc. Streetcars and cable cars are close to take you to Market Street, the Ferry Terminal, etc. The Inn is clean, and welcoming. It has a good look, nice sitting area in the lobby, wine hour every night, friendly and helpful staff. The rooms we had were a good size and clean. It was basic, but that was OK for us. I had trouble with the hot water in my shower but it was fixed the same day I reported the problem. I personally appreciated the free internet service in the hotel. All-in-all, compared to other hotels in the area, we were both impressed and happy with the Tuscan Inn and would recommend it. I did have to search through the usual online websites to find the best deal for rooms, but if you take time to look, I think you will be happy with the rates you get.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but what's with the Check in / out staff?”
Reviews.Author: RamboSacto
Reviews.Content: Was a nice, clean and quiet room. A little cramped, especially around the sink area. Excellent location, close to the wharf and cable car lines. Complementary coffee in the morning however, they have stopped with the biscotti! In addition, they advertise Limousine service to the financial district but when I inquired they announce they had stopped the service and I would need to take mass transportation. So I figured times must be hard. As I checked out I expressed my disappointment there were no biscottis and transportation service and the check out clerk tells me they do have the service and I needed to make an appointment. That set me off since I did try to do that. So I had problems with the check in and check out staff . On the other hand, the valet parking attendant/bell people were very friendly. Do not know if I will stay there again, due to the problems with the staff at the check in/out counter.

Reviews.Title: “We Really Loved Every Minute Of Our Trip!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SFOFUN
Reviews.Content: We had a great adventure. It was a last minute trip, totally unplanned. It could not have turned out better if we planned it. I haven't been to San Fran in 20 years. It was my daughter's first trip to San Fran and it was her birthday. She asked her best friend to come so I really wanted them to have a good time. I have to say if it weren't for the employees at the Tuscan Inn it wouldn't have been as good. Hugo, Gregori, Tanishia, and Ernie all went above and beyond to assist us in having a great trip. Hugo is one of a kind. He is one of the best Concierge's I have had the pleasure to meet. 5 STARS!!!!! All employee's that I mentioned have shown customer service skills that are above and beyond. Whatever questions asked they always came through with the answers that best suited our needs. From suggestions about resturants, tours, or just directions to the nearest movie theater. When we called down from our room with a request for extra towel blankets whatever we need it was delivered promptly to our room. We had a discussion on the plane that it was such a shame that customer service was gone in so many companies these days. It was so refreshing to see it is alive and well at the Tuscan Inn!! Thank You so much for making our trip one we won't soon forget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: storyteller60
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days in February 2009. Great location situated on the flat, no hill to climb!, Only one block away from Pier 39. Hotel was comfortable and all the staff helpful and polite. Would recommend a trip to Safewatys supermarket just across the road to stock up on water and goodies. Would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: kaul
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Tuscan Inn Fisherman's Wharf based on the reviews we read on the computer and were not disappointed. Everything went smoothly from the moment we checked in. I loved the decor of the room and found it to be modern, calm and restful. We had a room with a King sized bed and although the room was small it was bright and very clean. The Manager's wine tasting in the lobby at 5 every evening gave guests a chance to meet and mingle. A very nice touch. It was our wedding anniversary during our stay and the Manager sent a bottle of sparkling wine to our room. That was a nice touch. The location is perfect being so close to the Wharf and Pier 39 and the Powel St. Cable cars. I only regret not staying at the Tuscan Inn for a third night as there is so much to do in the area. We traveled down the coast to Los Angeles after our stay in San Francisco and I must say that the Tuscan Inn was my favourite place to stay in California.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: rubberbandeffect
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great - close to Fisherman's Wharf, within walking distance of Ghiradelli Square, boats to Alcatraz and two cable car lines. The room was big enough, though there wasn't a lot of extra room. It was clean, the beds were comfortable, and the room was quiet. Free internet and a computer for use in the lobby was helpful. The manager's cocktail hour was a nice touch, and the free coffee in the morning was also nice though I had to ask both mornings for hot chocolate to be brought out for the kids, and the advertised biscotti was no where to be found. Jorge was extremely friendly and helpful, but the rest of the staff was less animated and warm. Do try Pat's cafe around the corner for breakfast. It was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Valentines Weekend”
Reviews.Author: angeltiff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for Valentines weekend and just got back last night. We thought the hotel was a great value. We booked online through the hotel website and used our AAA card to get a discounted price and it was well worth it. I researched a bit before choosing to book with the Best Western. It's diagonally across from the Sheraton which was one of our options. We decided on the Best Western after we figured we'd save more and still be as close to Fisherman's wharf. Not only was it due to price, but after reading reviews and looking at pictures, the Best Western Tuscan just seemed to be more comfy and less touristy, which it was. The rooms are decorated well, not too flashy and yet still modern. Yes, the rooms aren't that big, but after deciding that our main goal was to find a nice clean hotel close to Fisherman's wharf and near a lot of the public transportation, it was a perfect choice for us. Although our weekend was during a storm, the close proximity to the piers and public transportation still made our location idea. The staff was very helpful in giving us suggestions and directions when we asked. They also scheduled our shuttle back to the SFO airport. I didn't get to take advantage of the free coffee in the morning, but my husband and I did go to the 5pm-6pm cocktail hour, which we enjoyed. It was nice to have a drink or two and talk to fellow travelers. Only complaint that we had was when we found out that there was no in-house gym. Although they didn't have a in-house gym, they did say they had passes to the 24 Hour Fitness across the street in the shopping center. Too bad it was raining pretty hard and discouraged us from going. (If you plan to stay for 2 to 3 days and are planning to take advantage of the public transportation in Downtown SF, get the 3-day MUNI pass for $18... the front desk can tell you where to get them. The hotel only offers 1 day passes for $11, which is a good deal, but if you are staying for longer, the 3-day pass is worth it... you even still save a bit if you only use it for 2-days.)

Reviews.Title: “Pearl in the dirt (pretty as a pearl but not in the best of areas)”
Reviews.Author: valit
Reviews.Content: We arrived from LA having paid the rooms in advance but were immediately hit by a $40/day surcharge to park our car. The hotel is very charming. The room was extremely small (there was basically only room for the bed) and the decor was, for my taste, a little over the top. But everything was nice and clean. There was no complimentary wi-fi in the hotel. The area immediately around the hotel was a little dry, the charm of San Francisco was definitely not just outside the door, but not too far either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: OregonDetective
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco to testify at a legal proceeding, decided to stay at Fisherman's Wharf. This hotel was a perfect choice. It seemed more like a Hilton than a Best Western. Very nice room, the bed was extremely comfortable and the pillows were better than my pillows at home. Very close to Fisherman's Wharf, a grocery store located right across the street, and very helpful and friendly staff. It was all good. If I ever return to Frisco, I will definitely stay at the Tuscan Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: sjmml
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn in September as a base for exploring San Francisco. Location-wise, the hotel was perfect; it was within walking distance of the pier for Alcatraz and a two minute walk away from the tram as well as Lombard Street. The rooms were a decent size for a city hotel and were very clean and well serviced. Coffee and biscotti were available in reception every morning free of charge or if you preferred, there was a restaurant in the hotel that served breakfast or a Starbucks round the corner. Most impressive of all though, was the assistance of the concierge who was incredible particularly when it came to organising our check-in on various flights etc. I would definitley stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Love Fisherman's Wharf Area”
Reviews.Author: HDTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: Love Fisherman's Wharf. Sights are wonderful, food is excellent. Tuscan Inn is within walking distance of all Wharf attractions. Many choices for eating, shopping and activities. Parking is expensive, Rooms are on the small side. Staff is very helpful. Happy Hour each day from 5 - 6 PM. Still......a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: KKTC
Reviews.Content: We've stay at the Tuscan Inn twice in 2007 and once in 2008. It's such a great hotel. The staff are so friendly and the hotel is in a great location, just 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf , bus and cable car station. The restaurant, cafe Pescatore is also very good. We had breakfast and dinner there many times during our stay. The Tuscan Inn is such a great find in beautiful San Francisco. We can't wait for our next trip to San Francisco and of course we only stay at the Tuscan inn.

Reviews.Title: “Best Wee hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Denise-Mark
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Tuscan Inn on our last 3 trips to San Francisco, and I really can't fault the service. The rooms are probably smaller than at a major chain, but you're not here to sit in your room. The staff at this hotel make you feel so welcome and its service with a smile. It's almost like you're part of a large Italian family. The wine reception is a great way to relax, meet fellow guests and wind down if you've had a long day sightseeing. All the staff go the extra mile to assist in anyway they can and the staff of the ajoining Cafe Pescatore are just as welcoming, with great service and the food is excellent. We feel at home here which is why we will be back this year too. It's a truely wonderful little hotel, with great people in a great location (bus stop across the street, f car one block down and cable car one block up and west where you can buy a 7 day ticket for all 3 - who needs a car!) We love it!

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom a bit dirty.”
Reviews.Author: Flutegarden
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a lot - a great location, great staff, free wine tastings and morning coffee. The room was pretty nice and spacious. However, parking is $30/night and valet only, which becomes a pain. Also, the bathroom was a bit dirty - brown water came out of the bath tub faucet initially and the sink wall by the toilet was dirty. I did not address these concerns during my stay, but did leave feedback on the website, to which I received no reply.

Reviews.Title: “Again, a nice quaint hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BrentD
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel awhile back, I sort of knew what to expect. Check in was flawless, and we were even early arrivals at approx 12 noon. Room was on 4th floor overlooking the interior garden area. Seems the hotel has been completely renovated since our last stay. Our room had a nice clean bath/shower, all tile, and sink that was marble. Plenty of toiletries. The bed was very plush, and king size that was very comfortable. There were 2 alarm clocks on either side of the bed. Nice mini bar, and plenty of tv stations to watch before going to bed. The rooms are done in an Italian hue, and recently new carpet through out the entire hotel and our floor. The refridge was a bit noisy, and the air conditioner seemed a bit loud and woke me several times during the night, but really was not bad at all. Never experienced the room service. Never did partake in the 5 pm wine tasting as we were usually out at the Buena Vista chugging down Irish coffee until the late night. The hotel is very well located as previously mentioned in other reviews. We ate dinner at the attached restaurant the night prior to our departure for convenience, and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food. Well done. All in all, would and have stayed here again. Paid around 205 a night booked through a hotel vendor website. It is very "touristy" by the wharf. As other times we have stayed more in the financial district, and probably would the next time for a different feel again.

Reviews.Title: “Room 200 is noisy...”
Reviews.Author: demozeleski
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 200 which is on the corner of Hyde and North Point. This is directly above the cable car stop. We heard cable cars and traffic going back and forth until 0100 and starting again at 0500. Apparently, cable cars are taken to the "barn" most all night for maintainence. The windows are single payne and provide no sound proofing. Others in our group stayed in the middle of the hotel and had no problem with traffic noise. The rooms were large and comfortable and the location was fine if you don't mind a little walking to the Wharf and other attractions. At least the cable car is close...maybe a little too close.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Emily's_Grandad
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 week vacation incorporating 6 days in California followed by a cruise. We chose the Best Western Tuscan Inn as our base whilst in San Francisco on the first three nights of our tour. We arrived at SFR approximately 1 hour late due to flight delays at London Heathrow and in the pouring rain and, of course, suffering from jet lag. Despite all this, we found the Tuscan Inn easily in a city strange to us. After reading other reviews on Trip Advisor we made sure that we had a "Garden View" room as we knew that the jet lag would see us awake at about 2:00am! I don't know about the street view rooms but we had no problems with noise whatsoever. The rooms were pleasant, clean and did not disappoint. The hotel is certainly well placed for access to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 etc. My wife suffers from arthritis and cannot walk far but we had no problems in walking to the departure point for Alcatraz tours, Mr. Toad's city tour, Cable Cars, etc. Staff were helpful and generally friendly. The daily wine reception was a great idea as it got guests together and talking about their experiences of the day. Was a little upset by waiter serving wine at the second of these we went to. On arriving we initially spoke to some other guests and I then went to request two glasses of wine on behalf of myself and my wife - reaction was, in broken English, - "Only two glasses each!" I explained we had just arrived and this was our first drink. "NO, only two glasses" "We haven't had one yet!" "I must see your room key" With annoyance I retrieved and displayed the key and finally got a glass of wine. I know they don't want clients getting drunk at their expense but at the end of the day it wasn't even quality wine just a very cheap plonk. Only other downer was $38 per night for valet parking. Being from UK this kind of thing is alien to me but I did know in advance and chose to accept it - apparently other guests with larger cars were paying over $50 ! Apart from the one incident above I would have no reservations about recommending this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: fadedtan
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable and enjoyable stay. The hotel was clean and convenient. The staff was helpful and friendly. We never went to the evening wine party but it looked very popular. We were street side which was a bit noisy some mornings with truck deliveries.

Reviews.Title: “liked it”
Reviews.Author: janneman10
Reviews.Content: room was quiet, clean with good beds but very very small not a cheap hotel valit parking was to much expencive but oke its the location

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: JLBMountJoy_PA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Tuscan Inn in the Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco recently. What a lovely place in the midst of a fast-paced environment! The thought that it was a Best Western made me think ahead of my stay that this is an okay place to rest a night but what a surprise when I found the cutest place in the City of San Francisco. The room was adorable and had everything I needed. The concierge, Hugo Vides, is the absolute best. The welcoming wine event between 5 and 6 p.m. was a nice twist to get to know others who were staying there. I only wish I would have had more time there and hope to someday return. I am so glad my travel agent at Liberty Travel suggested this.

Reviews.Title: “Liked staying at Tuscon Inn”
Reviews.Author: Gidoctor
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via booking.com at KLM website. I went through a lot of reviews and the one from Frommers Guide was most helpful. I got a good rate and no prepayment from the KLM website( linked to booking.com). Tuscon Inn was near the pier 39, which is a great location, checking in and out was easy. The staff were very helpful. The room was nice, good size and quite clean. The bathroom was big and clean as well. Although I was alone, room was good enough for a couple. The hotel had free coffee and drinks everyday and free access to wireless internet. The adjacent served nice breakfast. Great location and hotel. Try and not book anything from the hotel though, just walk up pier 39 and you will have more choice. The hotel does arrange a shuttle to the airport without any extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, friendly place to stay on the wharf”
Reviews.Author: PandaExpress
Reviews.Content: We had a quick trip to SF and decided to stay here so we could easily walk to the wharf, pier 39 and Ghirardeli chocolate square. We choose this place primarily based on other user reviews on TripAdvisor. The room is nice, very cozy (i.e. fairly small) but well put together and comfortable. We took everyone's advice and requested an interior courtyard view (basically looking at the opposing wall of the hotel) and so we didn't hear any noise. We were incredibly lucky and came here when the weather was very good. Free coffee and biscotti in the morning helped get the GF out of bed. It was funny to run into a fellow husband in the elevator bringing back coffee for this wife as well. Parking is crazy expensive, we drove up from LA so we had a car - but otherwise, you really don't need it. Staff was friendly and helpful - we had no issues. Most of the other guests are foreigners.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price...”
Reviews.Author: divecozumel
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms on Priceline for $139 each, just an overnight stay while flying home the next morning. Check in was good, rooms both ready, and we upgraded with no problems. Room was very small for 4, we apparently had an "outside" room, because trucks crashed around all night loading and unloading. Tried to tip the maids for 2 extra towels as there were 4 of us and it was a HUGE problem, apparently no more than 4 towels per room? Didn't want to pay for the mini-bar, but frig leaked all over floor. When maintenance guy came in, he blamed us for turning it down, it was in a locked cabinet! Asked for a wake up call and did not get it. One male working the desk the morning of 10/20 was rushed, rude, so checked out without talking to them. Hotel is clean, very convenient to the Wharf and shopping. Would not stay here again, due to noise and staff, but ok for the price, if I would have paid rack rate, I would have been more upset.

Reviews.Title: “Our comfy room at the Tuscan Inn”
Reviews.Author: bannalouise
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely, incredibly well located hotel for 6 nights as we explored the hills of San Francisco. The staff was wonderful, our room was very pretty with a view of the Fisherman's Wharf area. The bathroom was marble and we had luxurious bathrobes and really, every detail attended to. When we first arrived at 2am, there had been a mixup with the room reservation and the man at the desk was so competent and accomodating - while the hotel was full, he found a room for us, for which we were eternally grateful. We met the manager, who was incredibly helpful about restaurants in the area, and also a lovely person to talk to. The breakfast at the neighboring restaurant (attached to the hotel) was delicious and the evening wine hour was the perfect thing after a day on one's feet. I'd highly recommend the Tuscan Inn based on location, cheerfulness of staff, aesthetics in the room and general overall service.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the tuscan inn”
Reviews.Author: soccerdeb
Reviews.Content: stayed for three nights at the tuscan inn. easy walking distance to fishermans wharf , cable cars, and streetcar stop to ferry building. older hotel with smaller rooms but updated nicely. thin walled rooms. only coffee and bisquits for breakfast. overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the wine at 5pm”
Reviews.Author: Lytia
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in August following a flight from UK. We had a room on the ground floor that was very well decorated but a bit gloomy. As we had come to sleep that actually helped. It was large with enough space for our cases. Disappointed with coffee making faclities. Breakfast at the hotel was fine, and we had lunch and dinner there as well. Lunch time staff were miserable and in the evening we did not book so had ages to wait for a table, crowded and noisy.We would have gone elsewhere but around 21:00 found most other places closing so it was Hobsons choice The best part of the stay were the free wine and eats in the lounge arond 17:00, absolutely great and a warm fire as well! Very cosy and friendly. Staff were always helpful. Even when we were charged in error on our credit card after our return to UK it was sorted out with grace and effortlessly. We were only using it as a stopover and it met the bill on that front.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Beatons
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 4 days. Our flight came in early so the room we requested wasn't ready yet. The concierge recommended a bus tour and called to see if there were seats available and booked us on the tour that was leaving in an hour. The tour was fabulous and the driver was wonderful and provided excellent information during the tour. The tour ended around 2:30 and we were dropped off back at the hotel. By this time our room was ready. We had asked for a courtyard room as I am a very light sleeper. I had no problem at all even though everything in San Francisco was booked and there were people everywhere due to it being the start of Fleet Week. The room was extremely clean and very spacious. The carpet was a bit worn and outdated but that isn't a complaint just an observation. We found the staff to be very helpful and courteous and we had no problems at all. We didn't participate in the wine social that occurred everyday at 5 but there were a lot of people that did as every time we went through the lobby it was packed. We did however take advantage of the free coffee and biscotti that was offered every morning in the lobby. The hotel is in a fantastic location just a 5 minute walk from Fisherman's Wharf and no more then 10 minutes from the cable cars and other attractions. There is an Ihop one block down which we ate at a couple of times. Our stay was a pleasant one with no complaints at all. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Job”
Reviews.Author: chunky1974
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in August and couldn't fault it for what we wanted. Great location, the concierge guy was fantastic and there is a lovely restaurant attached to the hotel that does a great breakfast! No bar as such in the hotel but they have free wine tasting every day at 5p.m.!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: SteelersFan27
Reviews.Content: We loved the Tuscan Inn! We booked a King room, but they upgraded us to a King Deluxe when we arrived. It was pretty small, so I'm sure the standard rooms are even smaller! But, for just the two of us it was perfect. The room was very nicely decorated and was obviously recently renovated. We loved it. It was very clean, had a beautiful bathroom, and was comfortable. The staff was very friendly (especially Jose!) and the wine hour is such a nice touch!! We were only able to go one day, but it was great! Held us over nicely until dinner with wine and appetizers. If you stay here- be prepared to walk uphill to get anywhere outside of Fisherman's Wharf!! We also used the "F-line" street car to get to the Ferry building and financial district...it seemed safe, easy, and close to the hotel. We spent alot of time walking too and were able to see so much in a few days, but be prepared for the hills. Some highlights in the San Francisco area: -Coit Tower, Alcatraz with audio tour, Chinatown, Lombard St, Hyde-Powell Cable Car Line (standing on the outside!), Golden Gate Park are all must dos! -Wine Country Shuttle Tour - went to Domaine Chandon, V. Sattui, Rutherford Ranch, and Andretti Wineries. It was a great day and worth the money not to have to worry about driving, plus we really enjoyed each of the wineries- all different experiences! -Saulsalito - only had a short time here, but looked like a great area to explore art galleries, boutiques, and good food. -Punchline Comedy Club -Muir Woods was ok- if you've never seen the Redwoods further north in CA, you'll be satisfied...it's close enough to SF for an easy visit and the trees are still huge!! Lots of tourists and not quite the size of further up the coast, but still very pretty and we enjoyed it. We thoroughly enjoyed the Tuscan Inn and would recommend staying there if you're looking to stay in the Fisherman's Wharf area. It was pretty quiet and a little bit removed from all the action of the Wharf and Pier 39, which was nice. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Phototravelgirl
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights and found the staff to be very friendly. The location is great, only 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. The room was nice given this is not a 5 star property so our expectations were exceeded. Overall, it was a great value and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachel_Lesley
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel on the 23rd August for 3 nights and had an enjoyable stay. It is in a great location, 5 minute walk to Fisherman 's Wharf promenade and 5 minute walk to a tram stop. We were given a room over looking the street which proved to be noisey. The reception staff were very accommodating and said the hotel was fully booked but first thing in the morning they would move our luggage to a room over looking the courtyard. This room was alot quiter and you could also open the windows as apposed to the room on street level. The complimentry tea and biscuits in the morning were very good and the restaurant ajoined to the hotel was very pleasant. The hotel was clean, in a good location and we would reccommend it to other travelors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BD148
Reviews.Content: Completed a 3 night stay at the end of September, at the Tuscan Inn - which was excellent! Great location. Room was great - this was an outside room - so a bit of expected street noise - but not obtrusive. Staff were knowledgeable and friendly. The Concierge staff - exceptional and extremely helpful - right from suggestions on transportation/excursion options to recommending an amazing restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Tuscan Inn”
Reviews.Author: curlycat
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to get very mixed reviews, particularly about the reception desk staff. I can only think that some of the staff are very good and some equally bad, since our experience was a very positive one. We were greeted warmly and asked how we had enjoyed our stay on leaving. Both check in (when we were able to check in very early) and check out were fine and friendly. We have stayed at this hotel once before, a few years ago, so knew that the rooms were not particularly large. On this occasion our room was quite small, but extremely nice, although it did contain the smallest wardrobe I had ever seen! The hotel is very well situated, 5 minutes walk from Fishermans Wharf, shops, restaurants and cable cars etc. We were fortunate to get an inside (or courtyard) room, so were not disturbed by noise at all (except for 1 night when the fridge went mad!) We had a problem with the AC whilst we were there, but a very friendly and helpful maintenance man came within minutes of reporting it, and had it fixed at the touch of a button. Valet parking is, in my view, unreasonably high at $38 per night, but again we knew this before we arrived so can't really complain. The best point about this hotel is the wonderful restaurant attached to it - Cafe Pescatore. Both breakfast and evening meal were excellent - it is very well used, so bookings are advised for the evening. The late afternoon free wine reception was a really nice touch and we enjoyed this very much. So once again, we enjoyed a lovely stay at this hotel and will almost certainly go back when we next visit SF.

Reviews.Title: “DIsappointed in Front Desk Staff and Room Size”
Reviews.Author: kuke2
Reviews.Content: We were anticipating a special stay for our anniversary trip. The front desk staff couldn’t even be bothered to greet us hello. She took our confirmation information and was annoyed that we didn't have an additional copy to give her. The room was clean and nicely decorated but very small. The view from our 4th floor window was of two outside building walls, but it was very quiet. My husband talked with the concierge, who he found very helpful. The daily coffee and newspaper in the lobby were nice to have in the early morning. The location is great, only a few blocks from the Wharf. When we checked-out, the front desk clerk didn’t even bother to ask about our stay, which is very unusual. Fortunately, the hotel we stayed at in Monteray more than made up for our disappointing experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in heart of fishermans wharf”
Reviews.Author: Lampoon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. The rooms were nice. No complaints. Close to public transport and walking distance to restaraunt. This was probably not the best pick for us as we don't like tourist areas and Fishermans Wharf if one big tourist service. The food and drink prices in the area were outrageous. Summary: best place to stay in a tourist trap. Especially if you don't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: lilacbirman13
Reviews.Content: I originally requested a courtyard room but since we checked in around 11 a.m. the front desk person said one would be available around 3 p.m. but they had a 4th floor room facing the street available immediately. I am a very light sleeper so I’ll admit I was apprehensive about having a room facing the street. We were pleased that the room was very nice and a decent size for the three of us plus it had a great view of Coit Tower, the Transamerica building and a partial view of Alcatraz through the bay window. The street noise can get loud but we already knew it would be since it IS a street-side window in a busy tourist area. I also brought a sound machine which pretty much drowns out most of the annoying noises so I did manage to sleep very well. The mini fridge was filled with the snacks & drinks but we rearranged things so we could put our own bottles in there. The fridge made no noise at all, the a/c worked fine although we only used it once because it was cool enough for us. Our 11 year old son said that the sofa bed was not comfortable but that is normal for most sofa beds and he slept soundly every night anyway. Our king size bed was comfy, but I thought it should have had king sized pillows as well instead of three standard size ones. The lighting was good which my husband really appreciated because he did a lot of reading during our down time. The bathroom was an adequate size. The sink area is a bit small but there is a small glass shelf above the toilet and one shelf under the sink where hotel towels and a blow dryer are stored but there is enough room for a couple of toiletry bags. The bath has one of those large rain shower heads which we loved and it was so quiet too! The shower curtain rod curves outward to allow more “elbow” room which we really liked. As most hotels in the city, parking is expensive so unless you really need a vehicle it’s cheaper to just buy a MUNI Passport during your stay. There is a nice clock/radio which also has a CD player. We couldn’t figure out how to change the time on it so we just called front desk to request a wake up call each morning. The hotel is charming and comfortable, and the staff is great. The location is hard to beat with a Safeway, Trader Joe’s, Borders, World Market and the cable car all within a block of this hotel. Pier 39 is just a short 5-10 minutes away. We were sort of sad to leave as we transferred to another hotel at Union Square for the second part of our stay. If we were to stay in the Fisherman’s Wharf area, I would absolutely stay at the Tuscan Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hard_working_girl
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful Hotel. After reading some of the bad reviews, we started to worry about staying here. Our worries washed away the moment we reached the hotel. The staff was amazing, and went out of their way to help us. The coffee and treats in the moring was amazing. The wine and treats at night were great also, nice touch. We took the advice from other reviewers and requested a court-yard side room. Glad we did, it was very quite. Some say the rooms are small, but ours wasn't that tiny. A normal size hotel room compared to other hotel rooms we have stayed in, besides we didn't spend much time in the room when there is so much to do around San Francisco. I will stay here again if I ever get the chance to go back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: pagirl11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a convenient location. It is within walking distance to the wharf, as well as the pier that sails boats to Alcatraz. There are many public transportation options including the cable cars, the trolley line and bus service. It is within easy walking distance to China town and sits within the City's Italian neighborhood. The hotel is across the street from a Dollar rental car drop off, so you can rent a car at the airport, tour the area and then drop the car off when you get into the city. The hotel does have parking, but it is expensive and hard to get around the city while driving. The hotel itself had attractive common areas. The rooms were small, very small. They were, however clean and well equipped. The staff at the hotel more than made up for the tiny rooms. They were extremely helpful and would go out of their way to meet your every demand. The Consigliore was extremely knowledgeable and very helpful. If you are looking for an inexpensive hotel to stay at where the staff will make your tour of their city a good experience, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend it”
Reviews.Author: hsam
Reviews.Content: I am not a hotel snob - I don't mind a little noise, a little bit of dirt, etc. , but given the fairly strong review for this place, I was very disappointed. First, from day one our bathroom had a urine smell that never went away. Otherwise the bathroom was decent enough - decent temperature and decent water pressure. The room was loud loud loud. We were on the fourth floor and could literally hear conversations on the street, with our windows shut. The ac did not seem very accurate or effective and do not book a room with a sleeper sofa. Don't get me going on the noise the fridge made - it sounded like a jet plane every time the motor shifted. I finally had to buy sleeping pill across the street to try to sleep through all of this. Then my last morning, I got to hear a heated argument between the reception desk and the police. The police were investigating something that had happened and staff would not cooperate so the police got very annoyed...all this in front of guest. On a positive note, we did like having a Trader Joe's right behind the hotel and used the mini bar to store our goods.l also enjoyed the morning coffee in the lobby and the free wine. But not enough to every bring me back here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: albertafamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three days and then moved down the street to the Hyatt(also reviewed the Hyatt) for three days on our trip.This hotel was clean and in a excellent location to everything.The cable cars were one block behind the hotel,waterfront was two blocks in front of the hotel and the #10 bus to AT&T ballpark was right across the street from the main entrance.We arrived early in the morning and tried to check in and the front desk staff said they would have a room cleaned asap for us.We left and came back two hours later and room was still not ready.We had tickets to a 12:45pm Giants game and were hoping to get our room before going to the game.We were having a casual conversation with the concierge and mentioned this fact to him,he then said he'd see what he could do and had us checked into our room in minutes.The front desk staff didn't seem to care but the concierge who took care of us was great(there were two of them working different days)he also had many suggestions and tips for us about the Bay area.The only other negative and its a small one, was the size of the rooms,they are tiny but were cleaned well and were ready when we returned every day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: gringa-1
Reviews.Content: A good location if you want to be walking distance to sights and transportation. The rooms were very nice, clean and comfortable. The 2-room suite was a little crowded, too much furniture, nicely done otherwise. It's walking distance to many sights,, as well as the cable car line,and the trolleys. Very convenient. Every day in the lobby: a very nice complimentary coffee and biscotti in the morning, and a wine tasting in the evening. Wifi was included if you have your own laptop, otherwise internet available in the lobby. The highlight of this hotel for us was the service offered by the staff, particularly the two concierges on duty while we were there. Their service was of the level and knowledge I would expect at at 5-star hotel. I had also called ahead for some information regarding bilingual tours (information I had a very hard time finding on the internet) , and everything was taken care of for us before we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Experienced the good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: These_are_my_travels
Reviews.Content: Similar to some other disgruntled reviewers here I was assigned a different room than I had booked. There were three of us and I had booked a two double bed room and had a confirmation to prove it. I had chosen this hotel for that particular reason as I was having difficulty getting a two bed room at nearby wharf hotels. I was given a king room with a cot on check-in. After a few trips by the clerk back to the manager who remained out of site I was told I had not booked a double bed room but a double occupancy room which wasn't true. They said they noticed we had three people so had automatically provided a cot to our room, I was told they were full and there were no other rooms available. When we got to our room the cot was already there but due to the small room I had to re-arrange furniture to get it to fit, in doing so having to re-assemble their cheap particle board table. The room faced a side street, the street directly below became very active at 5 am with motorcycles in particular in addition to trucks noisily heading up the street. I'm a sound sleeper normally and nothing wakes me so this was just a sign of how noisy it was. I managed to get switched to a two double bed room for our next couple of nights and experienced what all the good reviewers must have. The room was significantly larger, still small but liveable, and although still on the 3rd floor it faced the wharf and what I would have thought was the busier street but the traffic was much quieter and I didn't hear much at all the next two mornings. The valet's were a little slow and I hated the vulture baggage guy. I don't have a problem being helped up to the room although I;m fine doing it myself. This guy immediately put all my bags on the cart while I was pre-occupied with the valet but then while I was trying to correct the problems with the room at check-in he was impatiently trying to get us to hurry up in spite of me telling him just to leave the bags. The location is great, I opted for a Fisherman's wharf stay for vacation having stayed near Union square on business in the past and I'm glad I did as it was easy walking distance to Chinatown and the touristy area of the wharf. I'd be leaving a better rating if I were given the 2nd room on arrival but due to the mix-up and the fact others have experienced the same I'd avoid this hotel in the future opting not to take the chance of another mix-up.

Reviews.Title: “Check out the free wine”
Reviews.Author: Irene-Weston
Reviews.Content: Our room was small by American standards but really comfortable, well appointed, and quiet. The location is ideal but the car park is really expensive, so if you are ending a trip here, take your hire car back after you have unloaded your luggage and get a taxi to the airport. You can walk or ride the buses in SF, its fun. The lobby area was really pleasant and the free wine (or coffee) gets you talking to other guests. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Don't pay full price there are lots of cheap deals.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely loved it”
Reviews.Author: gothepanthers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome.. We stayed here for our honeymoon and they had a bottle of bubbly on ice waiting for us in our room..nice touch. The staff were very helpful with suggesting places to eat and with directions of how to get to places eg.baseball. The room was nice. The house keeping ladies were pleasant and always greeted us when we walked past. This hotel is in a perfect location. It is only several blocks from fishermans wharf, not far from the cable cars to union square. The free morning hot cocoa and coffee was nice before our daily excursions.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Tuscan Inn”
Reviews.Author: dysan1
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan Inn was in a great location a few minutes from Fisherman's Wharf. It was easy to walk to North Beach as well. We didnt' have a car, so we liked the fact it was a short walk to the cable car stop. The room was small, but clean, quiet, and suited our needs. The afternoon wine and cheese was a nice bonus as was the free Internet. The concierge at the hotel was extremely helpful and nice. He checked into baseball tickets, offered dinner reccomendations, and answered all of our san francisco questions. I would definitely stay at this hotel again in the future. It was a great base to explore San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise.....”
Reviews.Author: Mainframer
Reviews.Content: What can you say about a place that does not dazzle but delivers solid consistent performance.. The price was reasonable based on others in the vicinity and it does a good job. The room was clean, the staff was great and it was CLOSE to Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf (easy walk). I'd stay there again. The restaurant looks nice but I'm not a big Italian food fan so I bypassed the place. I went with average expectations and came away pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “A Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glasgow_Member06
Reviews.Content: San Francisco was our final stop on a drive up Highway 1. My wife and two friends stayed here for four nights in July 08. This was our third visit to the city but the first stay at the Tuscan Inn and we would strongly recommend it. We were surprised and delighted when, on arrival, we were given tokens for free continental breakasts. This was unexpected as we hadn't been informed about this by our travel agent. The hotel has a certain individual style that distinguishes it from the Sheratons, Holiday Inns, etc. The reception area is compact and during the free evening wine sampling gets quite busy. The free morning coffee is also well appreciated and attended. We had a rear room which at first disappointed me but the air-con was much quieter than that of our friends who also had a bit of bother with noise from the street. The rooms were a little bit tired and with the simple expedient of renewing the wallcovering would show a great improvement. The bed was comfortable and the rooms and bathrooms were kept clean and although the refrigerators are honour bars the hotel is happy for you to chill your own drinks in them. We found the reception staff, maids and porters friendly and helpful. We have now stayed in three hotels in Fisherman's Wharf but the Tuscan Inn represents a good comprise of location, cost and facilities. Oh and before I forget, the hotel restaurant El Pescatore serves excellent food at reasonable prices. I would recommend a stay at the Tuscan Inn when visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Right position to visit SFO”
Reviews.Author: giothelion
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the right position to visit the city. The price is really convenient. Remember to ask for having a courtyard room ... the risk is to have a room "in the street".

Reviews.Title: “Tuscan is Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlNC
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I just returned from Tuscan Inn, Fisherman's Wharf, in San Francisco. We booked our reservation with Southwest Vacations. We had a great time and could have stayed longer. The room was very nice, and had a nice bathroom. We did have a wall view from the window, but since I was not in the room except to sleep I did not make a big fuss. It was nice having the Safeway store across the street to get snacks. I enjoyed the hot chocolate every morning in the lobby. The fireplace in the lobby was very pretty, and the courtyard flowers were beautiful. The location was perfect. Alot of other hotels were more expensive but we were very happy at the Tuscan. The desk clerks were nice and helpful. My friend celebrated his birthday there! We walked to a lot of places. It was very convenient. We did not have a car, hotel parking is expensive. We had a Tower Tour bus pick us up every morning at the hotel and they did an excellent job. Also plenty of busses and taxis. Everyone there was friendly to us. We had a great and exciting trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: myllek
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel back in August of 2007 at the beginning and end a trip from San Francisco to Monterey. We booked the standard two queen room and were very happy with our stay. The room was wonderful with great beds, a nice bathroom and we also had an excellent view of Coit Tower as well. The location only 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf made it a perfect base for exploring the area, we were able to walk or take public transportation everywhere we went. If we hadn't been driving to Monterey the next day I wouldn't have rented a car. There's no need when staying in this hotel. The valet parking was very convenient and seemed secure as it is attached to the hotel. A lot of hotel parking garages/lots are not on the same premises as the hotel in the area. The restaurant located in the hotel was excellent and the morning coffee/biscotti was really nice as well. Would love to stay there again if we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not as good as our last stay”
Reviews.Author: NYerUWS
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in the past and liked it very much. This time, I was not very impressed. The room was small, with a king bed, and a truly claustrophobic bathroom. Two bath towels for two adults is just skimpy, and when you close the door to the tub/toilet combination, there is no room to breathe. The bed was comfortable. We were awakened by a loud racket at 0730 - construction nearby. There is no place to conveniently charge phone/blackberry/laptop without crawling around on the floor. Why do hotels not install convenient plugs for guests to recharge the devices with which we are all travelling? Morning coffee quite delicious, but when we checked out at 0545, we were never offered any to drink. Would it have been so difficult to offer us a little coffee, as it was probably ready by then? Location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect locatin for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: flowerd2004
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tuscan Inn over the Fourth of July weekend after using Priceline before Christmas to book a room (although I didn't actually think I would get one for only $75/nt over a holiday weekend!). Check in was quick and my boyfriend and I were given a queen room on the fourth floor facing the street. My boyfriend's first response was "wow, this is a tiny room", but it was what I was expecting considering the location and that this is only a 3-star property. It was in fact a small room (a King size bed would not have fit) with a tiny closet and 2 drawers for storing clothes. Good thing we only packed carry on luggage and didn't have much to put away! The room was always clean and the maid staff was friendly, saying "hello" and "have a nice day" as you passed. We were frequently in and out of the room to change clothes or take a nap and never walked in on a maid (or were walked in on ourselves). One day we had the do not disturb sign on the door before the maid had come so we could rest, and when we finally stepped out for about an hour, we changed the sign for maid service and everything was perfect when we returned! One bad part about the room was that some street noise traveled up, although we were only really disturbed one night when there was a car parked on the street playing loud music with people around it laughing and talking loudly. Pros at the hotel: Staff - Very friendly and helpful. We had to send and receive several faxes during our stay and they were always happy to help. We used the concierge to book theater tickets, which worked flawlessly, and we also called the front desk around midnight our last evening and asked them to arrange an airport shuttle the next day, which they did the following morning when the shuttle company opened. Amenities - While this hotel isn't a luxury property, they have some nice touches like marble bathrooms, mini bar, room service and an evening wine reception every day (which many people attended). The restaurant attached to the hotel is nice, with a great little bar area and friendly bartenders. The restaurant breakfast menu is pretty minimal, but it does the trick. Location - This is the best part of the hotel. Two blocks from Pier 41, one block to the F line street car two blocks to the cable car. This was an awesome area to gain access to many different parts of the city without trying too hard. Overall, I would say this room was not worth the rack rate of $250+ per night, but it was far beyond my expectations at the Priceline bargain rate!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling check in and lots of lies”
Reviews.Author: Neatandtidy
Reviews.Content: We booked two suites both with a king bed, pre-paid for both suites and received a reservation confirmation from Best Western. On arriving at the hotel we were told that one suite was ready and the other would be an hour or so. When we got to the suite that was ready we found that it was not a one king bed suite but a two bed suite. I rang reception and spoke to a person called Jamelia to ask to be allocated the right type of suite as per our reservation confirmation. Her attitude was appalling and this is where the lies started. She initially said that the reservation had come through incorrect from Best Western or that I had not booked correctly on the website. I offered to take the Best Western reservation confirmation to reception as evidence and she said that this was of absolutely no interest to her and that it made no difference. She then said that there were no king bed suites at the hotel at all and that all suites had two beds. I asked her why their website stated that this type of room was available if they did not exist as she had just stated. She said the website must be incorrect. Next we were offered a standard king bedroom, and I pointed out that this was a cheaper room than the suite we had booked. She said 'well you got a good rate by booking on line'. Like that matters. I had paid $1900 up front for the suites 2 months’ prior when making the booking. I then asked if the next suite would also be two beds instead of the king bed as she had just stated that this type of suite did not exist. Unbelievably she said that this next suite would have a King bed contradicting the lie she had just told us. At this point I asked to be put through to Best Western Customer Services and amazingly our room was changed to a king bed suite as per our reservation within the hour. The funny thing was that when we got to the room, there were welcome cookies and a welcome note for a Mr and Mrs Bonfiglio. So, sorry to this couple as they probably got a load of lies and bull when they arrived to find that they did not get the room they had booked. The hotel is also very noisy but I guess this is inevitable considering the location. The free drinks are great if you and like the feeling of getting something for nothing. Please also beware of the restaurant at the hotel. They state that there is an obligatory service charge for tables of more than 6. We dined as a party of 4 and were still hit with this and then the waitress failed to hand over $10 of change taking this as an additional service charge. On the plus side some of the staff were nice and helpful especially the concierge who was most gracious. The suites are a decent size, clean and the décor is not of a bad standard. If you want to be near Fishermans Wharf the location is great. I did contact Best Western on returning home to see what response I would get after the investigation. Apparently the hotel had told Best Western that we were contacted directly by the management during our stay and that the matter was resolved (we were not contacted). While they apologised for the inconvenience they said that there was nothing more to do as we were eventually given the room we had booked. No mention of the lies, arrogance and ‘up you attitude’ of some of the staff then??

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: pjsltk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights for $125 from Hotwire. The first night we were on the Street, and could here motorcycles racing all night. We complained, and were moved to a quiet room for the duration of our stay. On the morning of the second day my daughter had stomach cramps and we had to go to the emergency room. We left at 6:30 AM, and the front desk and valet had a cab ready with instructions on where to go by the time we came down the elevator. We were very impressed with the service we received. The location for tourists can not be beat. You are 2 blocks from the wharf, the Mason line cable car is right behind the hotel, the F line street car is a block away, and pier 39 and the alcatraz tour is with in walking distance. There is a Trader Joes, Safeway, and Walgreens close by too. The rooms were nice, comfortable, and clean. The shower was great.
