I am still missing the strong coffee and biscotti we had for breakfast every morning. The next time we are in SF, we will be staying at the Tuscan Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Find!”
Reviews.Author: NtrDm2004
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because of a booking on Priceline. I got a GREAT price on the hotel and was extremely happy with the hotel. First, it is in a fantastic location - blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and within walking distance to so many things! Right from checking in, the staff was unbelievable! Every single staff member we came into contact with was extremely helpful and very nice! The room was on the smaller side but there was definitely enough room for two of us. The coffee, tea and biscotti in the morning is very nice. I would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Tiamaria865
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful in every way EXCEPT it was noisy at night. Our rooms faced the street rather than the courtyard and the traffic - especially the motorcycles - were loud all night long. You can drown out the noise with the fan, except if the fan is on then the air conditioner will cause it to go on an off, so you have the fan on and are too hot or the air on and intermittent noise. I suggest you request a room facing the courtyard (even numbered rooms, I think?) or pack a fan! Very comfortable beds and rooms - nice decor! Don't miss the 5 O'Clock wine hour. This is a great Italian tradition that matches the theme of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: canuck006
Reviews.Content: We have been planning this trip for a year. We used priceline to try to find us a 4 star hotel near the wharf. Well we got a Hotel . We arrived wondering what to expect and as soon as we arrived the staff made us feel welcomed .The 5 o'clock wine gathering in the lobby is terrific. rooms are clean,new, quiet, and relaxing.The concierge service is second to none. I highly recommend this hotel and even my call it a 5 star...

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here- they charge $75 if you depart a day early on mult- night stay”
Reviews.Author: sheeshm
Reviews.Content: I was told that they required 24 hours to change dates of stay or cancel. I checked in and had planned on staying three nights. After the first night, I found out that I would be leaving one day early and told them -- more than 24 hours in advance -- that I would be leaving one day early. I was charged a $75 early departure fee. I will never stay here again and recommend you do not either.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but.......”
Reviews.Author: 58HUSTLER
Reviews.Content: I'm not quite as impressed with the place as most seem to be. To begin, I'm more of what you'd call a budget traveler, and although I got this place at a good price via Priceline, there are some things to consider. First, the biggest "gotcha" is the mandatory valet parking. With taxes, it set me back over $43; and for me, that's rather stiff. The room was clean, but on the small side, especially in width. If someone was sitting at the desk (located at the center of the room in front of the bed), there is no room for another person to get by. Comfortable bed, but nothing special. No pool, spa or workout room that I could find. It is centrally located to the Wharf, within reasonable walking distance of Pier 39, etc. Not trying to bad mouth the Tuscan, it is a nice place to stay, and if you're not put off by the valet parking, you shouldn't be too disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: csg
Reviews.Content: My son, his girlfriend, and I stayed four nights recently at Tuscan Inn. The location is great, the hotel is very clean and nicely decorated. Rooms are small, but they have everything you need. Coffee in the mornings in the lobby, and wine in the afternoons are a nice touch. Adjoining restaurant was really good. Tourists from all over the USA and world were there. Concierge desk stayed very busy. I enjoyed my four nights there and I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Austher
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a weekend trip up to San Francisco and wanted to stay at a place that was cheap and close to Fisherman's Wharf. This place did not disappoint. Our room was only $99 per night through some promotion found on Travelzoo. I figure you get what you pay for... but the room was actually pretty nice. There wasn't much of a view (I think the window faced the adjacent building) but the room was fairly large, clean, and the room (as well as the whole floor) was nice and quiet. There was a very private feel to the hotel. They also had a staffmember serve soda and wine in the loungy lobby area in the early evening, which was a nice bonus. The surrounding area of the hotel, to our surprise, seemed safe and relatively clean. But the location was great... just a few blocks from the touristy parts of the Wharf. Would definitely recommend this hotel for your next brief stay in the bay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheilanj
Reviews.Content: we just stayed at the tuscan inn for about 5 nights. it was definetely worth it. we had a great room, clean and spacious enough for 2 adults and 2 small kids. and the price was fantastic. we first booked thru hotels.com and thought we got a great deal..our sf itinerary changed a bit, and we needed another 2 nights at the tuscan inn, and the hotel said they would match our hotels.com price, they actually gave us a lower price than that! wow! all the staff we encountered were super friendly and the hotel location is great..enjoy your stay there, i'm sure you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: lorelie21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn for 4 nights. The room was just the right size for 2 people and 2 suitcases (how big do you need it?), and the king size bed was spacious and comfortable. Our room was at the back of the hotel which meant we got no street noise. Cafe Pescatore next door was good for breakfast, and the wharf is only 5 mins walk with loads of places to eat. We got snacks from Safeway opposite the hotel opposite to the right, and the cable car stop was one street behind the hotel to the left. One thing you must do when at the wharf is have a clam chowder in a bread bowl, the best one we found was at the aptly named Chowders on pier 39 next to the wipeout cafe. It was delicious! Back to the hotel, we didn't go to the wine evenings but they were always busy so it must be good. As we probably won't be going back to San Francisco ( As much as we loved it, it's rather a long way) we won't be staying here again, but would definately recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: ManHeadingNorth
Reviews.Content: Arriving mid-afternoon, after a rather "fast" shuttle ride from the airport to Fishermans Wharf, we entered the hotel lobby, and was quite surprised. From outside, the building didn't really shout out to us. Checking in was easy, with very friendly, helpful front desk staff. Our room was upgraded complimentary. The room was clean, quite large with a very large bed, plus room for a sofa, table, large TV and extra chair. The bathroom was clean, well lit, and always well stocked with shampoo etc and towels. The bed was really comfortable, and we had a good nights sleep every night. The only odd thing was the bathroom door and room door opened outwards into the room and hallway respectively. Our room faced the small courtyard in the centre of the hotel, not the street, so noise was kept to a minimum. The complimentary wine in the evening was a great bonus as was the tea, coffee and hot chocolate in the morning. Not very far at all to the seafront. Only 2 blocks!! Safeway and Walgreens across the road for those little snacks,drinks and souveneirs. Denny's about 3 blocks away! Great!! There is plenty to do here in Fishermans Wharf. Would recommend to anyone to stay here, and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tuggster
Reviews.Content: Fantastic choice, 10 days at the Tuscan, location is wonderful only a couple of blocks from pier 39. The Coffee and Biscotti in the morning were a nice touch, and the wine tasting every evening became a must get back to the hotel for. Room spacious 2 double beds gave us plenty of room, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was a good size. there is a bar up the road if you are a sports fan at the grand hyatt which is worth a visit. Overall a fantastic time was had there and i look forward to returning A+++++++++++++

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Lovely Inn”
Reviews.Author: Lynn_StPaul
Reviews.Content: Our room was absolutely lovely, although dresser drawers and closet were small. The bed was very comfortable. Windows don't open - so no fresh air. Internet is free. I needed something printed two different times, and after following their directions I went to the front desk and was able to get it right away. There is a small refrigerator, but it was stocked so very little space for our own "goodies". The location is perfect - two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and only a block to the street car and trolley. The bathroom was large and included a mounted makeup mirror. Towels were large and soft. The shampoo, conditioner, soap and lotion they provide is heavenly! Coffeemaker in the room and when "regular" coffee wasn't left one day, it was delivered immediately when I requested it. Lots and lots of restaurants nearby. We had a wonderful time and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay at the Tuscan Inn”
Reviews.Author: shona62
Reviews.Content: Tuscan Inn has it all, exellant location,very close to public transport, very clean, impeccable, friendly service and a supermarket opposite. Our king bed room was quite overlooking the courtyard and the decor lovely. The complimentary toiletries, coffee and biscotti and the happy hour drinks each eveing just go to prove they go the extra mile. We found a great breakfast place just around the corner in Taylor St, called Darren's Cafe, good prices with excellant food and service. I would not hesitate to stay here again and highly recommend it. Shona of Sydney/London

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again, eventhough we had an issue”
Reviews.Author: kjshurbet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn, because its walking distance to the Cruise Pier. We were going on a cruise and wanted to be close to cruise terminal. Not only close, but in the Fishermans Wharf area, did not need to rent car, public transportation out front. Our room was very nice and comfy, only complain about room was it was too small. Would stay here again, event hough they did not know what they did with our luggage when we checked out, but I am trying to work with them now about it, we eventually found it, but the experience was not great. (lack of communication and very unhelpful about it on there end)

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value for money”
Reviews.Author: johnPerpignan
Reviews.Content: Hotels in SF are not cheap,and room sizes are not overly big,so a pretty tiny room for $180 was no big surprise. Valet parking for $40 per night seems a bit steep,but at least the service was efficient and quick. Overall the Tuscan Inn is a nice hotel. very clean,well maintained,with efficient,if not overly friendly service. the couple of faults with room features were fixed very quickly,which was a nice change from the interminable wait often suffered in European properties. The hotel makes a big thing of the coffee/bisc service in the morning,and this is quite nice. I'd say that,as far as the evening (5 to 6 ) wine service is concerned,if you happen to be in the hotel,it's fine. But not worth rushing back from a day out for. Breakfast was OK,but expensive. Much better option is Pats Cafe,just round the corner nr the cable car terminus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gemela01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to where you want to be. Great room! Everything was clean, good staff...The hotel is in very good condition. The prize for vallet parking is steep but I think you can expect that anywhere you go in San Francisco. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: JuanitaBrighton
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 day stay -we are a family of 4 with 2 daughters aged 15 and 20. We stayed in a family room which was not enormous but plenty big enough for us all. Shower/bathroom was good with good shower and plenty of space.We had a fridge and television and coffee making facilities. Beds were very comfortable and although we were at street level it was not noisy at all. The free coffee and biscotti in the morning kept us going until breakfast. We used the Hollywood Cafe-turn left out of hotel and it is a short distance up on the other side of the road opposite the Hilton. The breakfasts are brilliant and cheap. Evening wine hour from 5-6 was also good -free wine and nibbles and a chance to talk to other guests about places to visit , eat etc. Rooms were well cleaned and reception staff helpful. Take a jacket -it was sunny but windy on the wharf-we were also glad of a scarf.It meant we did not have to buy a SF fleece like a lot of other people! Our best bits were a visit to the Coit Tower, lunch at The Cheesecake factory at the top of Macey's, riding the cable cars, the bus tour and exploring the wharf area as well as the shops downtown. We walked a lot which meant we could eat the fantastic pancakes every day and plenty of cheesecake. We felt totally safe wherever we went. We all found plenty to do and had a great time -we flew to Las Vegas after that!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice --Would recommend to my friends”
Reviews.Author: i00567
Reviews.Content: We read reviews on many hotels looking for above average accomodations in a convenient location. The Tuscan Inn fit that well. Very comfortable stay and got a good deal on Orbitz to boot. Only drawback is room size. We started w/ a king w/ sofa bed for my son but we were tripping on each other so we upgraded to a suite. We also moved from a street view room to a courtyard as the street noise was extremely loud. Staff was some of the nicest I have encountered in a long time. The concierge here was 1st class. Would highly remonmmend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: claira2609
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, nice location for everything! Very clean, get a glass of wine free between 5&6pm in the lobby. Get an internal top floor room if you can, no noise from traffic or people upstairs. There's no view anyway so best to get some peace and quiet (no that it a noisy hotel anyway). Also book Alcatraze trip as soon as you get there (from Pier 31 I think it was) as it gets busy days in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms; great staff; great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malcontent
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a recent trip to San Francisco. Stayed at the Tuscan Inn near Fisherman's Wharf and it was excellent. Tuscan Inn has exceptionally helpful and friendly staff. There was never a time where I saw the concierge desk unstaffed. In fact, the concierges seemed to be the busiest people in the hotel; always assisting someone with a reservation, recommendation, a jogging route, etc. The hotel had nIce, well-decorated, fairly-modern rooms. Some of the common spaces are a little worn but our king guest room was very comfortable. OK... this is Fisherman's Wharf so there are some obnoxious, tourist-trap activities around. But.. the hotel is also only a few blocks from North Beach where we found some great little restaurants and cafes. Would definitely return to SFO and to the Tuscan Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: C8
Reviews.Content: Stayed March 14 - 17, 2008. The Tuscin Inn is a great hotel depending your room location. Location is the best. Everything is in walking distance, shopping, etc. The weather is great, just a little cold and windy but no rain; there were sunny days on our trip. Walgreens was a great store and purchase clothing less than the vendor on the street were offering. I had a government rate which was very good for the room selection. We had a double beds for the first 2 nights and a suite for the next two nights. The room are exact has they appear on the wedsite. Made our reservations on Best Western.com. The room 454 had double beds and no view. The closet are very small but the room was comfortable. When checking in remember to asked for the bar key so you can store beverages in the refrigerator. Room 402, was the suite, large bathrooom, no closet space, nice room, fireplace, but the sofa bed was terrible. In addition, the heater did not work, so I had to order additional blankets to get warm...even received a slight cold upon return. Room 402 did have a view, they were willing to change room but we had already uppacked and did not realize the heater was not working until our 2nd night. Did not asked for a discount; they told me to contact Manager who was unable at the time each time I inquired. The Corceige was excellent and some of the hotel staff did care and others did not (may be the government rate). The coffee in the morning was great; did not attend the wine party. Did not eat at the restaurant, but room service was great. If you book a room, asked for the courtyard view if possibe. Location is everything at this site; everything you need is right in the area. Pier 39 and other activities are in walking distance. Do you go the aquarium; not worth the price. Grayline tours were great. Took the $10 per person on the ride around the bay (best price). The battleship was a great tour also. Did not do Alcaraz tour due to the kids. Overall, the stay at The Tuscan Inn was great and would highly recommend due to the room service. There are other hotels in the area who do not offer room service. We traveled with 2 adults and 2 children.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tuscan Inn San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: talullab
Reviews.Content: I am always concerned when I book a hotel on Fishermans wharf in San Francisco, as many are very run down. When I drove up to this hotel it was excellent. There were 2 doormen just waiting to help you. The hotel has been renovated in the past 2 years and it was great. The staff very polite smiling and helpful.The lobby was comfortable Every evening, guests are welcome to the hosted evening Wine and Italian Beer reception from 5:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m and always have Italian roast coffee, tea and biscotti in the lobby. Free high speed wireless Internet access, which in San Francisco most always has a charge. I will always come back to this hotel for business travel or for pleasure.I travel quite often and have stayed in many different hotels. Right now this hotel is at the top of my list. I will always tell everyone to try it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and location! Great city for couples”
Reviews.Author: Roll-Tide-5
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel! It was near the ocean- about 2 blocks away. Location was also near Pier 39 (shopping, sea lions, and marina), Ghiradelli's chocolate factory, and Alcatraz. Lots of little shops nearby- very touristy. At Pier 39 the shops were nicer with a great outdoor atmosphere. Loved eating at Bubba Gump Shrimp Co.- as in Forest Gump. Great shrimp, fish, chicken fingers, hushpuppies, etc with lots of windows to enjoy the ocean and marina. The gift shop is great, too, if Forest Gump is one of your favorite movies like mine. My husband and I went for our anniversary and it was perfect. The Golden Gate Bridge is unbelievable! It just makes you happy inside seeing it. We walked across and back which was so nice to enjoy each other's company without toddlers wrapped around our legs. With this hotel we received a free 1 hour tour/cruise around Alcatraz and down to the Golden Gate Bridge. You also get 2 free transportation passes each day of your stay that we used for the trolley systems. Their travel system is called the MUNI and includes the trolleys or the city buses. The drivers are a great help for any questions you have. We used the trolley and buses for the Golden Gate Bridge. WE Loved the Trolleys! You can just ride with no particular destination in mind to get a feel for the city. Also great for going to the section of the city for the major shopping area (I can't remember what it's called but the area feels like New York City- very busy, hustle and bustle.) And remember the MUNI passes were free! We rented a car to go to Napa Valley to see the vineyards and Muir Woods to see the giant redwood trees. This was a nice little morning hike that my husband really enjoyed. Whatever the weather says for your trip to San Fran, take a heavy jacket/ coat. Everybody that doesn't do this buys one at the little tourist shops. (smile) Hotel was clean and a great price. However, don't count on the concierge for help. He was always covered up when we went by. This city is a must for any couple!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: kaszobody
Reviews.Content: Great location, near lots of stuff to walk too. Concierge was EXCELLENT!!! His name was Clay, very helpful and spent lots of time with you. Has a restraunt/bar in hotel, limited italian food, but nice to sit and have a few drinks. Rooms nice, beds very comfortable!. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: BnB_SE_Texas
Reviews.Content: Booked this on Expedia on one of their 24 hour half-price specials. For $99, we had a room on the fourth floor with courtyard view. It was quiet and comfortable. Both the bedroom and bathroom had plenty of room. Tuscan Inn is within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, Lombard Street, & Cable Cars. The front desk was helpful in providing the $11 all-day cable car/F-Line pass (Otherwise it's $5 per one-way ride). The concierge was knowledgeable not only about where to eat but where to find the cheapest gas on the way to the airport. Valet parking was $45 per night with tax, but that includes in and out privileges and my car was there whenever I needed it. Next time we have a layover in San Francisco, Tuscan Inn will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Coit
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights and wish we could stay longer. The staff members were extra helpful, the room well decorated, detailed, clean, and bright. Liked the wine, beer, and soft drinks happy hour, the proximity to all points of interest in Fisherman's Wharf, the cable cars, grocery stores, gym, etc. This is a real find. Nice Italian restaurant in hotel, too. Watch out for steep parking rates of about $45 per night. This total includes the taxes and tips for mandatory valet parking. Aside from the parking rate, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tuscan Inn”
Reviews.Author: keokimax
Reviews.Content: Beautifully furnished rooms. Was disappointed not to have a small refrigerator or a clock radio. Maid service was excellent ! Front desk and bell men were all very friendly and efficient. They gave out maps to help us find Chinatown, Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, as well as point out bus routes. The flower boxes around the hotel and in the court yard were beautiful as well. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “will stay again”
Reviews.Author: rosemariestlouis
Reviews.Content: we found a friendly staff through out the hotel great location, rooms were small but as pointed out to me all land is prime in the area and all places have small rooms. we had 4 adults and 2 double beds but so much to do in the area only used our room to sleep anyway. large clean bathrooms fully stocked with everything needed. all 4 of us said we would go back there again. what a nice clean friendly place to stay,

Reviews.Title: “Stay away during renos”
Reviews.Author: travellingtourister
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in early/mid February, after much research online and in travel books. I thought that I had found accommodation that was both within our budget and of high quality. Yes, there IS construction going on, and it started every morning at 9:00am for us; if you will be gone by this time, and away until after supper, then there shouldn't be a problem, provided you have a room facing the courtyard (away from the busy street in front). Issues we ran into: -Didn't have the room as requested in my reservation, so they had to put me in a queen bed on day 1, then move to a king days 2-4. -The first night, we also had to be moved at 2:00am because our ventilation started clicking non-stop--repair person came, suggested we just move rooms. Would have been ok, if not for: -Construction at 9:00am each morning. Heard it loud and clear on floors 2 and 4. -Also, placed us in a king suite that was joined with another room via a private doorway; the noise from the other family with kids was evident as of 7am as well. But, we couldn't move again because there were no other rooms available with king. -Showed up for breakfast in their restaurant at 10:31am--I'm not exaggerating--would not serve us, since they said they stop taking orders at 10:30am--the place had one other couple in it--could they afford to lose business over one minute? I guess so. Perhaps I had higher expectations, or perhaps not...Staff at front desk was fine, obviously the restaurant could use some work...Rooms were clean, always done promptly. Location was nice for getting all around the city; we mostly walked from place to place, even to and from downtown along the Embarcadero. The reno's look to be in full swing; I would doubt anything will be winding down in the near future; I'd certainly call their front desk and make sure that there are NO renovations being done prior to coming. Happy travelling!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: lozzdog
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in San Francisco on two previous occasions - firston Union Square and second @ Fishermans Wharf. We elected to stay for our third visit at fishermans Wharf again as we felt it had more to offer for tourists. The Tuscan Inn was a great choice. The beds very comfortable, rooms tastefully decorated and were very clean and comfortable. We arrived mid December and the Christmas ambience was fantastic - Christmas tree, open fire place and pre dinner drinks in the foyer. The morning complimentry coffee was good but we still needed to have breakfast out and about. We would definitely stay there again on our next visit to SF - value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but teeny rooms”
Reviews.Author: heiho
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Tuscan Inn for 2 nights in January. Staff was pleasant, bellhops were more than happy to get us a cab. Good location a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, if that's where you want to be. After strolling around the city, I thought a more fun neighborhood to stay in would have been Italy. Also, our room was so teeny tiny, we had to let each other pass by between the end of the bed and the desk, because there wasn't enough room for two people. I guess the price was good for the city, but the room was just too small.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of jack-hammering renovations”
Reviews.Author: beetle-bailey
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Best Western Tuscan Inn Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco based on it's #1 status on Trip Advisor and great review in Frommer's San Francisco 2007 travel guide. We booked directly with the hotel and called to confirm our reservation the night before. We were very pleased with the hotel's location right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf/North Beach...close to great restaurants (Pat's Cafe & The Buena Vista), transportation (buses, trolleys, & ferries), and the waterfront but what we weren't informed of was the on-going, messy & noisy renovations (Frommer's listed the property as having completed room renovations in 2005). There was no mention from hotel staff...all that was present was a dumpster out front and a small sign on our floor (2nd) saying sorry for any inconvenience. Thankfully we took off early every morning so we really didn't hear the workers until our last day. The jack-hammering in the room next to us started at 8:30am and was still in full swing at noon when we checked out. My husband mentioned to the front desk staff that it would have been appreciated if someone had told us about the renovations when we made our reservation or at check in and was told that the hotel manager set the policy that the staff was to not tell guests. We would recommend this hotel but not until the renovations are fully complete.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect San Francisco treat.....”
Reviews.Author: CarolLynn96
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Tuscan Inn at fishermans wharf last year, and when i booked the room I was just glad that i got a room at a good location in S.F. But when i got there ...I was truly impressed. You immediately get the feel of "Tuscan Inn" as soon as you walk in. The hotel has the perfect location for a S.F. weekend....you can walk to a lot of the city and there is a trolly car ride not too far. The hotel is clean and very nicely decorated. They even have a nice evening cocktail hour. The rooms were nice but not spectaular...as they were a little small. But stil thats being picky. In the morning the conceirge , told us about a little breakfast place in the morning only a 5 minute walk from the hotel that was out of this world. Sometimes , you get such a perfect vacation that you feel like you have to take a new trip more often , this hotel definetly made me feel that way. Highly recommended , for a great weekend getaway to the Bay area.

Reviews.Title: “10 Gold Stars”
Reviews.Author: LadyWard1
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan Hotel in Fishermans Wharf is outstanding. The location; the rooms; the staff; the concierge; the Managers nightly wine reception (nice touch); everything about this hotel made our holiday MAGIC. Thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: mbeaj
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend, great location, clean, quiet, friendly, nicely decorated, happy hour 5p-6p, just tea/coffee avail in am. Less expensive than originally booked b/c special winter rate.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem in a Sea of Tourist Schlock”
Reviews.Author: PDXNoah
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan Inn at Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco is in such a great location for tourism, I'm surprised there isn't a much larger hotel here. After reading countless reviews of this property, I was confident we could have an enjoyable stay here and avoid any potential pitfalls - and we were not disappointed. I discovered a special rate at Travelzoo, which probably swayed me to try this hotel, and made my own reservation with Best Western. There was no problem in them honoring the special rate. If you are bothered by street noise then be sure to ask for a room with a courtyard view. The courtyard is tiny - but we could not detect any street noise in our room on the second floor looking over the courtyard. Currently (January 2008) they are remodeling some rooms on the upper floors, and there is considerable construction noise in some areas that started after 9:30 AM and stopped by 5:00 PM. It would be a good idea to ask for a room away from the construction for the least noise, if you are going to be in your room during the day or sleeping in late. Gregory, at check in, was quick and polite and helpful with our request for a courtyard room. The room is a bit on the small-side, but I think that is the standard in San Francisco with only a few exceptions. Our room was very clean and fresh-smelling. One window did open, which kept the room from getting stale. Drawer space was minimal, with only two small but deep drawers, and the closet was a little small. Clothes for two people for five days maxed out the tiny closet. There is a refrigerator in the room with is also the mini-bar, so there isn't a lot of room in there for take-out food, but is ample for medications, etc. If you plan to use the refrigerator, make sure to take a key to the mini bar, or it will be able to get into it. The room includes a ironing board and iron, although using it would make the room a bit cramped. There is a wall-mounted hair dryer in the bathroom. The restaurant in the hotel - Cafe Pescatore - does the breakfast run for room service, it was adequate but a little overpriced. Lunch and dinner room service is provided by North Beach Pizza, which deliveries many Italian specialties including pasta, entrees, salads, sandwiches and of course - pizza. However, there are countless restaurants of all sorts and price ranges within a 1-4 block walk of this hotel, there is little reason to order room service. We were very happy with the location of this hotel. Within two blocks (and not even uphill!) you could catch the Mason-Powell cable car, also many of the Muni Buses go by the hotel and the "F Line" historic streetcar is only one block away. Just a 3 block walk north and you are on the waterfront of Fisherman's Wharf. There are two grocery stores (Safeway and Trader Joe's) within 2 blocks of the hotel. One of the things we enjoyed most, was walking away from the touristy area of Fisherman's Wharf and onto the side streets to look for restaurants. There are many smaller places with very good food at very reasonable prices, all within walking distance. Each night when we returned to our room, it had been cleaned up very nicely and restocked. We made sure to tip the housekeeping staff each morning, perhaps that insured that they did an outstanding job every day. We felt we got a reasonable value for the $99 rate we received and assuming we could get a similar or better rate, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but room 127 noisy”
Reviews.Author: vmoon8965
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Tuscan Inn between Chirstmas and New Years. We too had a bad experience with street noise in room 127. It seemed as if the windows were open as it was that loud. We requested a change to another room for the remainder of our stay and they were very helpful and immediately moved us to room 361 which was quiet and peaceful. I would definately stay there again and recommend it to others, but only if you reserve an off-street or courtyard room. We were able to get a great $99.00 per night rate through travelzoo.com and I did not felt we received a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Carleeqt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights at the Best Western Tuscan Inn. My husband called the day before to ask if we could check in early as we were due to arrive 3 hours before check-in time, which is 3 pm. They said it would not be a problem. We arrived at the San Francisco airport and took at taxi to the hotel. The cost for the taxi was approx. 40.00 plus tip. We decided to take a taxi as we wanted to get checked in fast because we were due to take the Alcatraz tour at 1:55 pm. When we arrived at the hotel there was no problem getting a room. She told us the only room ready was facing the court yard. This was fine as we knew we'd only be sleeping in our room so the view didn't matter. We were given room 421. The room was small but it was fine for sleeping. It was clean, although I did notice several spiders in the room. Just small ones though. The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. There was internet access available through your TV. There was a keyboard provided. We did not use this service but thought it was nice that it was available if needed. The room also came equipped with an alarm clock radio. There were a few things that bothered me, after leaving a tip the first day the maid never bothered to refill our shampoos, conditioner, or soap, and removed the part bottles that we had not used. I had thankfully kept some from the hotel we stayed at in Toronto before departing. The other thing that bothered me was after returning to our room in the late evening our window was left wide open. It was freezing cold in the room and I don't think it warmed up even with the heat on until the next day. Now I know we were on the 4th floor, but still I don't think it was proper for the maid to leave our window open all day/evening. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, we chose to eat at the IHOP around the corner for breakfast and it was good food and service, and they are open 24 hours. We chose to eat there both mornings. For dinner we ate at Pier 39 both times. Swiss Louis the first night. It was fantastic! The second night we ate at the Wipe Out grill, it was okay. The hotel is very central to everything and I would stay there again for its location. We felt very safe walking around at night and we did see some vagrants but not one of them bothered us. I was surprised at the amount of homeless people and beggars but none of them bothered or even asked for money. Most of them just held out cups or had signs or were street performers working for tips. We come from a small farming community of 6000 people so if it didn't bother us I don't think it should be a concern for others. There were excellent street performers which we found very entertaining. We especially enjoyed the guy who does spray paint art. We purchased one of his paintings for 10.00. What a bargain!! One word of advise is to pre book your tickets for the Alcatraz tour. Luckily I had read here on tripadvisor that the tickets sell out fast and usually days or weeks in advance and I had bought mine a month ahead. I booked my tickets online through their website. There were several people looking for tickets on the Saturday and the next available tour was Wed. morning at 9 am. Lots of disappointed people. You want to take the Hornblower Alcatraz tour at Pier 33, you get to visit Alcatraz and do a audio tour. It was fantastic. We also did the Aquarium under the bay. It was wonderful as well. If you have any other questions please feel free to msg me and I will do my best to answer your questions. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The Good & The Bad”
Reviews.Author: di1221
Reviews.Content: Hubby & I stayed here for a few days in November 2007. My biggest problem was our room. We were on the 2nd leg of our journey but if I had the energy I would have asked to be moved. Our room looked most like the photo of the room done in red,black and white without the red velvet couch in our room. It was very very small. We were facing the street and it was a bit noisey at times.The thing that bothered me the most was the bathroom was very dated. On top of that the wall paper was actually peeling. I am so dispapointed that I can't remember what room # it was becasue apparantly after reading other reviews, there are some newer and nicer rooms. I felt we paid too much for the particaulr room we got. Now on to the good: Location location location! Also, the wine hour is very nice and I don't even drink wine. A hot tip from the bell boy: arrive in the lobby about 10 minutes before wine hour begins. They usually bring in a deep dish pizza from the restaurant which is gone in a flash. We did and enjoyed it very much. In the morning a nice touch along with coffee and hot tea was hot chocoalte. Now would I stay here again? Well...maybe. If I got a really nice room like some of the other writers describe with a fridge too...perhaps...I still wonder if another hotel in the same area would have been a better deal. The other thing that I found disappointing was I can't remember the exact details but something like the charge they quote for parking (very pricey) was even more than that because there was some sort of a tax...

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sixamigos
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 5 nights staying at the Tuscan Inn at Fisherman's Wharf. The front desk staff were very helpful. The hotel itself was one of the best we have stayed in. It had such a warm and friendly atmosphere. The wine tasting in the afternoon made available from the manager was a really nice touch as was the free tea and coffee in the lobby in the morning which got you off to a great start for the day. The hotel was very central to everything. We walked to Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square, Starbuck's, laundromat (1/2mile from hotel). Italian restaurant next door to hotel had fantastic food. As for the room we could only find one complaint which was the shower head. Apart from this the room itself was perfect, very clean and fresh clean amenities every day. Attractions that we feel are a must are:- Segway tour, Cable car and Ghiradelli ice cream is a must!! These attractions are in very close proximity to each other. Jacob on the Segway tour was very patient and lots of fun. Also make sure you visit Alcatraz.

Reviews.Title: “A nice comfortable hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Penta5Vancouver
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan Inn is a moderately priced hotel located near Fisherman's Wharf, dozens of good restaurants and ten minutes to downtown by cab. The cable car is only a few blocks away. The rooms are large comfortable and well furnished, suitable for business travelers or tourists. Onsite parking is available. The hotel has free wireless. The restaurant attached to the hotel is good and well priced. You'll need a reservation for dinner. Each evening the hotel hosts a wine and cheese bar between 5 and 6pm. It is well attended and provides an opportunity to hear other tourists tales of the city. We stay here every time we come to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!!”
Reviews.Author: archi3004
Reviews.Content: This place is just as the way it has been described.The pics of the rooms are the same as they present them online. Nice Location.Easy walkable accessibility to Pier 39 and the Tram Ride.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here next time we're in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: KLORIK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location whether you are focusing your sightseeing at the Wharf or all over town. Bus lines run out front and the Wharf is a couple short blocks away. The staff was great, all the way around, helpful and polite. The room was clean, well decorated and had all you could ask for. One of the cable car lines in a block or two away along with a pharmacy, Starbucks and Barnes and Noble right around the corner. Convenient if nothing else. We stayed in a room overlooking Mason (which actually overlooks a small parking stack) BUT I thought it was great one morning to wake up to the sound of sea lions barking, where else but San Francisco! When standing in the window we could see Coit Tower with the moon rising in the background...not too bad for 125 a night on Thanksgiving weekend! I will return and recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved teh Best Western”
Reviews.Author: suzWex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western for four nights commencing Oct 30th for the start of our honeymoon. We had spent all day travelling (flying from Ireland) and when we arrived to check in the hotel had upgraded us and there was a bottle of champagne in the room for us. This was a lovely surprise and was much appreciated. The room itself was lovely and spotlessly clean. The hotel itself is in a perfect location for all the attractions. Its about a five minute walk to the end of the road and you are at Pier 39 where you can book your trips to the various attractions. There are also plenty of restaurants, bars and shops. At 5 o'clock every evening in the hotel lobby there is a free wine reception for an hour. This is a great idea as everyone sits around and chills out for an hour. There is also a lovely Italian restaurant attached to the hotel and the food in there is lovely. The staff were very friendly and you could book any trips you wanted with them. I could not fault this hotel at all and thank them for a wonderful four days.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in SF by Far!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mamadp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I take annual trips to San Francisco and have stayed at many different hotels. This trip and hotel stay was by far the best ever!!!! From the time we walked into the lobby until the time we checked out the stafff was always very hellpful and the room was very nice, clean, and quiet. This time we brought our one year old son and the fact that there was a grocery store (Safeway) next door to the hotel made it very convenient for us. He had an amazing time as well. I definitely recommend the Tuscan Inn @ Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PadreLuis
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my stay at the Tuscan Inn. The first thing I have to comment on is the great location. You are only blocks away from all the action. I was traveling alone and found the area very safe. The Safeway right next door was great...very convenient. The people at the hotel were all very friendly and helpful. I thought the rooms were good...not great, but pretty much what I expected. The wine reception at night was a great chance to meet some of the other hotel guests and learn about some of the tours. Check out the submarine at pier 45 (I forget the name)..very interesting and inexpensive. I also loved the tour of Alcatraz but be careful because tickets get sold out sometimes days in advance. I also did the five hour city tour with San Francisco Shuttle Tours. I would absolutely do this if you are looking for a way to see a lot of the major sites in the city. If you do it early in your vacation, you can then go back and visit some of the places and spend more time (tour stops are quick). I would definitely stay here again if I was going back to San Francisco. Quick note....it seems different people I spoke to pd. different rates for their rooms. I booked directly through Best Western and found that I had one of the more resonable rates. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbearLondon
Reviews.Content: This was my 9th trip to San Francisco but unlike prior trips I was with my in-laws and had different criteria for the trip, they wanted to be close to all the Fisherman’s Wharf action and walking distance to the main tourist attractions, this hotel was ideal and the best value we could find in the location. The hotel was clean, quiet, large rooms and very close to the Wharf and local restaurants. Nothing disappointed us about our stay and we didn’t even take advantage of the free wine tasting between 5-6pm. We did however make use of the free tea and coffee when we had an early start. The hotel gives a feeling of a small family run business whilst being under the umbrella of a brand you know. If you want to know what you’re getting, stay in a larger than average SF hotel room and be walking distance to the bay area then I don’t believe you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DonnaGisbert
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Tuscan Inn for three nights. The hotel was a wonderful place to stay and we were very comforatble. The lobby was welcoming, the staff was friendly and we felt good about being there. I would say, though, that the price was just a bit too high for what we got. $175 per night (after the discount for firefighters, mind you). There is virtually no counterspace in the bathroom at all. Upon our arrival, there was a SLIGHT odor in bathroom but nothing worth complaining about. Maid service was prompt and outstanding. But, it was close to the Wharf and soooo convenient. So, maybe the price was warranted. BEWARE though....parking is $45 + tax. I called before we ever arrived to inquire about it and was told that parking was no problem at all. Then the clerk told me the price. Woah!!! When we arrive at the valet stop, the valet told me that if we have AAA, the price would be $25. Cool. When we went to check out, the front desk clerk said that we could not have the discount because we did not make a reservation to park. WHAT??? I guess calling to inquire about parking while giving them our name and reservation dates didn't warrant the clerk to inform us that we should make a reservation for our car also. Trader Joe's is right around the corner and so is a Safeway. Made it nice for a morning breakfast with the kids. I would definately stay there again. But, next time, I will leave my car at home!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: 1dad1mom4girls
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of the Best Westen Tuscan Inn was nice, it was clean and nicely decorated. The Staff helped make our stay a great experience. Our request were promptly met, they made last minute reservations for us at a very popular restaurant on the wharf and had a cab waiting when we needed it. The rooms were decent size, clean and had all of the basic amenities. The wine hour was nice was a little crowded but it was pleasant to sit in front of the fireplace and visit with others with a complimentary glass of wine. For the cost of our stay I was a little dissapointed with the coffee and Biscotti in the AM but it was better than nothing. Access to the Wharf was a very easy walk from our hotel. We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kathieh724
Reviews.Content: very good hotel - great location, concierge extremely helpful, decor is nice and the maid service was excellent (room was cleaned by the time we got back from breakfast each morning). They have coffee in the morning and wine hour each evening in the lobby. The location is great, 2 blocks from FW and 5-6 blocks from really good italian food in North Beach and Chinatown is in that area as well. The only problem we had was on our last day; we were awoken at 6am by the banging on the roof (they were trying to fix the boiler or something) when I called the front desk all they could say was, sorry (we had stayed on the top floor). Also, if you have a rental car, do not park there, it's upwards of $40 per day (with taxes) - park around the block at a pay garage which i think the sign said was $14 max per day. I had asked for late check out of 130pm and that was not a problem. Also, take the shuttle to the airport which is only $15 per person as opposed to taxi which is $40 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: livinfortravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Tuscan Inn for a 4 night getaway for our anniversary. We loved the location as it was convenient to everything and a short walk to many attractions. The king room we had was lovely...and large. I was surprised by the size of it, because we've stayed in other hotel rooms in large cities and the rooms were always tiny. The bed was very comfy and the room itself was very clean. We were pleasantly surprised to find a complimentary bottle of champagne on ice when we arrived on our first night (our actual anniversary day). The only problem we had with the room was the noise level coming from the street. We were on the 2nd floor and facing the street and the noise was AWFUL. We were woken up once or twice by really rowdy passersby. The hotel can't control this, but there should be better windows or something to insulate the sound. We've stayed in large cities before and have never had this kind of problem. I'd stay at the Tuscan Inn again, but I'd request a room facing the courtyard. We missed the wine reception every evening we were there, but we did get coffee and biscotti every morning, which was nice. We had dinner in the restaurant once and it was very good. It got quite crowded as the evening progressed. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful...especially concierge. He was one of the better concierge staff I've encountered at a hotel. All in all, a great stay and I'd stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “4 nights no sleep”
Reviews.Author: cab57
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 10-14 October 07 and did not get a full night’s sleep in that time. The weekend nights were horrendous, we were kept awake for nearly 2 hours each night with the noise of what we assume were people leaving local clubs. As a result we were too tired to enjoy our visit to San Francisco and have decided never to go there again. I also found the room was much too small with a tiny closet and nowhere to store luggage, and the restaurant to be expensive, particularly when you share the very limited space with the bar and cannot enjoy your meal without noise. The only good thing about our stay in this hotel was the nightly wine reception but that certainly was not enough to make up for the down sides. My advice is if you like your sleep do not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location ; avoid restaurant would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: threespires
Reviews.Content: The travel agent booked this hotel and this was the only hotel out of 10 that I did not book myself although hotel sounded ok This was part of the deal for the airfares Location is excellent , Rooms Ok Staff variable some very helpful others not so . We stayed here for 5 nights and then 1 night later in our trip Problems (a) Given a smoking room when a non smoking room was asked were re allocated but it was a hassle (b) Came back one afternoon not only had the room be tidied but things had been put away which immediately led to the thoughts that stuff had been stolen but nothing was missing Complained and assistant manager very undestanding and gave us a voucher for a meal in their restaurant . (c) Restaurant very expensive and only ate there because of the voucher for 1 night staff arrogant also charged us for items we did not have felt very uncomfortable (d) On second stay room only had 1 shutter complained and comment was the problem had not been reported did get another room but it was more hassle especially as it did not get to hotel till 1 in the morning as there were delays on the train

Reviews.Title: “Great! Quiet Room #s Provided Here”
Reviews.Author: ita5724
Reviews.Content: Previously we stayed at the Sheraton across the street. The Tuscan Inn is markedly less expensive, and the location is identical. The room was clean and well decorated. No room darkening curtains (as others mentioned in their reviews) but the shutters do a good job for light and privacy. To get a quiet room, you need to ask for a Courtyard Room that doesn't face a brick wall. There are actually room (as others have mentioned) that literally face a brick wall. Otherwise, ask for the 4th floor. 439, 441, 443, 444, 045 face a good direction to the outside of the hotel. The rooms (on floors 2 & 3 also) that number 401, 402, 403, 405, 406, 408, 409, 412, 414, and 415 face out to the main street. You will hear street noise, garbage trucks, buses, etc. It's a Best Western - so it's not luxery, but it's a nice hotel in a great location at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location for Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: loseapoint
Reviews.Content: This is a very stylish hotel, a couple of hundred yards from the Wharf. We stayed for two nights and had requested a high floor on the front, which is exactly what we got - not that the view was very good but we did have a view of the water (but only just!). The room was well presented with modern fixtures and fittings in good working order. Staff were friendly and helpful and we enjoyed the complimentary wine tasting (1 hour) each evening. Coffee and biscuits were also priovided for 3 hours each morning. Only two negatives worth mentioning:- 1. The shower pressure was so low that it was a challenge to get wet all over!! 2. Valet parking is provided at $36/day which was, I thought, excessive. You could, for example, park across the street for only $10/day NB but this was only open until early evening, after which you would need to park on the street (which is free overnight). We ate both nights at Fisherman's Wharf - the first night at Alioti's and then at NIck's Lighthouse. Both were really good - Alioti's was more grand than Nick's with a view and prices to match but we thought we got value-for-money at each. I thought that, all in all, the Tuscan was an excellent hotel and I would happily recommend it to anyone visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Don't leave anything important in your room”
Reviews.Author: goodperson
Reviews.Content: The stay was great until the last day. We checked out. I forgot and expensive item. We went back to our room and it was gone. The room was not even changed over. A staff member must have gone in right after we checked out. The staff gave the typical run around. No help. It was terrible. We are still waiting for an answer. We recommend don't stay and if you do...don't leave or forget anything in your room that is important.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: missdeee
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Tuscan Inn in San Francisco in February of 2007 and loved every minute of it. The check in was quick and fast and the staff and nice concierge was very pleasurable. I couldn't have asked for anything better. Our room was quite small but for a family of four it was perfect. At night we had wonderful channel on our television and would not be bored after a late night out on town. Also every night at 5:00 they would have wine in the lobby which was very enjoyable. The Tuscan Inn is in the center of everything. Its just a quick walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Little Italy, China Town and everything else that San Francisco has to offer. It was perfect and I will definitly be going back. Even if you do not stay at this hotel there are many other delightful hotels nearby. San Francisco is a beauty of its own and you would not be spending a lot of time in the hotel anyway but if you want a good night sleep have it at the Tuscan Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Hotel room good also”
Reviews.Author: dc_irl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located near the Wharf and that is probably it's best selling point. The hotel itself is what you would expect from a Best Western - clean, comfortable with all the amenities. The room size was okay - we got 2 double bed, however, would have preferred a room with one king bed but they had none available. The restaurant next door was fine also - however, on the 2nd morning we went down for breakfast at 10.30 and they had stopped serving which I thought was a little early. Overall an average hotel in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hanfordmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights, there were six of us in three rooms. We all had the same great opinion of this property. Very clean and well maintained through-out. It was an easy walk to the bus stops and Fisherman's Wharf areas. There was a Trader Joes and Safeway within a block of the hotel to buy snacks and such. The adjacent Cafe Pescatero was handy for breakfast but had some hiccups in service, but it was okay overall. We would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: gozzerino
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Tuscan Inn over the weekend. It is a great hotel - clean and comfortable. We had a courtyard view, and there was NO noise at night. A lot of the people staying there were older and very quiet. I would DEFINITELY stay there again. It was a couple of blocks from the warf. The streets in San Fran were filthy and the homeless people were scary, but the hotel was wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tuscan Inn”
Reviews.Author: lisasully101
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tuscan Inn for our honeymoon and we can't say enough about how wonderful our stay was. We were complimentarily upgraded to the King Premier since we were on our honeymoon. The room was beautiful; the view wasn't the greatest, but we didn't care. I loved the view in the lobby as there was a lush garden in the window. The hotel offered complimentary wine tasting each evening which we enjoyed. The location was great as we were within walking distance to just about everything. The transportation systems were great and easy to use. The concierge's were extremely helpful and were very eager to assist us in anything we needed. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscan Inn 2 blocks from the Piers”
Reviews.Author: FNPMSN
Reviews.Content: Small enough, very personable. Very clean Small rooms, but have a couch, chair, desk, etc., w King bed, which was very comfortable w pillow top & pillows Very small 1 person closet, do not bring many clothes! Shutters nice. Lobby, downstairs restrooms & decor beautiful, flower courtyard nice. Restaurant/patio excellent food, high breakfast $, greast coffee. All the porters, etc., provide service like high end hotels. Walking distance, 2 blocks to the piers. Tuscan/botique theme nice. Housekeeping is quiet in the ams, not vacuming @ 0700, etc., Get in inside room facing courtyard if you are light sleeper as outside rooms face the streets. Will store your luggage in separate room on your check out day if you have late flight, want to spend more time, Oldest Italian restaurant in the country w/in walking distance, back east service, integrity, etc., Fiore d'Italia Wait until Monday to take the bay cruises if a holiday weekend Dantes best view for seafood lunch of the Bay bridge/bay Walgreens & Trader Joes w/in walking distance for we forgot... Walgreens has same souvenirs the airport shops do for 1/2 $ Do not rent a car, waste of time, money, & no parking! Split a fare w a private service i.e., Escalade etc., & for return to airport You can walk, take a cab, trolley, etc., we walked everywhere including up the hill to Coit Tower & then walked down just in time to attend 1300 service @ St. Peters Cathedral, beautiful! My first time to spend time in San Francisco, my husband's 3rd. He wants to re-locate there, desppite the real estate $$, taxes, etc., that is how nice it is...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: eyenurse
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel after a long flight from Florida. They were very efficient at the reservation desk and surprised us with an upgrade to a suite. The rooms seemed to have been recently renovated with updated decor. They were very comfortable and quite attractive. The bed was perfect as were the pillows. (I always carry travel down pillows, but didn't even unpack them.) The wine reception in the late afternoon is a nice extra. The bathroom was adequate with thick, fluffy towels. If I had any complaints, it would be that there could be a larger sink area to hold cosmetics. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: grotbags
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights,our room was on the fourth floor and adequately big enough for the three of us, my husband and adult daughter.The staff were friendly and helpful,it was a good base from which to explore San Francisco. We took an evening Alcatraz tour and a City tour with Shuttle tours which I would recommend if you have limited time in town.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: antnyp73
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the BW Tuscan Inn last week and I am so excited to write this review. From beginning to end it was a PERFECT experience. The staff was so friendly and helpful and the concierge service was very knowledgeable. The hotel itself was so beautiful and very boutique-like (don't let the Best Western in the name fool you). My room was clean and nicely decorated - the bed was EXTREMELY comfortable and also had a nice down comforter and comfy pillows. The bathroom was large and private. The room has an honor bar, which I didn't use, but DID use the refrigerator to store some of my own snacks and wine. Another great thing about the hotel is that every day, they offer wine and beer from 5-6pm for free for all hotel guests. We took advantage of the offer and many other guests did too. It is VERY nice. All in all, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff !”
Reviews.Author: Matty33
Reviews.Content: Excellent location 2 blocks from Fishermans Wharf and 1 block from cable car. Room on 4 th floor on roadside and heard no noise from anywhere. Room was nice , looked quite new and very clean and big enough for the 4 of us and our cases ! All staff very friendly and could not have been more helpful. Complimentary morning hot drinks were lovely and comlimentary wine around a log fire even better !! Make sure you bring warm clothes as it is chilly. Although there are plenty of cheap fleeces for sale.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel for a short getaway”
Reviews.Author: partonj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first 3 days of our honeymoon beofre getting some sun in Palm Springs. The room was lovely and clean with everything you need wether on business or pleasure. All the staff were extremely helpful and polite and always saying hi when eye contact was made. A good hotel in a good location for all the tourist attractions if you're walking, taxi or by bus. We ate at the hotel restaurant on our first night which was value for money. We would definately stay in this hotel again if we're ever in San Fran again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LaraH19
Reviews.Content: We booked on the recomendation of a friend who is particular with her accomodation, and the Tuscan Inn checked all the boxes for her, and so we decided to book directly with the property. We received a pleasant email from the Booking Manager, but never got to meet her to say thatnks for her prompt attention. Checkin was a no stress affair, and we were directed to our room with luggage arriving promptly. The room was not large, but then this was just a base for exploring all that San Francisco has to offer, and we did not need heaps of room to spead out in, just enough room to lay out our cases (4) and sit somewhere other than on the bed. The bathroom was very clean and well appointed with nice towels and toiletries, it was not big, but room enough to do what one needs to. The evening wine tasting was well patronized, and although we arrived just after the starting time, all the savouries were gone. A masseur was giving guests a massage at the same location, not sure if there was a charge involved for that service, as there was no information about that anywhere. The foyer was very cozy with the inviting fireplace and had large sofas and arm chairs and a bookcase full of interesting books, overlooking a courtyard garden filled with attractive landscaping. A consierge desk was also located in this area, and he was rather busy on the occasions he was there. We found the tourist advice to be slightly biased towards a particular company, and knew little about the sevices of other tour companies, even though one is very well know and patronized. There is a large tourist information stand near the lifts so you can peruse any of the brochures and make your own choice if he is not there or too busy. The hotel is conveniently located to the shopping centre across the road, and we made use of this to purchase our breakfast requirements, as we had not had great service from the adjoining cafe Pescatore for our evening meal and thought we would do our own thing each morning. The room has a coffee perculator and a supply of reasonable coffee was repenished daily. It is in an ideal situation to acess public transport, a short walk to the end of the street near the cruise pier is the trolley car, and another short walk the other way takes you to the cable cars. Pier 39 is close by and so are many other attractions such as the Maratime Museum, Ghiradelli Square, Fishermans Wharf, and many great vistas can be seen walking along the promenade down along the Embarcadero. I would have no hesitiation in recomending this establisment to my friends, and we would return here on any future visits to San Francisco, esp if we were cruising out of this port as it is very close to the cruise terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great experience!!”
Reviews.Author: StuAndNatty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our first visit to San Fran and the US. We'd read some ok reviews, bad reviews and great reviews so were a bit nervous but thought - what the hell, we won't be in it much anyway!!. We were very suprised when we got there - the location was great, just set back enough to miss the noise of the warf but within a stones throw of all the action. the food stores were near by too which was great for getting those much needed essentials. (Twinkies!!) We were there for 10 nights, the staff were very friendly and pleased to help. we were always greated with a smile by the valet guys too. The only bad thing is that they didn't reply to my girlfriend regarding a suprise birthday cake for me until we were at the checkout desk...Together!!! Oh well it's the thought that counts We did have a snoop around some of the other hotels and went to a few for breakfast, some were grander but by no means over shadowing the Tuscan Inn. Our room was both spacious, airy and light whilst being quiet at night. the room was always perfectly cleaned each day. The italian restaurant linked to the hotel was great, both for food and just popping in for a quick beer by the bar, very friendly!!! The only dissapointing thing is that we were so busy we missed the wine tasting - from the looks of the people who took part though, it's designed for the older generation!!! All in all a great place to stay, very comfortable and would definitely go back there and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “some disappointments”
Reviews.Author: DaveK3
Reviews.Content: We'd heard a lot of good things about the Tuscan Inn from people who'd stayed there for a night or two before cruising out of the port of San Francisco. Normally we'd stay at the SF Hilton, or one of the Marriott properties, but we decided this time to try something else. The Tuscan Inn room was quite nicely appointed, the bed was comfortable the chairs & TV adequate, the bathroom reasonably good. Street noise can be a problem in an outside room, though, and the window coverings (sliding Roman blinds that don't quite meet) left a lot to be desired if you don't want to get up with the sun. Housekeeping service was very inadequate, though. We left the room at 10:30 AM, placing the "please make up room" tag in the key slot. There were at least 4, and maybe 6, housekeeping carts between our room & the elevator. Yet when we returned at 3:30 the room hadn't been touched! The attached restaurant (Cafe Pescadore) is open for breakfast with a fairly skimpy menu - but quite good coffee. On balance, it was an OK place to stay but, perhaps, not to return to. It's fine if it's convenient to what you're doing in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, good location.”
Reviews.Author: ccmac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in early August before heading to the Tenaya Lodge in Yosemite. The hotel was clean and decorated nicely, and biscotti and coffee in the morning was nice. Staff was friendly. The rooms and the double beds were very small, both quite a bit smaller than the Tenaya. We had booked two connecting rooms since we were travelling with our boys, ages 11 & 15, and I called several days prior to arriving to remind them of our request. At check-in, they had our kids in a room at the end of the hallway, which we were not comfortable with. We took just one room for that night and they moved us to adjacent, though not connecting, rooms the next two nights. This was much better and gave us a lot more space. Beware, if you request adjoining rooms, they are not guaranteed and really not even planned. They told me they don't assign rooms until the day of check-in, and they were also overbooked. The Tuscan Inn is in a great location in Fishermen's Wharf and our boys really enjoyed Pier 39. I'm glad we stayed in FW instead of downtown - much more for kids to do there.

Reviews.Title: “Nearby the Wharf and Charming”
Reviews.Author: jph948
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan Inn is run by the Kimpton Hotel group and therefore a step above the typical Best Western. The hotel is very clean and modern. Our room was decorated with white wood shutters and accents of black and red. It was quaint and nice sized. The bed was comfortable and the views were overlooking the street and the bay, from our corner room. There was coffee and biscotti in the lobby daily. We also used the convenient shopping across the street to buy some bagels at Safeway which we stored in the bar refrigerator. Then we picked up the free lobby coffee and the WSJ and the USA Today newspapers, thus having a cheap breakfast. There's also a Trader Joes and Cost Plus just a block away. Pier 39 is about six blocks and the Wharf only two. We've stayed across the street at the Sheraton in the past, but this is our new favorite. Yes, being over the street can be a bit noisy but it was okay for sleeping. We travel a lot and this was a pleasant experience. I recommend it for families and couples alike. FYI: It was August and 63 degrees, so pack that sweater and jacket!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the wine in the afternoon”
Reviews.Author: NeedaSeaview
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers clean, well-kept rooms which are good value for money. Although breakfast isn't really included in the room rates, you can get tea / coffee / hot chocolate & biscotti in the reception / lounge area every morning. We particularly enjoyed the nightly 'manager's reception' when wine and nibbles are freely available! We were a little disappointed with the location of this hotel as although it is close to Fisherman's Wharf / Pier 39, it wasn't very busy in the nearby streets so we didn't feel like lingering in the restaurants before returning at night. The local restaurants are a bit cheap and cheerful, but if you are travelling as a family or are on a tight budget, there is sufficient choice. You have to brave the F-Market streetcar (which was often jam-packed) to get to Downtown San Francisco for more 'up-market' dining. However, it was very convenient for the ferry to Alcatraz (which you must book in advance of your visit) and for hiring bikes to go over the Golden Gate Bridge into Marin County. Overall, this hotel provides a good base, particularly if you are willing to get acquainted with San Francisco's extensive and varied public transport network.

Reviews.Title: “PA Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Zebra11
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! The staff was very helpful and the rooms were well apportioned. The rooms are a bit small for more than three adults. But, they were very clean and up to date. The location is excellent for access to the cable cars and the wharf. We enjoyed the morning coffee and evening wine in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Central and Clean”
Reviews.Author: babybuny
Reviews.Content: Very central for Wharf and walked to North Beach Area in about 10/15 mins. Had an outside room which was nice, request high floor room for less noise. The room was fairly quiet and adequate. Wharf is tacky, pier 39 smarter. Went to North Beach at night for italian restaurants. If you like garlic, The Stinking Rose is for you! Open top bus to Golden Gate bridge was great and book Alcatraz before you come on the official site or you may not get to it and may have to pay a lot more. Hotel restaurant is good and worth going to. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Laura Meith”
Reviews.Author: JamesBeaton
Reviews.Content: I was visiting from a three day layover flight from Boston, and I wanted to visit the wharf. I was recommended to the hotel from a dear friend of mine. The whole trip was ruined by the guest service of the hotel. They say they pride themselves on being the best in guest service but I was not impressed at all. During my stay I complained about a dent that was put in my rental car by a valet, and I was directed to speak with the Assistant General Manager Laura Meith. She was rude and insincere about repairing the damage done to my vehicle. I will never stay there again because of this incident.The valet parking was overpriced, the service was terrible, and the coffe was cold. Take my word for it, stay at the Hilton or the Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for San Francisco sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: mlbc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tuscan Inn for four nights at the end of July and found it a very enjoyable stay. To be honest, the hotel was just a base for exploring and we didn't spend a lot of time in the room however, the room was lovely. The staff were friendly and helpful. The morning tea/coffee/biscotti and afternoon wine reception was an added bonus. The hotel is central to transportation and a number of tourist areas particularly Alcatraz ferry and the Fisherman's wharf. It was great having so many fantastic restaurants close by - it made is difficult to choose. Overall, I was very happy with this hotel and would recommend it especially since it was reasonable priced.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Shikari
Reviews.Content: I stayed here based on the reviews I read on this site. I was not disappointed. We had a small suite. The linens and decor were lovely. Our room did overlook the street, so we did hear the street sounds. I've been to SF many times, and have just accepted when you stay down at the Wharf, you are going to hear street noises. We did take one person's recommendations to park in the lot just across the street. This saved us some money and we had access to our vehicle whenever we wanted it. At the hotel, it is valet only parking. We tried to have the wine/appetizers at night, but all nights we were there, it was always crowded. What we did sample was good, but it wasn't worth standing in line. The hotel is within short walking distance of a grocery store and Trader Joe's, so we picked up our own snacks. The rooms had DVD players. When we asked if they had DVD's to watch, they told me their one and only copy of the "Tuscan Sun" had been stolen, and they did not replace it. The location of this hotel is great if you are there to enjoy the tourist stuff of SF. The hotel staff was a hit and miss situation. Mostly, they were very nice, but occasionally we'd get a stressed out person. I would stay here again. Check for Internet deals and don't pay for their parking.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscan Inn a great location”
Reviews.Author: roadtrek
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our recent stay. Very close to all the public transportation to get to all the sites in the city. Reasonable price for the area. Staff was courteous and the wine hour each evening gave us a chance to meet many people from all over the world. Wish the morning coffee time would be extended for those of us who like to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Exploring San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Terrapin44
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Tuscan Inn at 1:00 AM and quickly checked in. We were exhausted from traveling from Boston. The room, (an inner courtyard room) while adequate, had a wall air condtioner which was very noisy. The next morning the hotel staff were very accomodating in changing our room and moving our belongings to an outside room which was not only larger, but had central air. Apparently the inner rooms have the wall units. The hotel staff was consistently friendly and helpful throughout our stay, especially Cliff, the consierge, providing directions, maps, dinner recommendations and reservations, and suggestions for sightseeing. The location is perfect to explore the city. Fisherman's Wharf (Pier 39) is a very short walk, the Embarcadero, Ferry to Alcatraz, Cable Cars, and Giardelli Square are all within walking distance.
