The hotel itself is conveniently located within walking distance of trolley and cable car routes as well as all the attractions on the wharf. Because of the exhorbitant $29 valet parking fee, we only rented a car for Sonoma and Napa for one day. Having purchased a City Pass for $42 each (which includes a week of unlimited mass transit, admission to Alcatraz as well as admission to sevral other museums in the city)we became well versed in getting around the town without a car. Back to the hotel...we loved the wine and beer reception between 5 and 6 every night as well as the coffee and biscotti in the morning. These receptions gave us a chance to pick the brains of the concierge and manager who made some excellent wine tasting recommendations (Artesa, Nicholson Ranch and Kunde Estates were great). Don't forget to tip them for their expertise. For excellent and reasonably priced seafood close to home, go to Scomas (expect at least a half hour wait as they don't take reservations). Also, treat yourself to clam chowder and cioppino in sourdough bread. Frisco beats every city in the world in the street food department (including NYC), so take advantage while you're there. Overall, TI is a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, friendly staff...where's the BUT?”
Reviews.Author: RugbyScrum
Reviews.Content: I agree with most that has been said about this hotel. It represents value for money, the rooms and bathrooms were impeccably clean, fresh linen daily, and the staff extremely helpful and friendly. Location cannot be faulted. Far enough from the glare of the wharf yet within easy walking distance and close to North Beach (for excellent Italian coffee houses and restaurants) and Chinatown. So where's the BUT? The rooms are noisy. The hotel itself is not affected by street-noise - it's fairly light and subsides by evening. The rooms are equipped with minibars and air-con. And here's the problem. I read other reviews about noisy air-con and thought "fool...switch it off". Well, even in the "off" position, the air-con emits an sporadic, intermittent hum and vibration, which, combined with the fridge resetting itself during the night conspire to deprive you of sleep. Earplugs didn't work. I asked to be moved after the first night, thinking this was unique to the particular room we had been assigned on arrival (454 - which faced a wall, by the way.) Staff were more than helpful and accommodating and we were were moved (to 403) overlooking the street. Same problem. Personally, I can live with street noise though I must say levels were not at all high, but the constant background electronic noise ruined a few nights' sleep. Until I discovered Napa Valley chardonnay. I'd recommend the hotel, but if you have noise sensitivity, look elsewhere. I had a great vacation. The room noise is the only think that would prevent me from returning to the Tuscan Inn. Otherwise, 10/10. We checked out the adjacent Holiday Inn Express - rooms of equivalent price and size but no mini-bar and, though air-conditioned, no persistent drone when in the "off" position - though request a room at the front - a streetcar line runs at the back and those drivers love to ring the bell!

Reviews.Title: “We stayed longer than planned!!”
Reviews.Author: Sally-from-NH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to a convention in town and only planned to stay at the hotel and in that area of San Francisco for 4 days. (even though our flight was for a week stay) We ended up extending our entire stay with the Tuscan. We loved the ease of running in and out of our room for pit stops. We joked about the rooms being sound proof since we never heard other guests and we slept great. We asked the staff to empty the refrigerator and snack bar so we could stock our own items, they did it easily and quickly. We ate breakfast nearly every morning at the attached restaurant. They have fantastic omelets, fresh fruit, real home fries etc...we didn't have a chance to try lunch or dinner there. We would love to go back to San Francisco and we would definitely stay at Best Western Tuscan again. We used public transportation for the first 4 days and rented a car for the last 3 days (we wanted to explore the outskirts of the city) Budget rental didn't have a fee for dropping the car off at the airport like some of the other companies (plus the car was nice/new). On bad notes of our vacation: we rented a 3 wheel go cart that made so much noise and the exhaust smell almost made us sick. 2nd bad note was we felt that the hotel was not helpful/knowledgeable in recommending restaurants. Make sure to have dinner from a city view restaurant at night (window view of course).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Valleygirl
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Tuscan Inn on my first visit to San Francisco, having researched the area using Tripadvisor, with a view to finding a good comfortable hotel at a good price. I was not disappointed. I visited with my friend. When we arrived at the hotel we had a warm greeting from the Desk Clerk, Mark, who gave us advice about getting the best from the area. He also suggested that we could have the mini-bar in the room cleared in order to store our own drinks and snacks (the hotel does not have a dining room, although there is an Italian restaurant where breakfasr and dinner can be obtained). I was very impressed with this and as there is a Safeway and a Trader Joe's nearby, this was very useful. The room was lovely, large by english standards, with two double beds, and supplied with an iron and an ironing board which were needed after all that flying! The room was stylish and clean. The bed linen was changed every day if you wanted, although there was the option of helping the environment by turning this down. There were plenty of thick towels in the bathroom, and all the usual toiletries, hair-dryer, etc. The free wine in the lounge each evening was very nice, and given with good grace - even the fourth glass! Coffee and hot chocolate were also available free from 6am each morning, although there was also a coffee maker in the room. The location of the hotel is excellent - only a few minutes walk from the cable car terminal and adjoined by a large Barnes and Noble bookstore with Starbucks for whiling away any spare moments! It is also only 5 minutes walk from Pier 39 and all the amenities there - lots of shops and restaurants. I found the staff to be helpful when required but unobtrusive otherwise. The only criticism I have is that there was no safe in the room, although safety deposit boxes were available free of charge in reception. I would recommend the hotel to anyone wanting a comfortable quiet stay in the city. If anyone has any questions please send me an e-mail, I'll try to help.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place For San Francisco Newbies”
Reviews.Author: enloop
Reviews.Content: Just back from four pleasant nights at the Tuscan Inn. Some folks might be put off by this hotel's Best Western affiliation. Don't be. This is a real hotel, not some plastic motel at an interstate exit. I'd recommend this property, especially to first-time San Francisco visitors. It's modern, clean, efficient, comfortable, and professionally run with courteous staff. On your second visit you might opt to stay a greater distance away from the tourist schlock of Fisherman's Wharf. (The hotel is about 2 blocks south of all the buzz on the Wharf, so don't worry about hordes of tourists lurking about.) Or, like me, if you've been to the city several times, you might choose to stay here because it is so close to transportation: A bus stop is right across the street; one cable car turnaround is literally around the corner and another is a few blocks away, and the Pier 41 ferries are a 5-minute walk away, as is a streetcar line. (You know all those warnings not to drive in SF? Pay attention! Don't Drive. You'll be having fun while some other poor sod is looking for a parking space that isn't there.) Although I didn't notice much of an authentic Tuscan note, my queen bed room was Europeanly small. Not cramped or inaccessible, just compact. (I had a glimpse at a king room, which was larger. More later.) The bed was comfortable, the closet and storage space was sufficient for one or two people traveling light, and the bath was not cramped. If there are two of you and several bags, plan on stacking most of the bags in a corner of the room. The room had a few annoying decorative items -- like a four-foot long round pillow carefully placed at the same location on the bed by the maid every day -- that seemed spawned by a marketing maven. Apparently, all the rooms are similarly afflicted. Oh yeah, if you don't like mirrors, go elsewhere. One entire wall is covered with mirrors. The restaurant on the premises is the Cafe Pescatore. Breakfast there was fine, but I ate elsewhere for lunch and dinner. The cafe is comfortable and service was attentive and polite. Plan on spending $15-$20 on breakfast. Room service at the hotel is limited: Breakfast items from the Cafe and lunch or dinner from a neighboring pizza joint, But, hey, this is San Francisco. Why are you eating in your room? The hotel provides complementary coffee and biscotti in the morning and hosts a winetasting in the late afternoon, If you forget something, a Walgreen's, a Safeway and a Trader Joe's are each about a block away. A large Barnes and Noble bookstore is even closer, if you're in need of caffeine and a book to read on the flight home. The rest of the immediate neighborhood seemed safe and nondescript, and largely free of the homeless and the street people that are in evidence elsewhere in this costly city. Other's have urged requesting an interior room overlooking the courtyard. They're right. Streets in the neighborhood carry a lot of traffic, and rooms on the streetside might be too noisy for your tastes. (This isn't unique. Traffic is heavy almost everywhere in SF.) I'd booked an interior courtyard room with a king bed, calling the day before I arrived to reiterate the request. However, I was given a streetside room and I could hear the noise before I unlocked the door. After complaining back at the desk, I was switched to a quiet queen room overlooking the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, warm, convienient!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tuscan in for three nights in November. It was our first trip to San Fransisco, and we couldn't have chosen a better spot for a getaway or for an introduction to the city. Right on the wharf and next to the trolley line, the hotel is quiet. The rooms are small but very clean, charmingly decorated with a view of the little flowered courtyard, comfy beds, plenty of pillows & towels and smiling service. Our favorite part of the stay were the fireside evenings with complementary wine & beer for hotel guests, where we met many friendly people from around the world. The whole atmosphere at the Tuscan is warm and comfortable. Morning coffee & biscotti was nice too. Unless you need to spend a lot of money or crave a swanky name, this is the best...an unpretentious little jewel!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the best value”
Reviews.Author: dsHonolulu
Reviews.Content: I visit San Francisco about twice a year. I try to get the best value for my stay and will always be willing to pay a bit more if I think it's worth it. Unfortunately this establishment falls a bit short. I really didn't get a chance to experience the staff's level of service but the rooms are small as is the bathroom. The room was clean and quiet. However, for the prices that this establishment charges, there are far better values like the Argonaut or right across the street, the Holiday Inn Express. One other thing, I took my family to the eating establishment connected to this hotel and the service there was TERRIBLE!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay when in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Aloha Ro
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tuscan Inn for two nights last week -- our second visit to the hotel. We arrived early and were pleasantly surprised that our room was ready: a king on the second floor -- clean, quiet, and nicely appointed. Upon checking out early Saturday morning (around 6:30 am), we discovered that the parking garage next door (where we left our rental car) would not be open until 7 - 7:30 -- too late to make our flight back to Hawaii. Quinn, the night auditor, came to our rescue. He volunteered to have someone get our car out of the garage and return it to the Hertz office a block or two from the hotel. While we were making these arrangements, the valet secured a shuttle service to get us to the airport on time. On our return home, there was a follow-up message from Sean, the assistant general manager, telling us that indeed the return had been made. Our stay at the Tuscan Inn was wonderful in every way, but for Quinn, the valets, and Sean to go the extra mile so we could make our flight was extraordinary! You can be sure that whenever we visit San Francisco we (and our rental car) will be staying at the Tuscan Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but small room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn as part of a vacation to the SF area. The main reason we chose this hotel was because of a referral from a friend and also the reviews found on TripAdvisor. It was an above average hotel, but I have to mark it down due to the size of the room. We had a king room and it was tiny! There was barely enough room to walk around the bed. The bathroom was also small; it was difficult to close the door once inside to avoid the door hitting you (no joke!). Other than the small room, the location was great and very close to all the attractions of Fisherman's Wharf. I thought the $29 per day parking was ridiculous, but I hear that's the standard in SF. We experienced no noise problems while staying here, but we had an inside courtyard room. The staff was not overly friendly nor helpful. The concierge, Daniel, was also not that much of a help. If you were simply asking for directions, suggestions, or general information, he acted a bit snooty. However, I witnessed other guests buying tour tickets through him, and he was much nicer. We were only around for the wine reception for one night, and it was much too crowded. It's a nice touch, but the lobby is not big enough to host such an event. All in all, we would stay again at the Tuscan Inn for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ustravlr
Reviews.Content: For those who've never been to San Francisco, The Tuscan Inn (near Fisherman's Wharf) is the perfect "first". We were near all the transportation modes (and there are plenty), shopping, entertainment, and restaurants. Our room was large and comfortable, and the staff was top-notch (especially Elmer). If you have a question, they have the answer or will get it for you. We were very pleased with The Tuscan Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Priced A Little High”
Reviews.Author: HappyH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a trip to San Francisco Sept. 22 - 24. The location is terrific - two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. We stayed there with another couple in 2 rooms. Upon arriving, there was a very long and confusing to do with the valet parking - we hadn't gotten our luggage out of th car and the valet wanted the keys. We were told to take our luggage out and wait for the concierge, who never showed up. There were about five other cars in the area - we were told if we needed the car, the valet would get when we needed it. There was a fee of $29 per day for the parking. We parked the car and never needed to take it out until we left. We checked in during the daily "wine tasting" the hotel provided. That left the small lobby loaded with people blocking the desk and walkways. The wine tasting is a great idea but the lobby is so small that the crowds block access. I was totally amazed that the other guests didn't budge out of the way so we could get to our rooms. Check in was quick. Our rooms were very small but beautifully decorated. We had no view - all we saw out the window was the back of another wing of the hotel. There was a mini-bar but it was locked and we did not have the key. There was a small refrigerator in the room. The furnishings were lovely. Some rooms had the bathroom sink outside the bathroom, which we would have preferred, but our sink was inside the bathroom. The bathroom was clean and bright and the toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, creams) were so good that we took the leftovers home because there was a website selling the shampoo listed on the bottle. The beds were comfortable, the shower was hot, the towels luxurious. There was an ice machine on our floor but the soda machine was out of order. There was a 7-11 convenience type store down the street so we simply got soda there while we were out. Our air conditioner was terribly loud our first night there. The second day we stopped at the desk and spoke to the friendly clerk who had it fixed for us when we came back that night. There is a moderately priced Italian restaurant in the hotel that we had a deceont dinner at, but there are so many restaurants on the Wharf we preferred to eat there. We found an IHOP around the corner for breakfast. It is a 2 block walk to the wharf and the location is very convenient. We also were within walking distance of the cable cars and even walked up to Lombard Street. We paid $169 per night. While the rooms were lovely for that price they were extremely small, but the location was just perfect. I'd recommend this hotel to others, but now that I have seen the area, might stay elsewhere if I could find a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Staying At The Tuscan”
Reviews.Author: jujubes10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the tuscan for 7 days and truly enjoyed ourselves. The front desk was very helpful as was the rest of the staff. The rooms were very nice, could of use just a little more shelf space by the bathroom sink. Loved the beds, very very comfortable. The location was perfect, we could go anywhere and still feel close. I would go back without a doubt. Thank you for making our stay very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - very good indeed”
Reviews.Author: UKtog
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long Transatlantic at wine hour and got a good feel about the place very quickly. The reception staff were struggling a bit and our check in was done wrong (only came to like when we tried to charge a meal to the room in Il Pescatore - lucky it did as someone else could have been given a key to our room) Next day, our room keys stoped working even though we were there for 2 days - again a check in error. Had it not been for these two issues I would have given this hotel an excellent rating. The staff were very pleasant, the concierge Daniel made excellent reservations for us and the bed was extremely comfortable. I would recommend an inside courtyard room as we had - so quiet - OK no view but who cares. It was nice to have a personal feel in this hotel rather than a chain activity

Reviews.Title: “The Tuscan did it again !!! A++++”
Reviews.Author: Poozella
Reviews.Content: We visited the Tuscan Inn this past weekend (Sept. 15-18) and had a fabulous time. I believe that this was our 4th trip back to the Tuscan Inn and I must say it is always a pleasure! It is in a great location, the staff is always alert and courteous, the rooms are clean, the morning coffee and biscotti are a nice touch, the happy hour is a PLUS, and the price is right !!!! We have recommended this hotel to others and will continue to do the same ….. The Staff gets an A+ -- The valet knew our names by the time we took our car out of the garage the first evening we were there … our remote needed a new battery Tony was there in minutes .. our room was equipped with a new thermostat … the engineer was there within minutes of our phone call to inform us of the change. It was a very pleasant experience …. Thank you ! side note .... It's amazing to hear all the TA folks out there sharing stories ... what a great way to gain infomation !!!!!! thanks for a great site !

Reviews.Title: “skip this dump”
Reviews.Author: Lernie
Reviews.Content: I planned a weekend getaway and thought because of the location and Hotel chain we would receive good service. Wrong. First the front desk snob was a rude welcome to SF. Valet parking attendant was no better. Waited 10 minutes for him to finish talking with 5 friends/relatives? before he could assist us. The morning front desk clerk was even worse than the nights. The hotel itself was a little tired looking and in need of remodel. I could excuse this if staff was friendly but I left there dissapointed. Didnt complain about treatment but thought I could share my experience here with you and definitely not ever return to this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn last weekend, and found it perfect for our needs. We were able to walk lots of great places, we did not take the cable car because the lines were so long, but it was easy to get to. It was very easy to find a cab when we needed one. The staff was very friendly, we had no issues at all with the front desk. The mini bar fridge was set too low - a bottle of beer actually exploded, and although we called housekeeping for some new towels no one ever arrived. I happened to go up to our room when the housekeeping staff was out in force - every single woman I passed said hello to me! I usually have trouble sleeping in hotels, but I was able to open the window (I need that street noise that others complain about!) and get some fresh air, and the bed was very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - and that's it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A complete disappointment - from losing the reservation made through Best Western toll-free number ("our computer crashed when receiving reservations from BW" - lame) to charging our credit card for someone elses stay 3 WEEKS AFTER WE LEFT! There appears to be no management actively involved with running this dump, cause when we asked to speak with one the front desk staff got very nervous and suddenly worked hard to find our lost reservation. Dont let the "free" wine and biscotti fool you. There is a Holiday Inn Express exactly one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: RichDe
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Tuscan. Nice, medium sized hotel in a good location. Walking distance to all Fishermans's Wharf attractions, cable cars, etc. Very good Italian resturant attached (forgot the name). Wine tastings each afteroon. The staff is friendly and helpful. The room is medium size, clean and comfortable. I SUGGEST YOU REQUEST A COURTYARD ROOM TO AVOID THE STREET NOISE. This IS a city!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: heads_up
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in terms of a walking distance to key Fisherman's Wharf attractions. From the Wharf area you can catch a trolley car or sightseeing bus to other parts of the City. Overall the hotel is great for the value. The lobby is large with a warm atmosphere and helpful concierge desk. The room we had was well furnished and clean, but it was small with no view; however, we were not paying a top rack rate and had no plans to spend much time in the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ratchet4
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise this hotel highly enough. We chose the hotel because of the reviews on this site and we weren't disappointed. The location of the hotel was fantastic it takes a couple of minutes to walk to pier 39 and is right next to the tram stop to take you into the main shopping areas. I really don't know where the "ghetto" was as mentioned in another review because I always felt perfectly safe. I think that SF has a problem with vagrants in general and they were not especially prevelant around the hotel. The reason that I liked this hotel so much was that it felt cosy and welcoming, the lobby had a log fire going constantly and all the staff were very friendly and helpful. The free beer, wine etc and snacks on an afternoon was a lovely touch and helped you swap tips and chat to other guests. The rooms were very nice - it wasn't the usual beige hotel room which made a nice change. The only thing wrong with the room was the bathroom, it was not up to the standard of the rest of the decor but it was clean and large enough. The restaurant that adjoins the hotel was excellent - the prices were reasonable and the food was very good. Just one tip... regardless of the hotel you stay in I would thoroughly recommend the bike hire that allows you to bike over the golden gate bridge. We spent a glorious morning exploring the bay area on our own and the bike paths made it very safe and easy to do.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: 42WWeber
Reviews.Content: On the 30th anniversary of our marriage my wife went on the internet and arranged a week in California. We flew from Philadelphia to San Francisco and arrived at the Tuscan Inn at Fisherman Warf in the early afternoon. The front desk treated us like royalty. Our room was tastefully decorated in white and yellow. It was so cheery and felt like a bed and breakfast room. We could walk everywhere and felt right at home when we returned in the evening. We would recommend this location for anyone who wanted to be close to all attractions. Don't hesitate, try it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: ronnyber
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn for one night in August 2005. I chose this property for its proximity to Fisherman's Wharf and the Blue and Gold Ferry to Alcatraz. It was an easy 5 minute walk to both of these as well as the Cable car line. Dinner in the hotel restaurant was excellent and the beds were very comfortable. I was also pleased with the wireless internet access. paid $161 plus tax along with a $20 parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brutus_Buckeye
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 10th wedding anniversary and were impressed. I had made arrangements for fruit/wine basket it was in our room along with a complimentary bottle of wine. The hotel room was elegant in its design. We were just a short distance to Fisherman's Warf and the tolley line. We also had a tour company right down the street and we took 3 tours through them - all terrific! We could also walk a couple of blocks to an IHOP. The restaurant in the hotel was expensive. The evening wine reception was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: TeacherMan
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the Tuscan Inn from August 1-8. I chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor customer reviews. We were very pleased with our choice. The location is perfect. Five minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf, and a short walk to cable cars, busses, and many great restaurants. Staff and concierge were very helpful. We had a courtyard room and it was very quiet. Weather was very cool at night and we slept with the window slightly open. Very comfortable for sleeping and we never used the air conditioning, even though we are from Michigan and keep it on in our home for most of the summer (like today, when it is 90 and humid). The coffee and biscotti offered in the morning is a good way to start the day, and the free wine hour from 5 to 6 is very pleasant, although we were so busy we only attended twice. I would definately return to the Tuscan.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay--Tuscan Inn”
Reviews.Author: AVacationer
Reviews.Content: My 18-yr old dtr and I just returned from staying 4 nights at the Tuscan Inn in San Francisco. We had never traveled there and booked the trip thru Priceline. Tuscan was wonderful! The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The rooms were also quiet and we felt safe. The location was great, just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. One day we got a day pass and took the cable cars and buses to view other parts of the city such as Chinatown, Golden Gate Park, Painted Ladies houses. The bus line we needed was just across the street and the cable car was a block away. Again, the location was great! The 5-6 pm complimentary wine hour was a nice feature. They did have soda for younger people, but ran out so my dtr didn't get anything to drink. In the morning there is complimentary tea, coffee, hot chocolate and biscotti. We arrived at the Oakland Airport and took BART to get to SanFrancisco and then the f-line muni to get to Fisherman's Wharf. It was ok, but it took a good hour to get to our motel. It cost about $8 per person to travel this way. We decided to take a shuttle back to the Oakland Airpost. There was a shuttle that advertised $23 for one person and $10 for additional people...so it cost $33 which was worth it. It only took about 20-25 minutes by shuttle to get back to the Oakland Airport. I'd definately stay at the Tuscan Inn again. Other places I'd recommend seeing include Alcatraz (audio tour), Muir Woods tour, and biking the Golden Gate bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal with lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: Lins94
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Tuscan Inn. After going back and forth trying to decide whether to stay at the more expensive Argonaut, we chose the Tusan Inn and were very happy with the choice. It is set back just far enough from the wharf area that you feel you can get away from the tourist madhouse, but close enough that in five minutes you can be at pier 39 or the cannery. The location was great! We were able to hop on the cable car right around the coner, we walked to Lombard Street, Coit Tower, the square, the marina, and the wharf many times. The rooms were celan and well kept. The bathroom was just okay, but for the price we survived. The staff of the hotel was very friendly and the evening cocktail hour was a great touch with many choices. We enjoyed a meal at the ajoining Pescatore's and found it to be affordable and delicious. The hotel is just across the way from Safeway, Trader Joe's, and Branes and Nobles. We were able to grab danish or donuts in the morning at Safeway which was a great way to save on money. I felt the hotel had a lot of charm and would highly recommend it for anyone staying in the wharf area.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived before check in and was told that two courtyard rooms were reserved for my party and available at 3:00 check in time. I returned at 3:40 and my rooms were not even ready. After waiting in the lounge area for 10-15 minutes, we were given our room keys. Upon entering our rooms, we see that our view was not of the courtyard, but of a brick wall. I called the desk and explained the situation. Their response was that there were no courtyard rooms available. Why they promise two rooms with a courtyard view, when they don't even have one to offer is beyond me. Our next disappointment was that we didn't even have towels. Again, I called housekeeping and their response was, yea we know! Their cavalier attitude gave one the impression that towels might not necessarily be one of the hotel's priorities. When the towels were finally delivered, I never got the correct number I requested. On the second night I left a note for housekeeping to provide 3 full sets of towels, again, I was shorted. When you pay for the extra third person, it's a bit discouraging to have to beg for the necessary accomodations. Complimentary wine was good, however, the second morning there was no hot water or coffee available in their lobby. I will say that the beds were comfortable and select staff were friendly, but definitely not enough incentive to try my luck again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Cannot imagine better in the Warf!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited San Francisco on a recent vacation and, under the advise of a trusted friend, decided to stay at the Best Western Tuscan Inn. I have stayed in many hotels, and could not imagine finding a better place. The room was inviting, the staff tremendously helpful and courteous, and the concierge was the best in the business. He led us to restaurants with views you couldn't find unless you were a local! I would highly recommend this hotel, and can't wait to visit it again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Decision to Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Due to the reviews on this sight, I recently stayed at the Tuscan Inn. This was a GREAT decision. I have never stayed at a Best Western before, but I think this is not your typical BW hotel! The lobby was decorated beautifully, giving you a feeling of being in a European hotel. Cocktail hour in the lobby with the fireplace burning was a delightful treat. They offered three styles of wine, Peroni beer, Pellegrino water, sodas, and a snack. Amazingly, with a 3-night stay, we made cocktail hour 3 times. You could chat with other guests, or just keep to yourselves; the atmosphere was warm and friendly. The complimentary coffee and biscotti in the morning was another hit. Their biggest challenge was keeping the coffee urns filled, as everyone seemed to enjoy the coffee. We ate at the attached Italian restaurant the first night due to exhaustion, and found it to be outstanding. This is not your typical spaghetti and meatball restaurant. The restaurant was decorated beautifully, the wait staff was professional without being snobby, the menu was creative and delicious. The tiramisu for dessert was one of the best I’ve ever had. I feared the room size because of the other reviews, but I think we got lucky and received one of their larger rooms. We requested 2 double beds for 3 women, and were expecting a closet-sized room. What we received was more than adequate. We were in the back of the hotel with a “view” of the inner courtyard, but it was quiet and we got a peaceful night’s sleep. Other guests on the street-side of the hotel were not as fortunate due to excessive street noise. The rooms were freshly and creatively decorated, and meticulously clean. The furnishings were bright and cheery (looked new), and having the one wall mirrored not only made the room feel larger, but with 3 women staying in the room, we never had to fight for mirror time. The goose-down duvets are another European touch. If I had to find one negative thing in the room (and I’m searching), it would be that the shower and toilet were in a separate room from the sink (good thing), but the light switch for the shower was tied into the same light at the sink. So, if one person wanted to shower and required the light on, it would also light up the sink area, which was in the bedroom area, hence, would disturb the other sleeping guests. The Concierge always had a friendly smile and was willing to help with any questions that came his way. The front desk and the housekeeping staff were equally as friendly. As far as parking is concerned, we were shell-shocked at what most of the hotels charge for parking—up to $40/night. The Tuscan is $29/night, but if you search for a package rate on their web site, you may get parking included in your room rate. Great value. Also, there is a public garage across the street from the hotel if you want to self-park. I don’t know what their rates are though. The hotel is in a great location; you can walk to anything in the Fisherman’s Wharf area. In fact, we even walked to Lombard Street one morning. Now that was a hike! And, conveniently, there is a Safeway and a drug store hidden in the parking garage across the street. Yes, hidden. We made several trips to the Safeway for more film, bottled water, etc. Very convenient. I highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again. Hope you enjoy your time their as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Bella! Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have travelled the world and stayed in hundreds of hotels in the US, Europe and Asia. This hotel ranks among the top. The service was excellent, the room was terrific, the bed was incredibly comfortable and the hotel is centrally located to all the major attractions of San Francisco. We particularly enjoyed the complimentary wine hour that the hotel features every day from five to six. We went on two day-long tours when in San Francisco including a day in the Napa/Sonoma valleys and the company we used is just down the block from the hotel so we didn't even have to wait for the pick-up bus. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dobre! dobre!-----great ! great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As the commercial for rice -a- roni states " A San Francico TREAT " ! The staff and faclilties were great !

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay near the wharf”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan Inn was a great place to stay when visiting Fisherman's Wharf and all that San Francisco has to offer. The entire staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. The concierge directed us to amazing restaurants and wonderful little establishments that we never would have found on our own. The accessibilty to the wharf was an attractive factor in where to stay without compromising on an elegant facility. The Tuscan Inn is a top-notch hotel and I will definitely return and also recommend highly to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Service From Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay, staff especially friendly, complimentary wine tasting a definite plus, rooms well appointed and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Tuscan Inn made our trip to San Francisco, as well as our dogs. We enjoyed our comfortable, clean room, as well as the excellent location. We felt very welcomed by the freindly staff that was able to help us with all of our questions and needs. Plus, our dog was very loved and welcomed by everyone! Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A NO WORRY VACATION.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: JULY 16TH-JULY 23RD 2005. MY husbandand I stayed at this wonderful place called THE TUSCAN INN FISHERMAN'S WHARF SAN FRANCISCO CALIFORNIA. I must say the place was wonderful by that I mean, the desk people were so helpful. The cleaning people did a great job of always making sure the place felt like home. My self I have a thing about sanitary conditions and fresh linens so that was very nice for us.The location was a nice surprise as the cable cars are around the corner, buses available easily.The staff has a wine get-to-gether for the patrons in the lobby every evening at 5-6 p.m. so if one chooses they can sit and relax and visit with other's.The hotel gave us the feeling like we were the only people that mattered, so you know they must make everyone feel like that.If I could have my children and our friends stay any where in that city it would most certainly be THE TUSCAN INN FISHERMANS WHARF.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Tuscan Inn on the recommendation of a friend who loved the place.We came to SF to celebrate Father's Day with our family. What great service. After flying from NYC we were very tired upon arrival. The front desk was quick and easy. once in our room we immediately showered. We phoned housekeeping for additional towels and they arrived before I hung up the telephone. Great free "coffee and" in the morning and a very pleasant afternoon complimentary wine. Extremely comfortable rooms, with minibar, TV, alarm clock, ironing board and iron, moring newspaper.We definitely appreciate the friends recommendation of this great hotel. We will be back next time we come to SF.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Each employee I encountered went out of their way to make my stay very enjoyable. I really enjoyed the wine hour...the masseuse they have in their lobby during this time is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: bche
Reviews.Content: What a great place. The staff was friendly and accomodating. The room was clean and comfortable. We loved the convenience of having a great restaurant right next door. Definitely a destination when in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Suprise for my wife”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very clean room, great location, wonderful service and dog friendly. My wife and I had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've had the opportunity to stay at the Tuscan Inn 3 times in the last year. Everytime we visit we enjoy it more and more. The personalized service always stands out and if we have a problem, it is immediately remedied. The last visit we arrived late and the front desk assisted my family in getting a late dinner from the attached restaurant, (which was very tasty). The location could not be any better. Just 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, the cable cars and convenient restaurants. We will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelDH
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long day's travelling from the UK and were delighted to find that the hotel exceeded our expectations. The room was very well appointed with quality furnishings and it was decorated in a classy and individual style, not what you normally expect from a chain hotel in a touristy location. It had more of a boutique hotel feel to it. After settling in and getting freshened up (great Tea Tree and Avacado shampoo by the way) we enjoyed the complimentary wine hour, where we were encouraged to sample all the varieties on offer. Suitably fortified, we set out on our first evening feeling very positive about the hotel, San Francisco and the world in general! The King size bed was longer and wider than the equivalent in the UK and extremely firm and comfortable - we're now shopping for a replacement at home using this as the benchmark. Morning coffee, tea and biscotti in the lobby was very convenient and as with the evening wine sessions, provided an oppurtunity to chat with other guests and swap tips on where to go and what to do. I'd seen a previous review recommending getting a room on the top floor in order to minimise traffic noise. We did and it was indeed very quiet (although the traffic didn't seem particularly heavy in the first place). All in all, an excellent stay over 4 nights and very good value for money. Great room, friendly staff, superb location - just a couple of blocks away from the hustle and bustle of Fisherman's Wharf and 2 minutes from the cable car turnaround that takes you straight to Union Square. We'll definitely stay there on our next visit to SF.

Reviews.Title: “had a blast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Francisco and we had a great time. The location of the Tuscan Inn is the best-right on Fishermans Wharf (2 blocks from the water). The staff is wonderful, they had knowledge of the city and the area and helped us in so many ways. We plan on another stay next year.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Fisherman's Wharf!”
Reviews.Author: sdhaughey
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at the Tuscan Inn and absolutely loved it! Our room with 2 double beds was beautiful. (Contrary to the comments of a previous reviewer, I never saw the rooms advertised anywhere as having 2 queen beds!) The room was not large, but was average size for a room in San Francisco. The staff was friendly, courteous, professional and knowledgeable. You cannot beat the location! You are walking distance to all of the Fisherman's Wharf attractions, as well as a quick cable car or street car ride to most points in the city. The evening wine hour is a great idea, allowing guests to mingle with each other while enjoying complimentary beverages! All in all I would say this was one of finest hotel stays I have ever experienced. I highly recommend the Tuscan Inn to anyone looking for a great visit to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “forget this place”
Reviews.Author: Cyn#1
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed here on July 9, 2005. Checked in at 4:00 p.m. and went to take showers (we'd been on the road since 4:15 a.m.) - there were not enough towels in the room for the three of us - though we paid for the three of us. We were told the towels would be sent right up - waited an hour, then called again, waited an hour, then called again and told not till after 9 p.m. because they ran out of towels. (They lied to us about it). What's up with that? We paid for a room with not enough towels? We had two double beds - and since I sleep with my husband at home on a double bed, I was amazed at how small these were - I measured to find them to be 5 inches shorter in width - so what you get is two large twins - with extra length, not width. Good luck sleeping with two people in one bed this small. False advertisement here...The heater/air conditioner unit is an arm's length from the bed, and it was so stuffy in the room, you had to have the unit on all the time - only it blew in your face when you tried to sleep...my nose burned. We didn't get much sleep with the paper thin walls. In the morning there was coffee and biscotti in the lobby - The biscotti is chopped into 1 inch pieces...whoopee. The location is good here, but that is all the good I can say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: WendyTex
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The location is fantastic - just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, and everything is nearby. There is a grocery store and a drug store across the street. From the hotel we walked to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 30, The Cannery, Ghirardelli Square, Coit Tower, Lombard Street, Chinatown, and many other locations. The staff is courteous and professional, and the concierge is very helpful. The hotel has a nice boutique feel to it, partly due to the lobby with fireplace, wine tasting every evening, and biscotti for breakfast. The rooms are extremely clean and have windows that actually open to the outside. We had a courtyard view of trees and flowers. Our room was furnished in tones of dark red and black, including a bolster pillow and shams. The hallways are clean and nicely lit to add to the boutique feel. The hotel is eco-friendly, which I liked. They only change your sheets and towels everyday if you request. If you don't want them changed, they still remake and clean the room. The towels were nice sized and thick, and there were plenty of them. The shower head was up pretty high which is great for tall travelers. There was also a curved curtain which allows you more room when showering. I especially liked the aromatherapy bath soap, lotion, shampoo, and conditioner. We got a great night's sleep due to the comfortable bed and quiet. We never heard a sound from other rooms besides the door next to ours opening and closing. If I searched to find anything wrong with the hotel, I could only say that one side of our toilet paper holder was loose. I can't recommend this hotel enough, and we will definitely stay there again when visiting San Francisco. I will also recommend it highly to everyone I know!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Batchyboo
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Arrived after a long journey and went to our room on the fourth floor. One of the smallest rooms in any Best Western I have stayed in. Decore was nice and clean, beds comfortable and we did have a fridge. However window was wide open and was broken. We asked at front desk and then said they would send someone up in 10 minutes, over 1 hour later no sign so we asked to move rooms. The concierge was useless - un-helpfull and a waste of time. Told us about a vegaterian restruant that had closed down years ago, a dry cleaners that was also shut. So we are in our new room, no double glazing and god could you here the traffic. Dumper trucks, buses etc all from 4am....not much sleep at all. Over rated and over priced. The only good hting was the location. It should be ashamed to call it's self a Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Why the high ratings for this place?”
Reviews.Author: KelleyfromOhio
Reviews.Content: Best Western website for this hotel advertised refrigerators in every room. Because of some special food needs, we booked this hotel with this understanding, plus it had received highest rating - best hotel in Wharf area. Were here July6-9 (still here...unfortunately....) Got to hotel, disappointed in the incredibly small rooms, but location is great. Website also said rooms had been recently redecorated - guess they forgot our 2 rooms - kind of shabby. Cheap furniture. Outdated outlets - couldn't plug cell phone chargers in except one place under desk. Hair dryer in bathroom constantly fell in sink from it's holder when anyone used the door to our room. Finally unplugged it and left it down on the TINY sink are space. Worst part was no fridges in room as advertised. They had quasi mini-bars in dorm-size fridges but we were told by front desk that we could not empty them out without being charged for the contents. We asked to speak to a manager, but after an hour of waiting no one came to talk to us about this. Wanted to get on with being tourists so we decided not to wait. Asked next morning - still told we couldn't empty them - offered to pull up website on our laptop which still showed that fridges came with rooms but they didn't want to see it - they just wanted to say that there rooms never had fridges and didn't know why BW advertised that they did. They told me I would have to wait for maids to come to take stuff out of fridge later in the day - like i'm really going to waste tourist time for this. I BEGGED them to be able to just remove the things myself and leave them on the desk - they said they'd have to talk to a manager - i said great when would they be in - they said they had no idea!!!!! Totally unwilling to help us in any way. WORST BW we've ever stayed in as far as service goes.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry - not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: smb0903
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the cosy reception with the open burning fireplace but that's where it stops. It was not worth the £115 ROOM ONLY per night that we paid for 4 nights - absolutely not ! ! ! ! If you want to stay in Fishermans Wharf stay at The Argonaut. Alcatraz is worth a visit but I would recommend booking as far in advance as you can and do the night tour which is fascinating. I wouldn't recommend this hotel - it really isn't great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the PRice”
Reviews.Author: NascarPhotog
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel(3 star) through Priceline while trying to get the Radison(2.5 star). We stayed at the Tuscan Inn the last week in June from Friday night until Monday morning. I reserved two rooms. We saved money by flying into Oakland International Airport. For those wondering, a cab ride from OIA is $53.00 We arrived very late, in fact Saturday am, and were greeted by Quinn who checked us in. Quinn was very friendly. During our stay, I spoke with both Quinn and Neal at the front desk, two valet attendants, and Daniel the Concierge. All were very friendly and courteous, and quickly answered every question that I asked. We never tried the restaurant in the hotel, as we had plenty of options in the blocks surrounding the hotel. The hotel is conveniently located, two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, and close to the cable cars, trolley stops, and the Blue and Gold fleet (Alcatraz tours). For $6 round trip you can take the nearby trolleys to China Town, Nob Hill, Union Station, and Powell Street. If you want to see the Golden Gate Bridge, you can rent bikes or two seater and four seater motorized vehicles from a few places within two or three blocks of the hotel. The bridge is about 3.5 miles from the hotel. You can walk to the Gold and Blue fleet for tours around the bay, to Angel and Alcatraz Islands, and to Muir Woods. Also, a Super Tours office is just a block or two up North Point. One morning as we were walking out, there was gentleman there who annouced to folks waiting in the lobby that he was with "Grayline Tours". The room we stayed in was a bit tight. It was actually two rooms, with a sofa bed, desk, coffee table, and television in the first room, and a bed, dresser, and television in a seperate room. The bath in our room was fine, not extraordinarily big, but not cramped either. It only had a shower. The only con was the limited space in the bedroom. There wasn't a lot of space for the luggage. However the bed was extremely confortable. Overall, I was happy with the room. The other room, reserved for my mother, was a single room, with much more space. She was very happy with her room. I will attempt to include a picture of her room. We stayed in three hotels on our trip to San Francisco and Las Vegas, and when it was all said and done, this was the hotel we all agreed was the best stay overall. Our other hotel stay in Las Vegas was the Holiday Inn Express a couple of blocks up the street. Prices being equal, I would recommend this hotel over the Holiday Inn Express for the beds alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lexi917
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tuscan Inn over Memorial Day weekend. It was great - very pretty, clean, nice staff, great wine hour every evening. The room was a little small but it was very nicely decorated and very clean. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: juxie
Reviews.Content: PROS The location is wonderful. Two short blocks to the cable cars, 1 block to the electrics trolleys and steps to the bus. We never used our car to explore the city. Pier 39, Fisherman’s Wharf, the Cannery and Ghirardelli all an easy walk (with kids). Our room was very quiet as well. It was nice not having to listen to cars and buses throughout the night or other guest. CONS We were initially given a smoking room although I requested nonsmoking and then the desk clerk argued with me that it was not a smoking room, but just on a smoking floor… there was an ashtray in the room. They did switch rooms eventually and even the bellhop thought it smelled horrid in the room. Small rooms, we could barely fit two adults and two children in the room. We also did not find them very kids friendly. There were only a couple of families with children there. The concierge was knowledgeable but it was like squeezing water out of a stone to get any information out of him. He also looked like you had interrupted him if you sat down to ask a question. Overall though, the location was great and the hotel was nice. I would consider staying there again if I returned without the children.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: yellowpony
Reviews.Content: The hotel was conveniently located 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. While this was an older hotel, it has been kept up well and the rooms were satisfactory. The morning Starbucks coffee in the lobby was a nice touch. I would not recommend the hotel resaurant. We ate breakfast there one day and were appalled at the slow service, rude waitstaff, and overpriced breakfast food. There are plenty of other places to eat within walking distance of the hotel. Overall, we would stay here again (just avoid the restaurant)!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from May 15-21 and was very impressed with the hotel. When I first got there my room wasn't ready yet since I was early so they held my bags and called me a cab and I went out sightseeing. When I came back my room still wasn't ready so I was upgraded to room with a king-sized bed at no extra charge. You can't beat that! The room was very nice, clean and well-decorated as was the whole hotel. The staff was friendly, courteous and always offering extra help even when I was checking out at 4am to catch a plane. I had breakfast and dinner a few times at the restaurant joined to the hotel, Cafe Pescatore, and thought the food and the service were both very good. You also can't beat the Tuscan Inn for location. It was close to Fisherman's Wharf with its great restaurants and views as well as several tour offices. I thoroughly enjoyed my week at the Tuscan Inn. I would definitely stay there again and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: mwano
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took two trips to San Fran in 2004 and stayed at the best western both times. The first was for a week in January. The hotel location was great. We flew in to San Fran airport, took the BART downtown, and then took a cable car to a stop 1 block from the hotel. We didnt have or need a car so we didnt have to deal with parking a car I believe it is $30 a day-- par for the city. The hotel is clean and neat, our room was clean and comfortable. If I had to be critical the room could use a little updateing, but not a big deal. The front desk was friendly, however not terribly knowledgeable--I would assume high turnover. The location is great, if your an active person you can walk everywhere from this hotel, in fact we took a long run up the shore --crissy field and accross the golden gate bridge. North Beach starts a block away and heads north, we skipped the touristy fishermans warf area. Restaurants are everywhere, however we did not eat at the Tuscan restaurant in the hotel. As far as convenience--the cable car stop is 1 block away and that along with the outstanding bus system will get you everywhere you need to go. We plan on visiting the city often, and we plan on staying at this location for the foreseeable future.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms,location & service”
Reviews.Author: mrstuckey
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent the day in San Fran. We stopped there before our week long trip to Napa. It was wonderful. The rooms were great and the Service wonderful. They did have a Wine/Beer serving at 5pm which was nice. It is located 2 blocks from the wharf which was outstanding considering parking is hard to come by. The only complaint I have is the Valet service. Not that it was horribly but the pull in nook is not very big. We waited about 10 mins before being helped but we were on vacation, So what's the hurry, right??! Enjoy your stay. We did!

Reviews.Title: “great location and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: soccermom327
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Tuscan Inn April 20-25 in two connecting rooms. The reasonable price of the hotel allowed us to book 2 rooms, thus giving the 4 of us a bit more space and 2 bathrooms (with teenage girls, this is important). As others have said, the beds are wonderful. Plenty of room in the bathroom. The air conditioning unit in one room was noisy, but nothing terrible. The concierge was helpful, and the Happy Hour by the fireplace was a bonus. Now that this is a Kimpton Hotel, I expect that it will be upgraded a bit in the near future and will feel like less of a Best Western. The location is perfect for walking to most attractions. We visited Alcatraz, Coit Tower, Cable Car museum, Lombard Street, Muir Woods and Sausalito. We ate dinner in the hotel restaraunt 3 times, mainly because we were exhausted at night, and enjoyed the food. We discovered a fabulous restaurant in Chinatown - Hunans Home - 622 Jackson Street. I highly recommend it. And reasonable, compared to other restaurants we visited. Although we come from a big city ourselves, we had three negative observations of SF: expensive, dirty and far more homeless people than we've ever seen in Phila. That's not to say that we won't return - just be prepared, especially if you bring children.

Reviews.Title: “such nice folks”
Reviews.Author: goodgirlIllinois
Reviews.Content: After much research of hotels in which to stay in SF prior to a cruise, I finally decided on the Best Western Tuscan Inn near Fishermans wharf. It was nice, the folks there very helpful--letting us check in early without so much as a frown--polite and eager to help in any way. I would love to go back and stay again--this time a little longer. It's easy to catch a taxi to anywhere you want to go, and the bellman was very helpful. The beds were comfortable with nice down comforters. The food was good at the resteraunt also. A good place to start a cruise!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MCLScituateMA
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the Tuscan Inn and have nothing but rave reviews for this hotel! The location was perfect. Walking distance to Cable Cars,Wharf, Bus 47 and F Line. Great restaurant with a friendly staff. Everyone was pleasant and very helpful. Nice clean rooms and a spacious bathroom. We are anxious to return! Mary and Jack from Scituate MA

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DDMOttawa
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel. It is about a 5 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Good base for exploring local sights. Generally very quiet hotel. Wine at 5 pm was a nice treat. Room was slightly bigger than a typical room. While I have no substantive complaints about this hotel, areas for improvement include: $29/day to park a car seems like a lot to me. The plumbing was a bit noisy. Otherwise, a pleasant place to stay in a good part of SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in June 2004 and were not disappointed After reading reviews decided to stay. Reviews were correct. We found the staff friendly and the drinks in the evening an added bonus. Central to everywhere and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Jerks”
Reviews.Author: atmo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I always try to get away on the anniversary of our only child's death, March 31st. I had read about the Tuscan Inn and booked it well in advance for our arrival. It sounded like a great place to be for the occasion. We took a train from Santa Barbara, and I knew we were going to arrive quite late. I was looking forward to the assurance of our lovely room awaiting us. As it turned out, we arrived at around 3:00 A. M. totally exhausted. We were supposed to have arrived around 10 P.M. But I had guaranteed with my credit card, so I knew we could just get there and go to sleep. Well we arrived and THEY HAD SOLD OUR ROOM! I was totally shocked. The snide, sadistic clerk at the desk was completely unapologetic and sarcastic. QUINN. He said he found us another room that was like the one we'd reserved non-smoking King. We also always look for free wi-fi. We were taken to another hotel where the room was totally reeking of cigarettes, because it was a smoking room, and 2 twin beds. By then it was almost 4:00 A.M. Internet access was not free. I was so upset and angry, and that desk clerk is nothing but a black hole for Best Western's public relations. There was no" MISTAKE"-there was no "MISUNDERSTANDING"But there was an abundance of ill will and greed. If a late arrival guarantee has NO meaning, and is not honored by the hotel, than how can I trust their hospitality code? I have NEVER had such a crappy experience at a hotel. I really feel that he sized us up and decided to try to wield power, because there was nothing we could do. I will tell all my friends about this, and we are not, despite Quinn's assessment of our social status, a bunch of unsophisticated hillbillies. This was way below terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Bergs
Reviews.Content: Big, clean comfortable room and a great location. Free wireless internet in the room - fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “I Don't often give compliments”
Reviews.Author: caniscorpus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights in March 2005. We had a room facing into the Courtyard. Quiet and well designed. Best feature was the freebie drinks in reception from 5-6pm. We met couples from all parts of the world and had interesting chats over several glasses of wine. Don't bother with the Italian style cafe attached to the hotel. The best and nearest breakfast is at Wharf Inn on Beach St, a block away (Chinese run). Another English couple we know has stayed here since our departure and they too confirm our opinion that this is a lovely hotel, well situated for all the delights of Fishermans Wharf

Reviews.Title: “Everything appeared okay”
Reviews.Author: Tellte
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently. Everything went well. I really liked the place. The hotel had been pre booked so on check out I had nothing else to pay. However, when I returned home, I discovered the hotel had charged my credit card $1.63 without my knowledge the day after check out. It is only a small sum of money but I was very concerned as I had not stolen anything from the hotel or used any of the stuff in the bedroom bar! The hotel now claims however that "items were removed". The only others with access to this food and drink were the cleaning staff. I suggest to anyone staying here to make sure they know what is being taken out of their credit card before they leave this hotel. I am a very honest person who has stayed in many hotels over Europe and America and I have never before experienced an insult like this. My credit card company are supportive and refunded my money but be aware. There could have been a lot more money involved. All I have is my word that I removed no items!

Reviews.Title: “Spent three nights last week”
Reviews.Author: ecwc54
Reviews.Content: We had an inside room, facing onto the courtyard. The room was small, but it was mostly due to the king-sized bed and some rather large pieces of furniture that were in the room. The bed was really comfortable. The staff was very friendly and attentive. We drove, so that was a disadvantage as we chose to valet our car for the unlimited "in and out" privileges. I thought it was pretty pricey at $29.00 per night plus tax. The best feature of this hotel is location, location, location. We loved that we could easily stroll all of Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 and North Beach. We'll likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned”
Reviews.Author: Travelingtoo
Reviews.Content: I will be back! I have been staying in San Fran for a while as i visit my college aged son. This hotel is the first i have felt totally comfortable in. The staff is friendly and the hotel itself is not what it appears from the outside. The Kimpton Group has taken it over and i believe, have given it a shakedown.....down comforters......gorgeous lobby and friendy restaurant and lounge. The food at the "Cafe" is quite "hotel-like" but the service makes up for it.....plus SF is a food town! So many other places to explore other than your hotel! This place geets major reccomendations from me. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and brilliant location near Fishermans Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Valjf5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western Fishermans Wharf Hotel in June 2005 and really loved everything about it. A warm welcome on arrival and a nice suite although the rooms were quite compact, however I understand this is common in Fishermans Wharf . Our suite was located on the inner courtyard of the Hotel and lovely and quiet away from any possible traffic noise. Can highly recommend the Restaurant attached to the Hotel for both breakfast and dinner. All in all a great Hotel to stay in at a reasonable cost close to all the action on Fishermans Wharf. Free internet use in the reception area was a great touch.

Reviews.Title: “The good outweighed the bad”
Reviews.Author: Warneringyou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights here in January 2005. I believe this is a pet friendly motel, which would account for the overwhelming smell of animal urine which nearly knocked us over every time we entered our room! The motel was full being over New Years, so we were not able to be moved to another room. Apart from that, the staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms were nicely decorated, and the beds were very comfortable. There is also internet access for a fee in the main lobby. We would probably stay here again, as the location is also good.

Reviews.Title: “a great 5 days”
Reviews.Author: sjr27
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a several days in san francisco and want to be on record regarding the tuscan inn, a very comfortable and welcoming kimpton hotel at fisherman's wharf. the rooms are very clean and are charmingly appointed; the staff could not be friendlier, and they knock themselves out to make guests feel welcome. the daily wine hour at 5:00pm is a warm way to end the day and ease into the evening. this hotel is a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic San Fran !!”
Reviews.Author: rogerrab
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks (which I gather is quite a long time!!!) at the Tuscan Inn in Sept 04 & had a great time.The hotel was lovely - really clean with friendly helpful staff & fantastically situated in between North Beach & Fishermans Wharf. We had a room facing the inner courtyard on the first floor & found it both quiet & very comfortable.We really could not find any fault with either the hotel or San francisco at all, & would not hesitate to stay there again. ps....do not miss Alcatraz - book in advance !!!

Reviews.Title: “A Bargain Hotel With Class”
Reviews.Author: honu-lover
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Best Western Tuscan Inn, Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco the week before Christmas. I booked the room through Expedia, and because of this, the hotel wouldn't credit my Best Western Gold Card with either points or air miles. The price was great for a small but comfortable room. We did have a room on the 3rd floor over the sidewalk and street of North Point. The windows are crank operated, and thin, so there was some street noise from city buses from about 5:30 in the morning until about 10 at night. We are heavy sleepers and it didn't really bother us, as it seems to have bothered other reviewers. The hotel is an Italian mediterrean theme everywhere, entrance, lobby, garden courtyard, restaurant, and rooms. The staff are 100% present and attentive to your every need. Their friendliness reminded me very much of the Aloha spirit at Hawai`ian resorts and hotels. The lobby is small and cozy with a gas log fireplace, perfect for taking away the chill after those cool, foggy walks down to the waterfront. Guests actually talk to one another during morning coffee, and the free hour of wine at 5 pm. I highly recommend this hotel, for both quality and economy. We bought some of our food at one of the 3 grocery stores a block from the hotel. I'ts about 2 blocks to Fisherman's Wharf, 2 blocks to the cable car turn-around, 1 block to the F-Line trolley car, and 3 blocks to Pier 39. I liked to start and end my day walking out to the sea lions on the K pier at Pier 39. I also took the Blue and Gold ferry out to Alcatraz, and suggest everyone visiting S.F. see this sight for both the ferry boat ride, and for the rich history lesson. Another of my day trips was to rent a car and drive down to Monterrey Bay.

Reviews.Title: “top marks for the tuscan”
Reviews.Author: allancabbie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great staff, great location not any problems what so ever. Keep up the good work!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and well managed”
Reviews.Author: Mike Swindley
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in October. The hotel is very conveniently situated for the piers. The whole place gave the impression of being well managed. The staff were helpful and attentive, the rooms were quite spacious and the whole place looked as if it was cared for. We had rooms that opened onto the garden and they were quiet. In any event the adjoining streets were not too busy. The rates were reasonable and we will certainly stay again when we return to SF.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: fortunakim
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location with a stick, but the "suite" was awfully small. The thermostat gave us a choice of baste or chill until frosty. At $80-100 this is a 4 star but at $150 a night I was looking for a little more.

Reviews.Title: “this is the place”
Reviews.Author: whatayanuts
Reviews.Content: the tuscan inn was a great place to spend a week since it is located away from the noise and action of the wharf but also close to the cable cars to travel around the city. our early flight arrival actually let us into the room before check in which was the first of many pluses of this hotel. the hotel has a wine hour each day which is a great way to relax after a day of touring and also meet others. friendly service was evident each day and the gentleman conceirge was patient and helpful. there is a grocery store right around the corner which was nice to grab some juice and pastry rather than a full scale breakfast. i could not recommend this place more and will return to the tuscan on my next vacation to california.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the Tuscan Inn. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Coffee in the morning was great. "Happy hour" from 5-6 was a great touch. We enjoyed drinking wine and meeting some of the other guests. Very close to Fishermans Wharf. Basically 2 blocks or so to the water. The only minor downside, as a few others have mentioned, is the bathroom/sink lighting. Room is a little small, but was totally fine for two people with two full sized suit cases. We will stay at this same hotel the next time we are in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Penney1000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel October 29th to November 2nd, 2004. I booked the hotel because it was recommended by Frommer's travel guide. I also looked at the reviews on tripadvisor and that also helped me make my final decision. Our room was average sized, I especially liked the fact that it had a couple of chairs and a table. I hate watching TV in bed (it is tough with bifocals). The beds were the most comfortable beds I think I have ever slept in, I don't know if the mattresses were new, but they were great. They also have these down comforters on the bed and several down pillows per bed, it was so hard to get up in the morning. I actually looked forward to getting back in the bed. The room had everything we needed, bar, refrigerator, big TV, shampoo and supplies, hair dryer, ironing board and iron, an umbrella and extra pillows. It also has a keyboard for wireless internet (extra fee). I also requested a courtyard view room and that kept down the noise (although we were up early everyday anyway). In the lobby they have free coffee, tea and biscotti everyday and have wine and snacks from 5 p to 6 p daily. There are newspapers at the desk for everyone. We ate at the adjoining restaurant once - I was not impressed. The hotel was centrally located to all the attractions, only 2 blocks from the wharf. That was so nice. And there were a lot of restaurants around, and a lot of souvenier shops. Pier 39 is there and we spent a lot of time watching the sea lions (so did everyone else). All in all we enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone and we would certainly stay there again. The staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: TheBaron
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in San Francisco at the Tuscan Inn and thought I would give my views on an excellent stay. Had picked this hotel on reviews on this site and a couple of others and I was pleased with my choice. The room itself was medium size - we were on the 4th floor which was nice and quiet , the chiller was useful and the bed most comfortable - surprising for a hotel. The location is 1st class , a few minutes from the Wharf and all its attractions , and close to a Safeways Supermarket ( open 7 to 12 pm ) and handily placed for buses , trams and cable cars. The staff seemed pleasant and efficient whenever I had dealings with them , indeed the only quibble I had was that the bell boys at the front were a little undermanned on occasions but I will not let this alter my view of the hotel overall. Don't miss the complimentary drinks and give the Prescatore a visit as it is good value. If you want some breakfast off site then I would recommend the IHOP nearby , although it gets busy at the weekends so you may have to wait. My final thought - 1 recurring image during this week ( 1 Nov - 7 Nov ) was the staff demonstarations outside a number of prominent hotels , many were day long vigils and many were noisy - the good news was that the Tuscan was not 1 of them !

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tuscan Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Tuscan Inn four nights, from October 16 through the 19th, 2004. The room was small but very clean and nicely decorated. There were sliding shutters and two windows which could be opened for fresh air. The location is perfect for the first-time visitor and Fisherman's Wharf has a lot of nice things to do and places to eat. Transportation is very close by and we rode cable cars, streetcars and buses anywhere we wanted to go, from Little Italy to the Golden Gate Bridge. The concierge even gave us a pair of City Passes someone had turned in with four more days still on them, so we rode everywhere for free. The staff was friendly and the coffee & biscotti snack in the morning and the wine in late afternoon were both very nice. The lobby is calm and looks out on potted flowers in a small courtyard. Soft Italian music played in the lobby and it was very pleasant. The concierge can arrange many different tours and provided maps to help us get around the city. We rented a car from Budget, which was just a block away and very convenient. I would definitely go back to the Tuscan Inn and can easily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Easily Accessible to Wharf”
Reviews.Author: patty0240
Reviews.Content: Close proximity to Fisherman's Wharf. Room on the small side but nicely decorated with extremely comfortable bed. Did not like the bathroom light shining into bedroom (no door in alcove). Staff accommodating and friendly. Enjoyed morning coffee and 5:00 p.m. cocktail hour.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Close”
Reviews.Author: OlPO
Reviews.Content: At the Tuscan with another couple 9/17 and 9/18. Went there because of positive TripAdvisor commentary and was not disappointed. Rooms were a bit small but very clean and nicely maintained. Beds were firm--which I like. Took the advice of other past guests and asked for 4th floor rooms which were very quiet. Location is perfect for Fisherman's Wharf and adjoining areas. The price:quality ratio was excellent. Staff was friendly and the vino hour in the evening was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Robbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and would definately recommend the hotel. Check-in can get busy although we got lucky and only queued for a couple of minutes. Check-in clerk wasn't particularly friendly as he was busy but he was polite. The room was a good size and the location, being just a couple of blocks from the Wharf was excellent. The afternoon wine/beer was a great idea, as was the free morning tea/cofee.
